items.title: Filestage: Product Designer
items.content:
Product Designer

About Us

At Filestage we believe that broken workflows poison teams with miscommunication, friction, and frustration. Our mission is to fuel creative teams with a rock-solid workflow. With our software, we empower people to produce great results together and build healthy and meaningful relationships at work.  



Over 500 companies (and growing!) all over the world like Lufthansa, Canadian Tire or Rabobank benefit from happier and more productive employees with Filestage.  We work hard to build great things together—and make time to celebrate our accomplishments.



Your mission

  • You play a key role in defining and building the future of our product. This is an opportunity to have a big impact and to shape how we simplify the daily work-life of thousands of professionals.



  • You drive product solutions that service the goals of both the users and the company. You’re collaborating closely with product and engineering teammates to work on the strategy and execution of features.



  • You create an outstanding user experience for product improvements. You conduct user research, design user flows, create visual designs, and measure the success of your improvements.



  • You run product experiments in cross-functional squads to achieve business, product and user goals.



  • You build strong relationships with our community of passionate customers to dive deep into their pain points, needs and use cases.




You’re good at

  • You have a holistic understanding of product design. You have more than 3 years of professional experience in product or UX design and can't wait to learn more.



  • You work well with lots of questions and few answers. No problem is too big or too hard. You take ownership and are able to bring things to completion in strong collaboration with your teammates.



  • You’re hungry to learn and strive to continuously improve, iterate, and integrate what you learn. 



  • You’re a strong communicator and have experience collaborating with a distributed team.



  • You have empathy and resilience. You have empathy for our customers, to build a product they’ll love. You have empathy for our coworkers, to build a workplace we’ll love. And resilience to be able to take feedback from anywhere, consider it gracefully, and fold it into your thinking and your work.




This is what you get

  • Work from where you are happiest and enjoy a flexible day schedule. We are a fully distributed team,  working from different locations and time zones, each individual following their personal daily schedule.



  • Work with teammates across the world. At Filestage, you broaden your horizons and build relationships with teammates around the world.



  • We meet up in real life. We all travel together at least once a year at our team retreat to have fun and get to know each other.



  • We build and maintain a strong team culture. Our working culture is based on our three core values: We are keen to learn, We take ownership and We play fair.



  • Your opinion matters. We trust our team members to make the best decisions to achieve their goals. We don’t micromanage.



  • You learn and grow continuously by solving complex problems together with highly talented minds.



  • Are you tired of useless meetings and slow decision making? We have flat hierarchies, no bullshit meetings and iterate quickly.

items.title: Senior Product Psychologist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Product Psychologist - London


 


Who are we?


We're an innovative and fast-growing psychometric tech business; our solutions combine neuroscience, artificial intelligence and game technology that aim to disrupt the candidate selection process. We process large amounts of data from the behavioural assessments we develop and then put it all through our analytics engines to derive insights into personality traits and behaviours. As a company, we believe technology will underpin everything we do in the future and our goal.


 


What we are looking for:


We're looking for a Senior Product Psychologist to join our London team based in our brand-new WeWork offices.


 


This role will involve you taking the lead and ownership of the product streams, relating to the use of our assessment, while working closely with our Chief Scientist and the wider science team.


 


We are looking for someone who will drive the delivery of our projects while adhering to the best practises set by our very own Science Team. You will be required to review and develop reports and communications, ensuring an efficient generation and use of norms, developing and training on best practice guidelines to enable consistency of use of our product across the company.


 


What your days will look like:



  • Developing an Arctic Shores competency framework that adheres to best practice recommendations.

  • Manage our off-the-shelf product offerings.

  • Overseeing the generation of norm groups and ensuring this is to a high standard.

  • Collaborating with members of the Arctic Shores team to ensure consistency in the use of the product across the company.

  • Designing and overseeing the development of reports and communications to clients and candidates.

  • Contributing to the growth of Arctic Shores’ platform in the marketplace through responsibility and ownership over the quality and delivery of the product.


 


The must haves:



  • MSc or equivalent in Organisational/Occupational Psychology

  • Strong statistical analysis skills using R

  • 5+ years’ experience in related field

  • 2-3 years of product/psychometric assessment development

  • Knowledge of psychometric standards and auditing processes

  • Experience of developing a competency framework


 


The nice to haves:



  • Understanding client needs and experience in adapting products accordingly

  • Level A and B trained


 


Here's what we offer:



  • A community-driven and relaxed work culture, which you'll fit right into. Part of this includes a regular games night and social events.

  • A chance to work with a standout and disruptive product, that's shaping the HR market and candidate experience.

  • A voice in your team where you can be heard and have a direct influence on how we create our products.

  • Working hours that are flexible to life outside of work.

  • A central location that's easy to commute to. 

  • Flexibility to work from home on a weekly basis.

  • 2 mental wellbeing days.

  • 25 days annual leave + bank holidays.

  • A dynamic working office in WeWork, where you can shut out the world with your headphones on or revel in the cosy co-working spaces.

  • Free breakfast on Mondays, onsite barista and bar, and weekly events and talks where you can learn from other local businesses.


 


Equal Opportunities


At Arctic Shores, giving people a fair chance is what we do, that's why we take equal opportunities seriously. We welcome people of any background, gender identification, race, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, ability-level, age, size, marital status, style or music taste!


 


If we sound like the kind of place you’d like to work, apply below or get in touch with Liam, he's our Research Manager at liam.close@arcticshores.com.

items.content:
About Raver Fans


www.raverfans.com


Raver Fans is the new and interactive social media platform for Brands to connect with their loyal fans. Evangelism marketing (word of mouth) is the most effective and cost-effective form of marketing strategy that is being underestimated by brands. We are simply providing a platform for brands to have more engagement with their fans, solve their problems and turn them into Raving Fans who will self-promote for them. Social media marketing is now a hot space where brands are always looking for brilliant innovative ventures.


 


We want to bring word of mouth on a larger scale. The platform consists of an app for fans to download and follow their favourite brands who will be signed on the web. They then share their experiences with the brand and the world for rewards. We are young, fresh and we believe the future of social networking is us


Backed by a pre seed investor, we have managed to develop and test all the platforms


 


We’ve launched our brand-new apps into both app stores


We are now in the beta stage with over 20 brands signed up


 


We are based in Bristol, UK and we are looking for a passionate, experienced and ambitious Marketing co-founder to help us achieve our goals of scaling in terms of users and partnerships.


 


About the role:


This will initially be a hands-on role and an equity-only role (for now)


If you are looking for an opportunity to join an exciting project, work remotely and help build something from the ground up, then keep reading.


 


You will be responsible for:


 



  • Planning and leading the execution of the marketing strategy for both online and offline channels

  • Grow revenue for the business

  • Determining the best way to clearly and succinctly communicate our Value Proposition to key customer segments

  • Building brand awareness using social media

  • Building partnerships with businesses

  • Content curation

  • Analysing data from advertising channels

  • Building a sales and marketing team and mentoring them

  • Participate with preparations for seed investment.


 


Requirements:


Must haves



  • 1-3 years of experience in marketing field

  • B2B experience

  • Demonstrated expertise in effective marketing strategies operations

  • Growth Hacker; creative thinker with experience of delivering results with a small budget

  • Experience in driving Google AdWords campaigns and Facebook Ads

  • Experience in community management (across all major social media platforms)

  • Experience using Google Analytics and delivering analytics reports


 


Nice to haves



  • Experience in building partnerships

  • App store optimization (ASO) experience


 


What we can offer:



  • The right candidate can expect a substantial amount of equity (based on ability and experience) with salary post-investment

  • Flexible working

  • The opportunity to work remotely (I’ll buy the coffees at future meetings)


If you’re interested, then please reply with a cover letter and CV.


Looking forward to hearing from you!

items.title: Performance Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
nkoda is a sheet music app containing a huge resource of scores, parts and educational materials from every genre. Fresh from a major collaboration with Apple’s App Store and with endorsements from Sir Simon Rattle and Joyce DiDonato, nkoda is one of the fastest growing and most dynamic startups in Europe. 


 


We are proud of our mission: bringing music learning, practice and performance to everyone in the world.


 


About the Role


 


This role has potential to impact the growth of one of the most exciting start-ups in Europe!


 


We are looking for an insanely talented and analytical PPC performance marketing specialist to be instrumental in delivering growth across the board. The role will initially focus on driving acquisition via Facebook PPC and email marketing, before looking into new channels by applying the “test and learn” approach.


 


Key responsibilities:


 



  • Developing the strategy and management of paid activities.

  • Hands-on management of international campaigns and ownership of KPIs and reporting.

  • Working with the creative and tech teams to develop a campaign content roadmap.

  • Owning the funnel optimization for Facebook PPC, as well as testing new channels.

  • Liaising with the team to set up and optimize email marketing campaigns.


 


About You…


 



  • At least 2-3 years’ experience in ROI focused performance marketing with social PPC being your main focus/strength.

  • At least 1 year of experience in using email automation tools (i.e. Drip, Active Campaign, Autopilot etc.)

  • Experience having mastered creation of ads on Facebook and Google Ads etc.

  • Comfortable setting up complex prospecting & remarketing flows across different ad platforms.

  • Familiar with finding and testing audiences within Facebook and across other channels.

  • Demonstrable experience managing ads for eCommerce or Apps.

  • Previous experience assisting with copywriting for ads, funnel, and email.


 


What we offer


 


The chance to...



  • Work in a key position in one of the most exciting young companies in Europe.

  • Contribute to the development and expansion of a revolutionary digital service for musicians.

  • Be part of a team completely obsessed with the success and usability of the product.


 


Culture


 


We are a relaxed bunch, but work equally hard to achieve our goals. People who enjoy the challenge, complexity and constant problem-solving thrive, and find nkoda one of the best environments they’ve ever worked in. 


 


We emphasize promotion and growth from within our team, so there is the opportunity to progress quickly. Our focus on nurturing our own talent is also why we’re so selective about the people we hire.


 


Salary


 


£30-40K DOE


 


We look forward to receiving your application!


 


If you have not received a response within 10 working days, please assume that on this occasion your application has been unsuccessful.

items.title: Gatekeeper: Product Manager for SaaS Solution | Remote
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=2, frontend=0}
items.content:
Product Manager for SaaS Solution | Remote

 
Gatekeeper is a SaaS-based contract and supplier management solution with an expanding feature set. We offer supplier management, contract management, supplier portal, employee portal and additional modules to help our customers crush complexity in their processes, reduce risk, improve compliance and maximise value.

Gatekeeper offers a fresh, vibrant, simplified and modern way of managing supplier relationships and contracts.

Note: This is a fully remote role, so your physical location can be anywhere in Europe or Canada. 

About you

Are you a Product Manager looking for the next challenge in a fast-moving, fast-growing, fast-talking startup?

Do you have what it takes to deliver value over and above expectations on a consistent basis? Are you ready to help build a disruptive feature set delivering best-in-class modern solutions to universal customer problems?

DO NOT apply for this job if:
  • You ever consider mediocrity acceptable
  • You want to be the smartest person in the (virtual) room
  • You need to be told what to do
  • Don’t like working with the best and learning something new everyday
  • You have an ego bigger than your sense of humour
If you still want to apply, read our Vision & Values. If they excite and inspire you to join our team and culture then please read on……

The role 

We need a Product Manager to build world-class solutions to universal problems impacting almost every business on the planet. Our fanatical focus on solving complex problems with simple effective solutions is what allows Gatekeeper as a product to disrupt the market and supports our growth.

This role reports directly to the CEO and is critical to the success of our solution in the long term.

Key responsibilities will include:
  • Support the Product Director (CEO) in specifying new ideas features and integrations into developer ready user stories and related wireframes and high fidelity prototypes
  • Managing our internal and public product roadmaps including feature prioritisation and release management
  • Manage our UX Team to improve information flow and the end-user experience
  • Ensure product quality through testing and support releases with strong documentation
  • Engage with the customer-facing teams to analyse requirements and problems to outcome elegant solutions
  • Develop a range of KPIs to monitor and maximise product usage
  • Help source engineering, design and DevOps talent to support the product roadmap and customer demands
  • Work with marketing on messaging, positioning, and launch activities
  • Build a range of videos by benefit, persona, features and module for the Gatekeeper Academy to maximise product usage
  • Embed Machine Learning and AI within our solution 
 
Your qualities

As a natural team player and lifetime learner you will have:
  • A borderline-unhealthy obsession with solving customer problems
  • Very strong technical aptitude and understanding of cloud technologies
  • Empathetic, with attention to detail and eye for design
  • Excellent spoken and written communication skills
  • Ability to work with an agile, highly distributed team
  • Proven track record in SaaS product management
  • A sense of humour and lust of life 
 
HOW GATEKEEPER SUPPORTS YOU:
  • Work remotely: Live & work wherever you like - no more commutes
  • Flexible hours: Design your working time to meet your lifestyle
  • Technology: Get hooked up with a laptop, monitor and headphones to do your best work
  • Gatekeeper Retreats: Join us on annual (or more frequent) GK Gatherings
  • Learning & development budget: to support our lifetime learners we offer financial support for courses, books and events
  • Health: stay fit and healthy - reimbursement for a gym membership or any other well-being activity
  • Thorough product training to equip you with the tools to succeed

items.content:
ServiceNow Business Analyst currently required for a leading ServiceNow Partner offering the opportunity to work remotely on a permanent basis.

This role offers the successful candidate a chance to become part of a strong and rapidly growing team working on a variety of projects, from small client-facing project engagements to Enterprise solutions. You will be given the opportunity to engage with key stakeholders while driving continuous process improvement practices.

You should have excellent communication skills and a proven track record of influencing and consulting, with at least two years of ServiceNow process consultancy experience. This role is suited to a real team player, with experience of mentoring more novice staff preferred.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work with one of the most respected ServiceNow partner in the UK, with a great company culture and a real focus on quality delivery of ServiceNow implementations.

By applying to this advert, you are giving Etonwood Limited authority to hold and process your data for this specific role and any other roles we may deem suitable to you over time. We will not pass your data to any third party without your verbal or written permission to do so. A copy of our Privacy notice is available on our website for further details. Etonwood Limited is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

items.title: Buildkite: Senior Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=16}
items.content:
Senior Product Designer


As a Senior Product Designer at Buildkite you’ll work on a small team with a big impact, and help shape a tool that thousands of developers use every day. You’ll report to Tim Lucas, our co-founder and design lead, and you’ll be working alongside an existing senior product designer and print designer. In this small team you’ll have the chance to influence all corners of Buildkite’s product and brand.

A typical day for a Senior Product Designer might look like:
  • Pairing with a product engineer on Zoom to talk through a new feature being worked on, and working on improvements to UI, copy, and user flows.
  • Mocking up user interface ideas in Sketch or Figma, and posting them to Basecamp, to help clarify discussions between everyone on the team.
  • Collaborating on a scope doc for a new feature, and helping to explore the possible solutions and tradeoffs.
  • Helping polish a new UI animation, pairing with a frontend engineer over Zoom.
  • Writing a post to the team on Basecamp with some design strategies and ideas, and getting feedback from a range of perspectives on the team.
  • Giving feedback on and helping to iterate our UI component libraries, helping to empower the rest of the team with great design tools.
  • Creating polished design assets for product launches, and designing changes to the Buildkite marketing site.
  • Joining in the weekly design catchup over Zoom, giving feedback on a commissioned illustration project for a new conference sticker, contributing to a sponsorship booth design idea, and demonstrating designs you’ve been working on.
  • Pairing on support to answer customer questions, and venturing into the far corners of Buildkite’s product, tools and documentation to understand how things are working in practice.

This job is for you if you have:
  • An eye for detail, and feel comfortable advocating for the user through the lens of great design.
  • The ability to navigate ambiguity, create clarity through design, and lead by example.
  • Experience working closely with frontend and backend engineers, and enjoy participating in the process of bringing your design ideas to life.
  • An interest in working in remote, cross-functional teams.
  • Worked on an existing product, helping to iterate it towards an overarching vision.
  • Confidence to seek critical feedback, ask questions, and participate in decision making.
  • Experience with leading discussions about tradeoffs in the product development process, and helping to ensure a cohesive product experience in the face of challenges.
  • An interest in helping build a small company with big impact, and influencing many aspects of the business with great design.
  • Proficiency in Sketch, Figma, Illustrator, or other design tools.
  • Basic proficiency in HTML and CSS.
  • Basic proficiency working with Ruby on Rails or similar web app framework.

Benefits and Salary
  • Salary of AUD$130K-$160K (US$90-$110K, €80-100K) depending on experience, plus benefits, for 38 hours per week (pro-rata for part-time). Salary amount excludes superannuation / 401k.
  • Equity and profit share.
  • 6 weeks paid annual leave.
  • 6 months paid parental leave for primary caregivers, and 3 months paid parental leave for secondary carers with superannuation/401k and continuation of all benefits.
  • Comprehensive hardware and phone budget every 24 months.
  • Training and conference budget.
  • Wellness budget.
  • Private healthcare.
  • Green commuting budget.
  • Expense card.
  • Home office expenses, and co-working budget.

About us

Buildkite is a continuous delivery platform that helps development teams ship quality code, fast. Making developers happy and productive makes us happy, and we’re lucky to work closely with some of the best software teams in the world, including Airbnb, Shopify, Wayfair, Intercom, PagerDuty, and Basecamp.

We are an independently owned, profitable company that values sustainable growth, transparency and work-life balance. We're currently a distributed team of twelve, and work remotely from Vancouver, Perth, Sydney, Adelaide and Melbourne.

Read more about us at https://buildkite.com/careers

items.title: Math Expert Q&A (Contract)
items.content:
Math Expert Q&A (Contract)

Company: study.com
Location: Telecommute
Job Type: Contract
Description

Math Expert (Contract)

We're looking for passionate experts to work online answering advanced math questions sent from students all over the world.
As a Math Expert, you'll be:

  • choosing from a large pool of advanced questions
  • writing thorough, step-by-step explanations
  • making revisions with our collaborative team of reviewers

As a contract Math Expert, you'll receive the following:

  • Reliable Payments: Timely, reliable payments twice a month
  • Independence: No waiting, no assignments, and a massive library of questions for you to choose from
  • Flexibility: Work from anywhere, at any time, completely online
  • Supportive Staff: Access to a supportive in-house team to answer your questions

What we’re looking for:

  • Expertise in college level math or physics like calculus
  • Ability to provide clear answers and thorough explanations on advanced math and physics topics
  • Fluent English writing and reading skills are required

Do you think you can be a Math Expert for Study.com? Click the link to fill out an application and submit your resume!

About Study.com

At Study.com, our quest is to make education fun and accessible. We’re working to help students with high quality answers to questions that they may have along the way.

items.title: Automotive Product Writer
items.content:
Automotive Product Writer

Company: Auto Media Planet
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Contract
Description

We’re looking for a number of freelance writers to help us produce product reviews. These reviews provide useful insights and information into different car parts and accessories in a way that is reader-friendly.

Required Experience: Demonstrable writing experience (preferably with product reviews) is a must. Automotive experience (professional or hobby) is also desirable. 

Required Skills: The ability to write clearly to a variety of audiences is crucial. Producing clean, error-free copy is also a must. Some research skills may be necessary, depending on your familiarity with automotive products.

About AMP

Auto Media Planet is a digital publishing company focused on connecting automotive publishers with audiences through engaging content. We do this by providing advertising and marketing services that are tailored towards the unique needs of automotive publications large and small.

The publishers we work with all have unique and engaging content about the automotive world to share. Our mission is to make it easier to share this content with new audiences.

Perks: The ability to work as much as you want in terms of article assignments. Flexible schedule. Remote work. 

How to Apply: Submit a resume, cover letter, and this writing sample assignment with your application. Please answer the following questions:

  • Have you worked for any other product review websites before? If so, which ones?

items.title: Automotive Product Writer
items.content:
Automotive Product Writer

Company: Auto Media Planet
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Contract
Description

We’re looking for a number of freelance writers to help us produce product reviews. These reviews provide useful insights and information into different car parts and accessories in a way that is reader-friendly.

Required Experience: Demonstrable writing experience (preferably with product reviews) is a must. Automotive experience (professional or hobby) is also desirable. 

Required Skills: The ability to write clearly to a variety of audiences is crucial. Producing clean, error-free copy is also a must. Some research skills may be necessary, depending on your familiarity with automotive products.

About AMP

Auto Media Planet is a digital publishing company focused on connecting automotive publishers with audiences through engaging content. We do this by providing advertising and marketing services that are tailored towards the unique needs of automotive publications large and small.

The publishers we work with all have unique and engaging content about the automotive world to share. Our mission is to make it easier to share this content with new audiences.

Perks: The ability to work as much as you want in terms of article assignments. Flexible schedule. Remote work. 

How to Apply: Submit a resume, cover letter, and this writing sample assignment with your application. Please answer the following questions:

  • Have you worked for any other product review websites before? If so, which ones?

items.content:
College Outreach Coordinator

Various
Anywhere in US
Company: Girls Who Code
ContractPart Time

Overview

Girls Who Code (GWC) is an international non-profit organization working to close the gender gap in technology. Through our College Loops program, we are leading the movement to support and equip college-aged women with the skills to pursue careers in technology fields. Girls Who Code is searching for dynamic, results-oriented College Loops Outreach Coordinator to execute recruitment strategies to generate leads for the expansion of the College Loops program. The ideal candidate has experience cultivating, building and maintaining leads, creating email campaigns, and thrives in a fast-paced environment. They bring experience working with collegiate student organizations.

This is a part-time (10 hours/week), temporary (through early December), remote position.
  • Work closely with the Manager of Alumni Programs to ensure that the outreach strategy being implemented is effective and meeting outreach targets
  • Submit weekly status updates and meet monthly lead targets
  • Convert interested College Loops applicants through phone banking and additional individualized follow up on select campuses

    • Qualifications
    • Previously participation in GWC programs (Campus, Clubs, College Loops, and/or SIP)
    • Excellent communication skills with an ability to balance priorities
    • Able to work independently and comfortable working remote
    • Proactive and self-motivated; you follow-through with projects from start to finish
    • Detail-oriented, with superb organizational skills and Google Sheet experience
    • Commitment to Girls Who Code’s strategy and mission
    • Knowledge of and/or interest in computer science, and understanding of the college landscape and student organizations

      • Girls Who Code is committed to building a truly diverse and inclusive organization with a focus on valuing, serving, and understanding our target constituents, while challenging all stakeholders to think inclusively for the betterment of our programs.

Racial and ethnic minorities and men are encouraged to apply for vacant positions at all levels.  GWC is not able to sponsor employment visas.

items.title: Creative Partner
items.content:
Creative Partner at Brilliant Branded

Remote

$60k – $80k • No equity

Help bring brands to life as a Creative Partner at Brilliant.

Work with our clients help them design and produce creative branded products, achieve marketing goals and delight their customers and colleagues with better branded products and flawlessly executed campaigns.

The Creative Partner is tech-savvy, has excellent communication skills, design chops, a great eye and a passion for ecommerce, retail trends and creative, well-designed physical products.

Primary activities include product research and selection, product design, production logistics coordination, and project management. You will interface with Brilliant designers, vendors and our clients to develop creative solutions, pitch them to clients, and execute projects from beginning to end.

This is a special hybrid role for a special hybrid kind of person. The role is a little bit of each of the following:

  • Account Management
  • Graphic Design
  • Project Management
  • Creative Direction
  • Shopping and Retail Trend Analysis
  • Vendor Management
  • Customer Service
  • Exception Handling

About you:

  • 2-4 years of full-time work experience required (minimum)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop experience
  • Good design sense
  • Strong customer service mentality
  • Tech savvy
  • Positive attitude – this is a heavy client-service role, so strong empathy is a must!

And finally:

  • You love branding, design and retail — you will ultimately be selling prospective clients on Brilliant and our mission to bring their brands to life through impactful branded merchandise, creative packaging and thoughtful collateral
  • #remotelife: You love the freedom remote work brings, and you know that with great freedom comes great responsibility. You’re ready for both

Compensation:

  • $60-80k DOE
  • Open vacation / PTO policy
  • $3k a year in healthcare reimbursement through our QSEHRA program
  • 401k plan and profit sharing

We are a small, nimble team. You will have room to grow in your role, manage others, take on additional responsibilities, or focus on specific skills as desired. Opportunities available to work on company branding, content creation, email marketing, software product management, ops, reporting, buying, merchandise planning if interested.

We are a remote company, so you can be based anywhere in the US and should be enthusiastic about working remotely.

Location

  • Remote
  • Chicago
  • Los Angeles
  • New York City

Job typem Full-time

Visa sponsorship Not available

Skills

items.title: Social Media Sales Exec
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
Company name:

The Nature Boys

Tag line:

“Social and environmentally conscious organic audience builders”

Job Specifications

Title: Social Media Sales Exec

Location: Digitally nomadic (UK South East Preference)

Salary: £18,250 (Quick progression as tiny startup)

Benefits:

  • Monthly cash bonus pot of £50 - £250,

  • Audible and Meditation subscriptions included,

  • Working for a company that’s environmentally and socially conscious,

  • All sorts of random free extras like festival tickets thanks to our super mixed client base!

Mission for Role

To work alongside our head of sales, Kieran and founder Max, to find new individuals and businesses that need outside support in social media marketing and sell them in to the right support offered by our team.

This would include our Instagram growth plugin, other Instagram related services like content & engagement powerups, Facebook and Instagram Paid Ads management, our Youtube growth plugin, Linkedin sales support and other services.

You’ll be joining a small but hard-working team - you will be reporting into Max Sinclair (Founder) and Kieran Gregory (Head of Sales) and working closely with the insta and youtube team of Kirstin and Chris and Facebook paid ads lead Vukasin.

We’re a young but fast-growing business having gone from 0 - 250 clients and 0 to 3m network in a year. We do things in a unique way - there’s no office, the first 40 minutes of your working day is a session of Audible listening to a book to develop your knowledge base and meditation to develop your capacity for mindfulness. While we have a huge mixture of clients from bars in London, to furniture designers or fitness influencers, our largest niche is focused on travel and natural world and veganism - so If you enjoy a bit of deer hunting on the weekends or think “meditation is for pussies”, then this position isn’t for you.

Overall you will grow faster as a person in all dimensions with The Nature Boys in comparison to 99% of any other jobs you’ve looked at today! And that’s a promise!! Growth is our number one focus for both the company and the people within it.

What you will be doing

  • Managing sales flow across multiple Linkedin profiles automated for outreach and bringing leads down the funnel all the way to sale.

  • Handling inbound sales opportunities in the same way.

  • Developing new opportunities to expand the business into whole new spaces!

What we are looking for in you

  • You are naturally competitive against yourself always striving to grow and outdo your previous performance.

  • You’re highly driven with an execution focus, a strong sense of urgency and a belief in the mission and the way we do things here.

  • Maintain a positive mindset and have a ‘can-do’ attitude.

  • Have a long term vantage point thinking what’s the optimal approach to each message, email or follow up for the business in the long term instead of to achieve a short term result.

  • You have a curious and analytical mind to what does and doesn’t work and how to improve.

Essential hard skills and experience required

  • A basic understanding of social media, especially Instagram, Facebook and Youtube.

  • Experience in using Microsoft Excel, Word and Google Sheets.

  • High standard of written and spoken English.

  • Cultural understanding of the UK marketplace.

Bonus points

  • Experience with social media or any other sales.

  • Experience of CRM systems like Close.io

  • Experience of using Slack.

  • Worked with startups before.

  • Experience of Instagram marketing.

Read more about our company over on our site: www.wearethenatureboys.com

"The greatest thing you'll ever learn

Is just to love and be loved in return"

Nat King Cole, Nature Boys

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER - Remote Looking for UX/Product Designers Hello everyone! I’m Noel. I saved ...
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER - Remote

Looking for UX/Product Designers

Hello everyone!

I’m Noel. I saved some money and now I want to invest it in some personal projects during my free time.

I need people for:

- Creating logos

- Creating web UI/UX designs (with no user-research. I’ll do the user-research and I’ll just send you the pages/features that needs to be created)

- Writing good product descriptions or product speech (you know, explaining how a feature works, and “why you should pay for this product”)

It’s not gonna be a full-time job.Every time I need to start a new project, I’ll send an email to a few of you, asking for how much time do you think it can take to finish the project (anyway, I’ll try to not work with fixed prices, but it will help to get a cost estimation).

If I choose you, I’ll send you a full detail of the pages/features that need to be created, and I’ll trust in your creativity and your UX experience, in order to create them. So, you are going to be responsible for defining the UX (more fun for you) with some input from my side.

So, if you can do some of those task mentioned above, send me an email to brodanoel@gmail.comPlease, the email should contain:

- Your portfolio or any kind of work that you already worked on (please, don’t bother you sending a PERFECT portfolio. Just send something)

- How much time have you taken creating each of your portfolio projects? (Will be helpful to get some cost estimations)

- Your rate (USD per hour) (consider that I’m not a company. It’s just a couple of side projects)

Important: I’m not in a hurry with none of the coming project. I WILL NOT request things to be done “yesterday”. We’ll have time. The job is going to be chill out.

I hope to see you there!

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
Do you have a few years experience in digital marketing and looking to take the next step in your career?


ABOUT US


BoostLabs.co.uk is a fast-growing SEO agency, made up of a small team of experts who over-deliver on client campaigns every time. Our values are based on transparency, value, and expertise. We have big growth plans and are looking for a proactive SEO Consultant to help deliver outstanding results for client campaigns. The role is both exciting and challenging: you will be given account responsibility, whilst being fully supported by the agency Founder from day one. 


We believe in a work-life balance and hiring only the best talent, so we work remotely within the UK.


ABOUT THE ROLE


We are looking for a passionate, dedicated and highly professional SEO Consultant to join our team. This would suit an experienced SEO Executive or SEO Manager looking to take the next step in their career, who is hungry to succeed and be the best.


You will work with the founder from day 1 - with 10 years of SEO experience working on enterprise-level sites, you will gain unique experience. You will be responsible for managing and delivering SEO campaigns for brands - brands that you have definitely heard of.


The chosen candidate's responsibilities will be, but not limited to:


• Managing and delivering successful SEO campaigns


• Day to day client account ownership ensuring client campaigns are delivered on time


• Ownership of technical SEO audits and recommendations for clients


• Keyword research across multiple verticals with detailed gap analysis


• Backlink analysis and strategy


• On-page optimisation


• Carrying out monthly/campaign reporting internally and to clients.


Essential skills & experience required:


• Experienced in SEO website optimisation techniques, preferably across high traffic websites


• Proficient in the use of SEO research and insight tools such as Ahrefs, SEMrush, Searchmetrics, Sitebulb, Screaming Frog, Google Analytics, Search Console etc.


• Be able to deal with and analyse large data sets


• Comfortable working as part of a team as well as on their own initiative


• Able to manage multiple workstreams and prioritise effectively to ensure deadlines are met


• Positive and enthusiastic with a can-do attitude


• Attention to detail


• Hunger to learn and succeed in their career and field of expertise


Desirable:


• Working on large scale websites


• Experience running Google ads and Facebook ads


The Ideal Candidate:


• Delivers SEO planning activity independently


• Builds a rapport with clients


• Works collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders


• Communicates effectively


• Focuses on clients and client satisfaction


• Has an agency background and experience in working with clients


Reward


• £22k-£26k p.a. (D.O.E.)


• Annual bonus potential


• Remote working with regular meetups


• Real opportunity for fast progression within the agency


Job Type: Full-time


Salary: £22,000.00 to £26,000.00 /year

items.title: Performance Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Performance Marketing Manager


Marketing | Up to £40k p.a. | Old Street Station, London


At Pod Point we’re changing the way people drive.  We fundamentally believe that travel shouldn’t damage the Earth so we’ve made it our mission to install a Pod Point (an Electric Vehicle charging point) everywhere you park. To make that vision a reality, we need the brightest, most tenacious and most inspiring talent in the world - we are growing faster than the market and we need to maintain that velocity - that’s where you come in!


The Role


We’re looking for a proactive self-starter to jump on board and help us achieve our ambitious growth goals. The position will report into the Head of Marketing and will be based out of our office near Old Street Station in London.


What you’ll do


You will take ownership of our paid and organic acquisition channels and supercharge them (with the help of the rest of the Pod Point team). 


You’ll be responsible for:



  • Managing and optimising our paid and organic acquisition channels

  • Managing the Pod Point website and optimising it for conversion

  • Creating content that targets users across our B2C and B2B markets at the awareness and consideration phase of the customer journey

  • Managing all onsite technical SEO (including structured data, metadata, keyword optimisation and resolving crawl issues)

  • Managing all offsite SEO (including link building campaigns and working with relevant team members to distribute content via social and email)

  • Managing our PPC agency for non-English language ad campaigns.

  • Monitoring and reporting on our paid and organic KPI metrics, as well as communicating wins and progress to the wider company

  • Staying on top of algorithm updates and the latest best practices


What you’ll need



  • At least 3 years’ experience delivering digital marketing campaigns that have had a tangible impact on business growth, with a focus on SEO and paid acquisition

  • An understanding of both B2B and B2C marketing practices

  • Proficient in the use of:


    • Google Ads, Facebook Ads (and other social ad platforms as a bonus)

    • Google Analytics and Search Console

    • Moz SEO or similar rank tracking/search analytics platform

    • Screaming Frog or similar crawl tools

    • Google Keyword Planner or a similar keyword research tool

    • Website content management systems

    • Google Optimize (or similar A/B testing tool)


  • You have a creative approach to problem-solving, rely on data to guide your decision-making and apply lean principles to maximise efficiency and output 

  • You have worked in an agile environment as part of an Agile (Scrum / Kanban) team

  • You enjoy learning new skills and getting involved in activities outside your core area when extra hands are needed


Bonus Points



  • Experience running email marketing campaigns (even more bonus points if they were automated)

  • Experience using Jira, Confluence and/or Adobe Creative Suite

  • Experience working with product teams, software developers and/or B2B sales

  • Experience working in a high growth start-up or growth-stage tech company

  • Passionate and knowledgeable about the EV and/or sustainability industry

  • Fluent in Norwegian

  • A dog you can bring into the office


And if you’re not sure whether you’re what we’re looking for - send us your CV anyway!  We love to hear from people who are passionate about what we do, and we always take the view that a good cultural fit (and mission alignment) is much more important than ticking all the “qualifications, skills and experience” boxes.


Our culture is electric


At Pod Point we like to think we are anything but conventional. We have worked hard to create a rapidly-growing, constantly innovating, flat-structured world, where each employee can see the vital contribution they are making to the company. We knew from the very beginning that a rigid, corporate environment was never going to work for us, and we have stayed true to our word - we’re anything but.


We work hard; we’re not clock-watchers but equally you may find yourself working into the evening very occasionally. In return we’ll pay you well, give you complete ownership to shape the role, give you ground-breaking projects to work on and surround you with fantastic, talented people. We also provide the following benefits:



  • Flexible working hours and a casual dress code

  • 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays)

  • Very generous maternity and paternity leave scheme

  • Pension scheme

  • Eyecare scheme

  • Bike to work scheme and discounted gym membership

  • An extensive non-fiction library to provide a bit of inspiration

  • The odd Pod Point puppy to cuddle.


Pod Point is an equal opportunities employer, although you must be legally able to work in the UK, and any data you provide us will be stored and disseminated in accordance with Pod Point’s Privacy Policy.


We like to deal directly with our candidates so no agencies please!

Position:Flair Football - Work Experience - Social Media Administrator


Start Date: October 2019


Duration: 2 months minimum, with opportunity to renew on rolling 4-week basis thereafter


Working Hours:Mon-Sunday, flexible, though expect to work at least 5-6 hours per day


Location: During the week, you will be expected to work from UCL’s incubator at Kings Cross. On weekends, you can work from home.


Remuneration: Cost of travel + £25/week lunch expense


Flair Football is the app for the players. Our mission is to make every young football player feel like a pro, no matter their level of ability.


Launched on the app stores in September 2018, Flair allows the everyday young football player to see their progress as a player. We’re now adopting a growth mindset - we want Flair to be a household name among young people who play football. This is requiring a substantial direct marketing push on Instagram.


Responsibilities:
- Growing Flair's userbase by identifying relevant Instagram accounts to follow


- Meeting daily marketing targets


- Communicating via Instagram DM with prospective new users of the app, when handling customer support enquiries


- Coordinating with other social media administrators to execute Flair's marketing strategy


Requirements:


- Ability to execute repetitive work while maintaining focus


- Excellent communication skills to ensure effective coordination with other administrators


- Experience using Instagram, either as a user of the app, or in a professional capacity.


- Note that this is not a social media content creation role, but rather focuses on the admin involved around growing a social media community


Benefits:


- The chance to be part of a young, fun-loving team, who love what we’re doing and behave more like friends than colleagues


Job Types: Internship, Volunteer


Remuneration:Cost of travel + £25/week lunch expense


Job Types: Internship, Volunteer

items.title: Digital Marketing Intern
items.content:
A FINE HOUR brings a new dimension to the travel industry, offering gyms, spas, pools, meeting rooms and more from a selection of the finest hotels, bookable through our online platform.


We are now expanding our team to include a Digital Marketing Intern, to support with the increasingly broad and creative scope of marketing activities being undertaken.


As a new business, we are at an exciting stage of growth and are looking for an ambitious individual who wants to be part of an early-stage start-up.


Our Digital Marketing Intern will work across all marketing activities including social media, PR and A FINE HOUR website.


Key Tasks and Main Duties



  • Work with the Brand and Communications Manager to organise and deliver our social media activity in line with our brand and tone of voice

  • Implement individual campaign briefs (as part of a wider campaign strategy) using multiple channels and content

  • Execute email marketing campaigns to AFH subscriber base ensuring the copy, branding and look & feel is to the high standards of AFH

  • Assist with the timely development and continual improvement of AFH’s website in the realm of keywords, UX, hotel onboarding and regularly aiding the renewal of content and imagery

  • Work closely with the Co-Founder to respond to Press and PR requests

  • Create a library of imagery and video for marketing and social media

  • Help to provide regular reporting on performance metrics against KPIs for email marketing and social media

  • Conduct SEO Keyword and Social Media Hashtag research to help improve the reach of our campaigns

  • Identify trending topics and key themes in the luxury and hospitality space to help with the creation of new campaigns


Key Skills & Experience:



  • Excellent digital planning and implementation skills and ideas.

  • A keen eye for detail and the ability to be a brand guardian.

  • Experience in developing compelling digital and print content that inspires engagement

  • Ability to manage multiple projects while also being self-motivated

  • Experience of implementing a brief in collaboration with colleagues.

  • Full understanding of the growing trends of content and influencer marketing

  • Experience of being a brand guardian/ambassador

  • Excellent proofreader.

  • Knowledge of Google Analytics and Facebook Ads advantageous


More Information


This will initially be a 3 month, paid, part-time internship, with the possibility of full-time employment in the future


As a team, we often work remotely. You will be heavily supported during the internship, through regular meetings and contact, but you must be prepared to work independently on occasion.

items.title: Social Media Sales Exec
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
Company name:


The Nature Boys


Tag line:


“Social and environmentally conscious organic audience builders”


Job Specifications


Title: Social Media Sales Exec


Location: Digitally nomadic (UK South East Preference)


Salary: £18,250 (Quick progression as tiny startup)


Benefits: 



  • Monthly cash bonus pot of £50 - £250, 

  • Audible and Meditation subscriptions included, 

  • Working for a company that’s environmentally and socially conscious,

  • All sorts of random free extras like festival tickets thanks to our super mixed client base! 


Mission for Role


To work alongside our head of sales, Kieran and founder Max, to find new individuals and businesses that need outside support in social media marketing and sell them in to the right support offered by our team. 


This would include our Instagram growth plugin, other Instagram related services like content & engagement powerups, Facebook and Instagram Paid Ads management, our Youtube growth plugin, Linkedin sales support and other services.


You’ll be joining a small but hard-working team - you will be reporting into Max Sinclair (Founder) and Kieran Gregory (Head of Sales) and working closely with the insta and youtube team of Kirstin and Chris and Facebook paid ads lead Vukasin.


We’re a young but fast-growing business having gone from 0 - 250 clients and 0 to 3m network in a year. We do things in a unique way - there’s no office, the first 40 minutes of your working day is a session of Audible listening to a book to develop your knowledge base and meditation to develop your capacity for mindfulness. While we have a huge mixture of clients from bars in London, to furniture designers or fitness influencers, our largest niche is focused on travel and natural world and veganism - so If you enjoy a bit of deer hunting on the weekends or think “meditation is for pussies”, then this position isn’t for you.


Overall you will grow faster as a person in all dimensions with The Nature Boys in comparison to 99% of any other jobs you’ve looked at today! And that’s a promise!! Growth is our number one focus for both the company and the people within it.


What you will be doing



  • Managing sales flow across multiple Linkedin profiles automated for outreach and bringing leads down the funnel all the way to sale.

  • Handling inbound sales opportunities in the same way.

  • Developing new opportunities to expand the business into whole new spaces! 


What we are looking for in you



  • You are naturally competitive against yourself always striving to grow and outdo your previous performance.

  • You’re highly driven with an execution focus, a strong sense of urgency and a belief in the mission and the way we do things here.

  • Maintain a positive mindset and have a ‘can-do’ attitude.

  • Have a long term vantage point thinking what’s the optimal approach to each message, email or follow up for the business in the long term instead of to achieve a short term result.

  • You have a curious and analytical mind to what does and doesn’t work and how to improve.


Essential hard skills and experience required



  • A basic understanding of social media, especially Instagram, Facebook and Youtube.

  • Experience in using Microsoft Excel, Word and Google Sheets.

  • High standard of written and spoken English.

  • Cultural understanding of the UK marketplace.


Bonus points



  • Experience with social media or any other sales.

  • Experience of CRM systems like Close.io

  • Experience of using Slack.

  • Worked with startups before.

  • Experience of Instagram marketing.


 


Read more about our company over on our site: www.wearethenatureboys.com 


"The greatest thing you'll ever learn


Is just to love and be loved in return"


Nat King Cole, Nature Boys

items.title: Junior Product Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
About Us


Planes is a young digital product studio, started by two friends who liked making great products together. As we grow that will always be our essence - to work on products we believe in with people we enjoy every day.


Our background is in startups, not agencies. We prefer shipping code, listening to users and iterating quickly rather than long lunches, ‘expert’ reports and death by powerpoint. This approach has lead us to work with all sorts of people, from international fin-tech providers to startups, building products that their users love.


A small and nimble team, we work collaboratively to produce work that we are proud of and our clients love. We are made up of designers, engineers and product lovers who are all entrepreneurs by nature.


The Role


We are looking for a Junior Product Manager to join our team full time. You will be responsible for managing a number of products at once, both new projects and retainers for existing products. Working in a multi-disciplinary team you will be the voice of the user, while also keeping sprints running on time and budget. Days will be varied and could involve any of the following:



  • Running user interviews to uncover insights

  • Testing prototypes with users to understand usability and solution fit

  • Digging into data to inform decisions and query hypothesis

  • Collaborating with a designer to convert ideas into a tangible product

  • Writing user stories and managing development pipelines to ensure delivery stays on track

  • Running product demos and sprint planning sessions with clients and the development team

  • Researching and making recommendations for solutions to product problems, or to help with product goals

  • Wireframing and mapping out user journeys


About you


For this role, you will have the right combination of experience and skills to manage multiple projects and priorities. You will need to be able to take the initiative and be organised as the rest of the team will rely on you to keep workflows moving in the right direction. Tonnes of experience is not required, but here is some idea of the kinds of experience that would suit:



  • Client facing; communicating directly with clients both written and in person

  • UX research/design; an appreciation of how users interact with products, how to map and measure these journeys and the ability to improve them. You might have some experience with wireframing too.

  • Project planning; aptitude at managing many moving parts and conflicting stakeholders requirements

  • Specification writing; translating designs or requirements to user stories for developers to build

  • Scrum/agile exposure; you will have exposure to the principles of agile development, and know how to adapt a development framework to suit various types of projects.

  • Exposure to deliverying digital projects; this doesn't have to be apps it could be micro sites or campaigns for an agency too for example


Working at Planes


We are a relatively relaxed bunch, and believe that if we hire adults and treat them like them we won't need any baby sitters. As such we leave it to you to decide where and when you will do your best work. If you need to stay at home and nut out a tough problem so be it, if you have to come in late because you are dancing at Morning Glory -power too you! That being said, we all tend to spend most of our time in the studio because we have more fun working together, so this is not a fully remote role.


We are also a social bunch and since we work with people we like we tend to hang out after work too. We don't really plan anything but tend to find ourselves doing at least one activity together a month be it mountain biking, rock climbing or just going out for beers. We also get that you have your own life too, so won't be upset if you can't join us every Friday night.


Holidays are the spice of life, so on top of your 28 days a year, we also let you take up to a month of leave without pay if you like to do even more adventuring.


Hiring process


If this sounds like a piece of you, please send through a short (no longer than one paragraph) intro on you along with your CV. If we like what we see we will start with a phone call. Following that we will send you across a small challenge for you to work on and come in to present back to us, at the same time we will introduce you to the team, show you our office and have a chat over a coffee.

items.title: Marketing Manager - Content
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We’re looking for a content marketing hero to showcase one of London’s top 100 start-ups


EduMe is excitedly on the search for a brilliant Content Marketing Manager. Are you someone with the biggest enthusiasm for marketing and content who wants to see their work making a significant difference?


You’ll want to excite people with your writing and be able to put yourself in the shoes of any number of existing and potential clients and industries. This is our second full time marketing hire alongside the Head of Marketing, and in a growing business it means this role will play a critical part in the success of EduMe.


About EduMe


EduMe is a Workforce Success platform used by modern companies across 6 continents to train, engage and communicate with their workforce. By having effective learning and relevant information in the palm of their hands, the workforce at companies like Uber, Airbnb, Deloitte and Vodafone are empowered with the knowledge they require to be successful in their job. This is the goal of Workforce Success.


We are a hyper-growth company that’s changing the way people get access to and absorb information. Founded in 2016, we have won numerous awards for innovation and excellence, and are listed by Seedtable as one of top 100 London startups to watch in 2019. We’re quickly growing, now with a team of 18 based in the idyllic and leafy Chiswick. Our office is in a modern Workspace building with café on site, all your high street favourites just over the road and a huge range of independent cafes, pubs and eateries.


What you’ll do



  • Be ultimately responsible for developing and delivering a content marketing plan

  • Come up with bold ideas

  • Write and edit blogs, guides, stories, social posts, webinars, product information, newsletters and anything else you want to get your hands on

  • Help to shape our category design marketing around Workforce Success

  • Become an expert in Workforce Success and a leading voice in the industry

  • Work with an in-house designer to bring your content to life

  • Carry out analysis of the performance of all new content and make recommendations

  • Run all our social media and manage performance 


What we’re looking for in our Content Marketing Manager



  • Someone with huge passion for building stories and taking pride in their work

  • A real creative soul - someone who’s always got ideas from both the inside and outside of the ‘box’

  • An eagerness to direct both content and social strategies and inform the overall growth marketing strategy

  • You’ll love exciting and educating people by creating a unique voice and personality for a brand

  • Experience in B2B content marketing for 3+ years is essential

  • Someone who’s had exposure to the full marketing mix

  • Experience with Hubspot will be a big benefit


Why EduMe


As one of London’s most exciting tech startups, there’s a wonderfully positive atmosphere in the office. Whether it’s the camaraderie and sharing of ideas, or the fact every opinion, suggestion and concept is totally valued. You will never feel out of place with us.


Work and play come hand in hand at EduMe with games nights, Friday afternoon pub sessions and the odd team party. We offer a pension, 25 days holiday, share options, personal health budget and personal learning and education budget.


This is a brilliant opportunity to be part of a business that’s growing, in an environment where you’ll have complete freedom to act on your instincts. You’ll see your ideas help build the path to bigger success, establish yourself as a critical part of the company and develop personally and professionally.


Please send us your CV with a short covering note.

items.title: Growth Assistant
items.content:
Do you want to be a part of a wellbeing revolution? Are you looking to gain experience in a femtech startup, funded by one of Europe’s most well-known VC firms?


Yoppie is on a mission to name and shame the industry’s dirty little secrets in the form of unwanted and unknown toxic ingredients. We keep it 100% real and 100% au natural by combining the best of product design with synthetic-free, biodegradable, cruelty-free and 100% organic cotton period products. We make tampons, pads and liners for girls with periods, yes we said it, the forbidden P-word. We think it's about time we started talking about them.


We’re growing our team and have an exciting opportunity to bright & intelligent people to help in driving user acquisition and scaling the systems that lead to that. This is a great opportunity to develop a broad, lateral skill-set and will let you interact with the entire marketing funnel.
This role reports directly to Head of Growth.


Responsibilities:



  • Your role will take you from working on our website to our conversion rates to growth experiments to email campaigns

  • Setting up paid acquisition campaigns: Facebook Ads,  Google Ads, Pinterest Ads and a few more

  • Managing email campaigns

  • Weekly reporting on the growth KPIs together with the Head of Growth

  • Working with the creative team to produce content


What we’re looking for:



  • Relentlessly curious people

  • Organised self-starter

  • Inclination towards tech & data analytics

  • Experience or knowledge of Facebook Ads & Google Ads

  • Design experience

items.title: Senior Marketing Manager - Performance Marketing
items.content:
Technology has revolutionised the world we live in, yet somehow travel has stayed much the same as it was 30 years ago. Seatfrog is here to change that.


We’re on a mission to take every journey beyond the ordinary for millions of people all over the globe, empowering them to upgrade their seat and fill the 480M premium seats that travel empty every year with technology that’s a joy to use.


We’re building a stellar team to achieve our audacious goals. We strive to create an environment where you can do your best work. Join us, and you’ll be challenged and supported in equal measure. Ours is a culture with spirit and substance and our people are empowered to make the bold decisions others wouldn’t and haven't.


The opportunity


As a senior partnerships marketing manager you will be responsible for driving performance of user acquisition across partner channels, suggesting and planning effective digital marketing campaigns with partners.


We're looking for an enthusiastic self-starter who is keen on not only strategic planning and performance focussed marketing, but also nurturing client relationships and evolving Seatfrog use.


Tasks will include driving performance management of partner marketing; social media optimisation, content, remarketing campaigns and email.



  • Manage and maintain strong relationships with new and existing partnerships for an internal and external audience

  • Support partners with driving awareness & demand on their own digital & social channels activities such as email, social, online campaigns, events and direct marketing.

  • Support with creating relevant collateral including case studies & PR, advocating and building up the Seatfrog brand with each partner.

  • Deliver on a broad range of customer focused initiatives to support marketing with revenue targets in mind.

  • Working closely with the data & product team and sales team members to identify and create opportunities with partners

  • Evaluate partner needs and build productive long lasting relationships

  • Drive innovation in marketing across the Seatfrog channel mix

  • Educate partners on the value of Seatfrog on the best ways to support their customers with co-marketing activities


Requirements



  • Performance marketing focused experience, social & email primarily.

  • Relevant experience in B2B tech, B2C affiliates.

  • Excellent organisational skills and ability to meet deadlines to plan multiple concurrent marketing activities, content and campaigns in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

  • Excellent presentation skills to be able to present ideas and proposals in a clear and coherent way.

  • Strong influencing and negotiating skills.

  • Professional and upbeat attitude, with the ability to interact effectively with customers, sales, marketing and other internal teams.

  • Excellent problem solving skills, combined with strong commercial acumen.

  • Ability to deliver quality outputs in a fast-paced, exciting and dynamic environment with an ability to work to tight deadlines.

  • Exceptional communication skills and ability to liaise with all levels of management and to communicate cross-functionally in a structured and clear manner to influence outcome

  • Experience in a marketplace, high growth business is a plus


What's on offer



  • A fantastic opportunity to work in a high growth global software company and help shape the future of how travel should be

  • A team culture that is truly beyond the ordinary, where we solve problems together to drive the best possible results for our clients and users

  • Genuine autonomy to achieve your best and a personal development and growth plan to create a long-term career path for you at Seatfrog

  • Free Upgrades and budget for 1 week working anywhere in the world.

  • A competitive salary

  • Private healthcare plan via Vitality, with added gym discounts and incentives to encourage you to get out, get active and stay mentally and physically healthy

  • The latest gear and best tools to enable you to do your greatest work

  • Off-peak travel - so you can swap a public holiday with any day you like so you can get away without the crowds. 


At Seatfrog, we consider diversity a strength - inclusion fuels our ability to solve problems we never thought we could. Your application will be considered on its merits, without regard to your race, age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability status or anything else. If there is anything we need to know to enable you to fully participate in our interview process, please just let us know in your application.

items.content:
Technology has revolutionised the world we live in, yet somehow travel has stayed much the same as it was 30 years ago. Seatfrog is here to change that.


We’re on a mission to take every journey beyond the ordinary for millions of people all over the globe, empowering them to upgrade their seat and fill the 480M premium seats that travel empty every year with technology that’s a joy to use.


We’re building a stellar team to achieve our audacious goals. We strive to create an environment where you can do your best work. Join us, and you’ll be challenged and supported in equal measure. Ours is a culture with spirit and substance and our people are empowered to make the bold decisions others wouldn’t and haven't.


We’re looking for a Junior Product Manager to come on the journey and join our London office. Fancy coming along for the ride? Apply below!


About the team you'll be joining


The product team at Seatfrog is focused on crafting great experiences that fundamentally change the way people are able to travel. You'll be part of a group of skilled and thoughtful individuals focused on solving big problems that deliver significant growth and build upon our ambitious vision.


About the role


In this role you’ll work closely with the Product Manager and the senior product team to drive decision-making and product delivery for our iOS and Android apps. You’ll create a strong connection to our customers along every stage of the process to listen, understand and empathise with their struggles and drive solutions to solve their problems.


Your key areas of focus will be: 



  • Checking in on app health metrics daily, and producing weekly and monthly reports of your findings. 

  • Working with the senior product team to build and maintain the product roadmap for customer experience.

  • Carrying out user and market research for new initiatives and features.

  • Managing new version releases. You’ll write app release notes and ensure that new versions are shipped on time. 

  • Communicating updates to the wider team.  

  • Being the go-to person for Customer Support and Customer Success teams.

    • Responding to customer feedback and bug reports, investigating the severity of issues in order to effectively prioritise a backlog.

    • Gathering insights that drive the Customer Experience roadmap.




What you'll need



  • A passion for delivering great products and great customer experience.

  • Ability to blend instinct, consultation, and objective analysis to make the right decisions in a timely manner.

  • A methodical approach and be able to proactively foresee issues. 

  • You’ll build the trust of colleagues to keep them informed and to deliver on expectations.

  • An energetic and motivational style, that stimulates pace and creativity from colleagues.


Nice to haves, or willing to learn



  • Introductory course to product management

  • Experience using Jira

  • Experience in an agile environment

  • Experience of travel sector 

  • Mobile app product development 

  • Exposure to a fast-paced start-up environment


What's on offer



  • A fantastic opportunity to work in a high growth global software company and help shape the future of how travel should be

  • A team culture that is truly beyond the ordinary, where we solve problems together to drive the best possible results for our clients and users

  • Genuine autonomy to achieve your best and a personal development and growth plan to create a long-term career path for you at Seatfrog

  • Free Upgrades and budget for 1 week working anywhere in the world.

  • A competitive salary

  • Private healthcare plan via Vitality, with added gym discounts and incentives to encourage you to get out, get active and stay mentally and physically healthy

  • The latest gear and best tools to enable you to do your greatest work

  • Off-peak travel - so you can swap a public holiday with any day you like so you can get away without the crowds. 


At Seatfrog, we consider diversity a strength - inclusion fuels our ability to solve problems we never thought we could. Your application will be considered on its merits, without regard to your race, age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability status or anything else. If there is anything we need to know to enable you to fully participate in our interview process, please just let us know in your application.
