items.content:
About MyTutor:


One-to-one tuition is proven to significantly improve pupils’ grades, confidence and life chances. Yet it remains out of reach for many. MyTutor’s mission is to bring life-changing tuition to all. Our handpicked network of tutors work online with pupils from all walks of life, and we’ve given half a million lessons so far – raising results on average by one whole grade. We’re proud of the fact that over 400 schools have also chosen to work with us. And that we’ve earned a Trustpilot rating of 4.8/5


We understand the hectic lives of families with teenagers, and our flexible lesson times mean parents can juggle schedules more easily. On our website, it’s simple to find a tutor your child gets on with – and every lesson is tailored to their needs. Also, by having lessons via live video, pupils can access the best tutors no matter where they live or when they need help. No travelling for Mum and Dad, no waiting around, no strangers in your home. Pupils can have their lessons anywhere – at Grandma’s, at a friend’s house or on holiday, so there’s no disruption in the run-up to exams.


Tuition is now more affordable and accessible, making life less stressful for those who care about seeing the next generation succeed. 




REQUIREMENTS


About the Role:


You’ll be joining our passionate, ambitious team in an exciting, fast-paced & high-growth environment. With tutoring being a well searched term, SEO is key to our growth, ensuring that we are well ranked for the appropriate keywords and converting this organic traffic into paying customers.


Working closely with the CMO, you'll be responsible for creating, managing and implementing the MyTutor SEO strategy with support from external consultants. The SEO champion across the business, You’ll coordinate all efforts across product, tech and marketing to drive growth in this channel including onsite and offsite optimisation and keyword expansion research.


What you'll do:



  • Produce and publish content in line with SEO standards (articles, blogs, web copy)

  • Write compelling content for landing pages to drive organic traffic

  • Conduct keyword research to drive organic visibility and authority

  • Monitor and evaluate search results and search performance across the major search channels in order to improve search engine positioning

  • Oversee the implementation and management of the website SEO particularly onsite and offsite content requirements

  • Deliver content auditing and content gap analysis and SEO forecasts

  • Proactively research and implement SEO recommendations to drive organic traffic and revenue

  • Coordinate and report on link building activities


 


Requirements



  • At least 1 year experience of either producing content or optimisation

  • Understanding of on-page SEO and copywriting

  • Passion for writing great SEO content

  • Strong knowledge of newest SEO best practices

  • A strong understanding of SEO metrics and KPIs

  • Experience using Google Analytics and Google Search Console

  • Experience using SEO tools (SEOMonitor, Screaming Frog, Majestic or similar)

  • Link building experience

  • Experience with CMS platforms (e.g. Wordpress)

  • Comfortable dealing with large site structures

  • Ability to work independently and effectively as part of a team



Nice to have:



  • Understanding of HTML & CSS

  • Experience with SQL

  • Experience in performing competitor analysis


Interested in applying but don't tick all the boxes on the list? Please apply, we'd still love to hear from you.




BENEFITS


 



  • Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people

  • A work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and support

  • Training and investment in your learning

  • Competitive salary and share option package

  • Tuesday Breakfasts, Friday drinks and regular team events & outings

  • 24 days holiday (plus public holidays)



MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace with an EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

items.title: marketing, social media, online growth role
items.content:
Stretch inc., a new retail experience is looking for a fun, witty, and creative marketing and social media professional. You will own social activity and social management for the company, creating, scheduling and distributing engaging and interesting content across channels. We will be looking to you to help us grow with exciting ideas and marketing campaigns that drive revenue, cultivate our brand, highlight our product and embody stretch inc. values and objectives.


Not only will you own social media management for the business, you'll also help with design content creation in the lead up to our launch. Stretch inc. is an innovative and fresh retail experience and we need a strategy that captures that vibe. 


The role will grow and develop as the company grows and develops with the potential to become a full-time member and / or manager of the marketing team.


You will gain invaluable experience in marketing, partnerships, and promotion of events but as a rough guide here is what we expect:



  • Design a campaign that drives online booking

  • Managing the company's social media calendar and accounts, including LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and any other relevant platforms.

  • Plan and create content to effectively deliver stretch inc’s message and increase online following

  • Report activity and performance data against the campaigns you run and the copy you create

  • Be a key stakeholder in event marketing and planning and promote our events through social media engagement

  • Develop partnerships for marketing promotion

  • Develop and maintain contacts and a distribution network

  • Creation and management of marketing materials including text content, images, blogs, and more

  • Creation of artwork for emails, digital newsletters, brochures, event signage, social media, and other marketing tools

  • Generate prospective attendee and press leads through intelligent & in-depth research


Experience is great, but not essential. Personality, work ethic, and organisation skills are paramount. We’re looking for a hardworking and ambitious team-player who is excited to grow with the company. You will bring:



  • A great eye for design, attention to detail and composition

  • Knowledge and experience of Adobe InDesign and Photoshop

  • A keen user of social media

  • An enthusiastic and positive outlook, energy, passion and “let’s do this” attitude

  • Initiative to share and implement ideas

  • Ability to communicate confidently within the team and externally

  • Excellent organization skills, and ability to remain calm under pressure

  • Ability to adapt to and work effectively in a fast-paced environment

items.title: Communications and Campaigns Associate
items.content:
The role


If you like to move at pace on multiple tasks, take projects from design to execution and evaluation, have a flair for messaging and engaging audiences, this role in the area of might be perfect for you.


Apolitical’s aim of transforming government can only be achieved if we continue to grow and engage a diverse range of public servants across the world. That’s why we’re looking for someone with initiative, creativity and flair who can run their own projects with this aim in mind. This might include creating interactive content, organising online workshops, running competitions and working on search-engine-optimisation (amongst other ideas).


Prior experience is not necessary but concrete evidence of the desired skills is. This is likely to be a suitable role for someone of up to 3 years experience, but will vary by individual.


 


Your key activities will involve:




  • (30%) Design and execution of campaigns designed to achieve the companies growth and engagement goals.




  • (25%) Helping optimise our content for search, including making sure the journalists are formatting their pieces and headlines correctly, trying to get pieces on Apolitical republished, and trying to get external organisations to link to Apolitical




  • (10%) Researching policy challenges (the key issues, organisations, people) to support all your growth and engagement activity like generating ideas, writing messaging, finding speakers and participants, and liaising confidently with high profile public servants, academics, and practitioners.




  • (15%) Writing messaging to communicate the significance of a policy issue in a concise and engaging way, and setting up engaging email communications.




  • (15%) Ringleading distribution across the company to promote a campaigns - including reaching out to distribution partners, on social media, and engaging our community.




  • (5%) Tracking and evaluation of your interventions.




 


Who we are looking for -


You have these essential traits which you will further hone in the role:




  • Creative - You enjoy thinking of new ways to engage public servants.




  • Strategic - Your ideas match the reality of the resources available to you. You can see how others’ work can support your goals.




  • Organised and attentive executor and project manager - You enjoy zooming in and executing on multiple projects, as well as zooming out (being strategic).




  • Excellent communicator - Your communication is persuasive and compelling. You can credibly communicate with seniors. You are great at working with other teams.




  • Data and goal driven - You enjoy assessing the effectiveness of your effort by analysing data.




  • Passion -You are enthusiastic about i) building and engaging specific audiences through digital methods, and ii) learning about policy and the public service.




 


In addition you will develop skills in:




  • Using email software, like Hubspot




  • Basic coding




  • Running effective experiments and build a new function in a startup




  • Building online communities




  • Public speaking and moderation (through preparing the speakers and moderators, and possibly, in the future leading online events yourself)

items.title: Social Media Marketing Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
DESCRIPTION


We're currently hiring for a Social Media Executive to join our Marketing team in London. You'll be charged with management of our social media accounts which will also include content creation, scheduling and distribution as well as analysis and reporting of social media performance and activity. 


 


About us


 


Since launching in 2014 we have been on a mission to fight financial crime on a global scale. In that time, we have raised over $35m in funding, opened offices in New York, Singapore and Romania, and have grown to over 200 employees, and we're not stopping there!


 


We aim to grow to over 500 employees in the next 18 months, as we continue to fight the good fight against financial crime and help make compliance less painful for our client base of over 450 customers across 45 different countries. We're leveraging game-changing tech to help us on our mission, building our platform around AI, Machine Learning and Big Data, meaning that our platform is unrivaled in it’s capabilities.


 


No fight against crime is complete without the right values, and we take ours very seriously!


 


Focus on the Team- We're Collaborative, Human, and Humble


Kaizen- We're Curious, Proactive and Agile


Deliver Results- We're Tenacious, Accountable and Focused


 


We can only defeat financial crime if we have the right people with the right values in place to do so, and we're committed to investing in passionate people who are experts in their field. Our culture and working environment is second to none- Don't believe us? See what our employees have to say on Glassdoor


 


 


The Role


As part of our growth an exciting position has opened up on our UK marketing team. ComplyAdvantage is seeking a Social Media Executive as we scale our marketing function. You will own social activity and management for the company, creating, scheduling and distributing engaging, snappy, and interesting content to our customers, prospects and followers.



Not only will you own social media management for the business, you'll also help with design and content creation so worlking knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite would be very helpful, including Illustrator and Photoshop. You will work alongside our in-house Graphic Designer to help create engaging content for our social channels. 


If you know how to communicate with content, have experience managing social media, want to continue to innovate and learn and are self-motivated, you’ll fit in well and have fun!




REQUIREMENTS


What You Will Do



  • Your time will be split between short-form content creation and content planning for social media, creating assets with a designer and writing fantastic short-form copy.

  • You will be responsible for managing the company social media calendar and accounts, including LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and any other relevant platforms.

  • Plan and create content to effectively deliver ComplyAdvantage’s message globally, primarily industry-focused - e.g. Banking, Insurance, Gaming

  • Work with all other areas of marketing to understand and effectively support their in-country campaigns and activity with appropriate content.

  • You'll also be responsible for reporting activity and performance against the campaigns you run and the copy you post, to ensure we are performing as we should be in the future.


Who You Are


 



  • Ideally minimum 1 years experience with B2B multi-channel content creation

  • Experience managing social media accounts for your company (Including LinkedIn, Twitter, etc)

  • A B2B technology marketing background - with the ability to imagine the possibilities for customers using new technology.

  • Previous experience generating marketing content focusing on Fintech sectors is a plus.




BENEFITS



  • 25 days holiday

  • Share Options

  • Flexible working

  • Company Health Insurance

  • Company pension scheme

items.content:
At Karhoo, we are creating the largest marketplace for ground transportation, allowing brands in Travel, Hospitality and other industries to offer taxi rides from their websites and mobile apps, virtually anywhere in the world.


By aggregating fleets and digitising the booking / riding experience, we create new business opportunities for the private and public sectors, and improve the mobility experience for millions of clients and citizens. Furthermore, we only work with licensed fleets and help them compete with ruthless disruptors.


Karhoo reinvented themselves to get out of administration in January 2017, funded by RCI Bank and Services, the financial services provider for the Groupe Renault brands in the world and for the Nissan Group brands in Europe.


Product Designer



  • As part of the product design team, you will create experiences for our consumer-facing partner apps, our in-house app, the website and internal fleet management solutions 

  • Work with cross-functional teams 

  • Apply user research findings whenever possible

  • Develop and apply a design system


Experience


It would be great if you:



  • Have at least 3 years of experience in a UI role

  • Experience in UX and Interaction Design and willing to learn more about it

  • Value craftsmanship as much as conceptual thinking 

  • Are a team player

  • Speak your mind 

  • Learn and share 

  • Have successfully shipped products 

  • Master your tools


It would be a bonus if you:



  • Have experience with complex data-driven products (dashboards, mapping, location-based services)

  • Experience with remote teams 


Company Benefits



  • Competitive salary

  • Your own L&D budget

  • 25 days holiday

  • Pension scheme

  • Private medical insurance

  • Dental insurance

  • Travel insurance

  • Life insurance

  • A modern toolset (Sketch, transitioning to Figma, Principle, Invision and FramerX)

  • Regular team events and a friendly bunch of people

  • Free fruit, free Coffee (an In-House barista) and a roof-top terrace in our WeWork Office in Paddington

items.title: Graduate Marketing Coordinator (Edinburgh)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Location


Edinburgh


Description


We’re on a mission: to change how the world works. 


We want to give people the freedom to access the world’s best work spaces, anywhere, any time, at the touch of a button. Communicating to the world is at the heart of delivering that. 


We’re a growing startup so we’re looking for a well rounded Marketing graduate capable of growing with us from the ground up.


About Desana


Desana gives our customers access to a network of great work space when they want it, where they want it, through a single monthly subscription. We do that by supporting coworking spaces, taking their spare inventory and giving our customers fluid access to it.


We’re a growing startup based between London, Edinburgh, and Stockholm but we aim to become a globally relevant company by disrupting the way people think about, and access, the places they work. We're looking for the best people to join us on our journey.


With prior experience in startups ourselves, we’re keen to do things the right way from the very start. That’s why we believe in openness and transparency in everything we do, from salary to communications, to processes.


Why Join Us?


We’re at the forefront of a new wave of innovation in the office space sector which is already undergoing tremendous change and significant growth. Join us to not only grow our brand which is changing the ways people work, but by living and breathing the innovation as you work flexibly, autonomously, and (as much as the job demands) remotely yourself. We pride ourselves in radical open-ness and strive to create a company that fulfils its users, partners, and employees. 


The Role


Marketing done well isn’t always marketing done by the book. It’s out-of-the-box, inherently unique thinking that makes the biggest impact.


We’re giving you the chance to flex your creativity. We want to build a brand that’s memorable and impactful to both our customers and the workspaces that we’re partnered with. To do that, we need someone that’s motivated to:



  • Work with the founders and get to know the business really well.

  • Work with our consumer groups, and workspace partners and will learn how to speak with them directly through email and LinkedIn, and indirectly through our social media channels.

  • Work as a member of the team to produce a marketing strategy plan - you’ll be in charge of delivering it.

  • Work together to generate creative ideas and to identify new, high impact ways (and channels) to grow the business and engage potential customers.

  • Run our social media platforms. 

  • Work with photographers and videographers to create high-quality, engaging media. 

  • Create and manage a content calendar for analytically focussed, multi-channel marketing campaigns.

  • Reach out directly to potential customers and create a pipeline for the team to meet with them.

  • Participate daily in a 10 minute whole team “stand up” call, wherever you are. Our team are regularly in London so it will be up to you to touch-base with us and take charge of your days.


About You



  • You have a solid understanding of marketing: you have a relevant degree and, ideally, can already demonstrate experience in delivering marketing campaigns.

  • You know what’s effective: you have experience with marketing automation platforms, CDPs, and attribution tools and it would be advantageous if you are able to make good recommendations on different platforms.

  • You get the importance of data: you understand growth metrics, A/B testing, and statistics and you’ve delivered effective data-driven strategies and marketing campaigns across multiple media channels for for the companies you’ve worked with.

  • You can design: not essential for the role but it would be extremely advantageous if you have design experience that can be applied directly to content creation.

  • You have CRM experience / awareness: not essential but would be really useful.

  • You’re personable: a fun, enthusiastic people-person.

  • You’re self-starting & self-motivated: you’re confident in your abilities, willing to take on responsibilities, and manage your own agendas and work scopes. Actively seek and respond to feedback.

  • You can communicate diligently: you’re able to understand the importance of maintaining regular communication with our team, our partners, affiliates, and our customers. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

  • You’re never complacent: you strive to recognise that things can always be better than they currently are and have the confidence to present solutions to any weaknesses or inefficiencies that you see.

  • You have a growth mindset: a desire to grow both personally and professionally.


Desana benefits



  • Share options in the business if the role were to become full time.

  • Flexible and remote work hours with a strong focus on work-life balance.

  • We’re establishing complete salary transparency across the company with clear progression paths.

  • Team drinks, events and trips.

  • Free access to the app and our network of workspaces.

items.title: Product Manager
items.content:
We are an international team of lawyers and technologists, working to reinvent the startup law experience from the ground up. Clara graduated from Techstars Dubai’s class of 2019 and closed a USD 2,000,000 seed round before expanding into London. We move fast (but thoughtfully), and are looking for a talented and impact-oriented Product Manager to join us.


The Role:


You will be the product owner for your area, initially managing a defined roadmap which will ultimately become yours to own and shape through the use of data, internal feedback and market assessment. 



  • Collaborate with internal teams to shape, scope and prioritise new product opportunities within the broader product roadmap.

  • Develop written user requirements and define success metrics for new product features, moving quickly with Design and Engineering teams to execute, test and validate your ideas and address any blockers through problem solving and coordination with your stakeholders.

  • Research, troubleshoot, diagnose and recommend solutions to increasingly complex business problems.

  • Ensure user acceptance testing is performed prior to go-live launch of new features.

  • Assist in prioritising enhancements and triaging bug fixes.

  • Monitor key conversion metrics and A/B tests to support in the continued optimisation of your product area. continual optimization of the product and business plan.


We are looking for the following:



  • At least three years of demonstrable experience of managing features and/or products throughout the full development lifecycle in a B2B or SaaS environment.

  • Excited about the idea of taking a broad product vision and leading the ideation, technical development, and launch of products that are making a dent in the future of the internet

  • Experience integrating usability studies, research, market analysis and customer development into product requirements

  • Obsessive over continuous product improvement and the ability to optimise for shipping a portfolio of small, medium and large releases

  • Data driven: using both quantitative and qualitative data to inform decisions and priorities.

  • Growth mindset: demonstrable experience of delivering products, features and/or optimisations with the results to back it up.

  • Naturally curious: someone who wants to truly understand their product – how it works, who uses it and hypothesising on how it can be improved

  • Hands-on experience working with agile methodologies, but isn’t dogmatic about a single approach.

  • A basic understanding of key startup legal concepts such as equity and intellectual property is a plus.

  • Experience working with remote development teams preferred.

items.title: Lead Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=10}
items.content:
You could join us join at an exciting time for the business. We are active across 16 countries, with the USA our largest single market closely followed by the UK. The success of new launch titles in the past 12 months – particularly Where Are You and our new Bedtime storybook- mean that the Board and team are hungry for data-driven insight to guide their next moves.


This role comes with a wide remit to lead;


- Analytics strategy & development : Lead the development of Customer analytics, working with internal Data specialists to define a roadmap for more sophisticated analysis, predictive modelling and data


- Delivery of key customer Insight – to the Senior management team, Product leads and Marketing Group


- Continuing to develop our Attribution & LTV models


- Looker BI : You will lead & manage our Looker BI reporting tool. There has been a significant investment in training across the team and in development of a series of dashboards & reports, which help all members of the team self-serve daily and hourly insight. You are the go-to person for support on Looker, to Quality check outputs and to help create new reports as needed.


- Marketing & CRM Performance measurement & team meetings: Jointly lead [along with the Head of CRM ] a bi-monthly Marketing and CRM activity review, presenting to all the commercial and marketing group. This covers major initiatives, launches, CRM campaigns etc. Every 6 months, this extends to a full Review for the MD , FD and team.


- Data & Analytics stack : Oversee the management of a full data analytics & technology toolkit. You’ll lead best in class solutions to help us gather, store, process, analyse and share through the business.


- Team leader & collaborator, particularly with CRM & Marketing heads : You’ll work in close collaboration with our VP of Marketing, CFO, Search and Digital marketing specialists to develop customer-centric strategies that deliver against sales and profitability targets. You’ll heavily support in setting strategies for pricing/promotions, product and marketing.


- Make the business case to build the Data & Analytics function


As value to the business and ROI is proven, we are open to expanding the analytics team


Hopefully you will have some or all of the following:


· Skilled Analyst with hands on experience of BI & Reporting tools - ideally within digital product, marketing and/or trade (more than one not essential, but desirable) with 5+ years experience


· Highly numerate, ideally with a bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in Maths, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or similar


· Regular & strong user of SQL, Python; Understanding of, and practical use of, Python, R , SQL and/or similar programming language


· Advanced Excel and/or Google Sheets skills are essential, for the manipulation of and sharing of insights/data to the team. Wonderbly operates on the Google sheets/slides/Docs /Gmail environment


· Experience with managing data in a data warehouse, including identification of data quality issues and data structure improvements.


· Fast learner or expertise of using BI tools - particularly Looker [Tableau and other similar ‘drag & drop’ tools are also a positive]


· Campaign measurement experience : track record of measuring large seasonal marketing campaigns a plus; understanding the importance of seasonal bias and time periods will be key to this role


· Experience with the Google & Amazon tech stack a major positive - especially Google Analytics , Google BigQuery and Amazon AWS


· Experience of machine learning and modelling techniques a plus


Your Personality


As we move out of early start-up phase, we are looking for big personalities that will be the future leaders of the business, as we grow in scale, launch in new areas [grown-ups books etc] and across markets. To thrive at Wonderbly, we are seeking candidates who can demonstrate some or all of the following;


· Proactive self starter who readily takes ownership of key projects


· Great at prioritising & managing requests : show track record of handling multiple requests on your time, managing via Trello or other work management tools


· Naturally inquisitive about Wonderbly products & customers ; seen as the ‘customer expert’ in the business within a few months


· Strong communicator to deliver insights and recommendations to stakeholders


· Able to work within a creative, lively environment : managing and building relationships with people who maybe less comfortable with numbers than you


· Confident enough to Identify opportunities for the business, through analysis and modelling - whether in product, marketing, or trade (pricing & promotions)


· Helpful & a patient trainer: Provide know how and help for others to use data in their decision making


Why join Wonderbly?


Asi , David and the Founders of Wonderbly believe strongly in the culture that drove the success of the business since 2016. It’s that energy & belief to tackle big opportunities that attract people to join and stay.


· Each year you'll accrue a generous 28 days holiday, plus 8 bank holidays


· We support being active ; with numerous running groups, gym lunches and yoga in the office. We have some sparkling new showers on site , secure bike parking facilities and are part of the Cycle To Work scheme


· Childcare vouchers, health insurance are also available


· Matched pension contribution


· You’ll get a sweet training budget to enable you to do your best work and develop as a professional, combined with weekly Lunch and Learns


· We have heaps of snacks, drinks, and comforts in our fully-stocked kitchen


· PLUS team lunches and breakfasts. Every Thursday, our Studio Manager orders some super delish food and we gorge ourselves.


· We love having dogs in the office [well behaved ones anyway]!


Equal opportunities employer


Our team are committed to providing equal opportunities for employment regardless of of race, religion or belief, ethnic origin, disability, family structure, socio-economic status, age, nationality or citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis (it's the law, but it's also just the right thing to do).


If you have a disability, caring duties, or any other additional need that require consideration, please do let us know.


And to see more on our business and products, please do visit


www.Wonderbly.com


Summary of position



  • Reporting into the VP Marketing, you will play a central role in supporting data-driven Strategy , marketing & commercial decisions at Board level and with the team

  • Competitive + benefits

  • 28 days paid holiday per year + 8 bank holidays

  • Start date : June 2019 [although Contract support mean later dates considered]

  • Would consider Temp to Perm candidates

  • Fantastic office and open kitchen; weekly free lunch & team events


Who are Wonderbly?


Wonderbly is a unique, award winning start-up that lives on the intersection of storytelling, engineering, digital and print. We are building a global personal-publishing business that brings millions of people into our products - as co-creators and audiences We are best known for our first title, Lost My Name, which is read by over 4 million children and their families globally. We are releasing a new title every few months and now have 18 books in our range.


Our focus in the near future is with the children’s book market - creating stunning, uncompromisingly high quality and technically ambitious personalised books for kids.


We’re in the business of sparking kids’ imaginations; inspiring them to read & to learn as well as build confidence and self-belief. May 2019 sees a relaunch of our website and material to back up that positioning


Life as the Lead Analyst for Wonderbly


You join at an exciting time for the business. We are active across 16 countries, with the USA our largest single market closely followed by the UK. The success of new launch titles in the past 12 months – particularly Where Are You and our new Bedtime storybook- mean that the Board and team are hungry for data-driven insight to guide their next moves.

You are the go-to person for support on Looker, to Quality check outputs and to help create new reports as needed.

This covers major initiatives, launches, CRM campaigns etc. Every 6 months, this extends to a full Review for the MD , FD and team.

You’ll heavily support in setting strategies for pricing/promotions, product and marketing.


- Make the business case to build the Data & Analytics function


As value to the business and ROI is proven, we are open to expanding the analytics team


 




REQUIREMENTS


Experience & Analytics skills required


· Skilled Analyst with hands on experience of BI & Reporting tools - ideally within digital product, marketing and/or trade (more than one not essential, but desirable) with 5+ years experience


· Highly numerate, ideally with a bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in Maths, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or similar

BENEFITS

items.title: Network Growth Manager (Coworking Space)

items.content:
Location


Based in London but plenty of opportunity for travelling across the UK and Europe. Adventure awaits! 


Description


We want to give people the freedom to access the world’s best work spaces, anywhere, any time, at the touch of a button. 


One of the most fundamental aspects of our business is how well we understand the needs and intricacies of the work spaces we partner with. Your role will be to build and maintain great relationships with a network of the UKs best coworking and flexible workspaces. 


We’re looking for an energetic and passionate person to help us grow the number of great places our customers access through the Desana app so that they have the best experience possible.


Desana


We’re a growing startup based between London, Edinburgh, and Stockholm. We aim to become a globally relevant company by disrupting the way people think about, and access, the places they work. We're looking for the best people to join us on our journey.


With prior experience in startups ourselves, we’re keen to do things the right way from the very start. That’s why we believe in openness and transparency in everything we do, from salary to communications, to processes.


Why Join Us


We’re at the forefront of the new wave of innovation in a sector that’s already undergoing tremendous change and significant growth. Join us to not only grow the network of workspaces that are already changing the ways people work, but by living and breathing that transformation as you work flexibly, autonomously, and (as much as the job demands) remotely yourself. We pride ourselves in radical open-ness and are creating  a company that fulfils its users, partners, and employees.


The Role


Growing the Network


We want to build a network that’s genuinely valuable to our customers and the operators that we work with. To do that, we need someone that’s motivated to:  



  • Increase the number of workspaces on the Desana platform each month across the UK. 

  • Collaborate in the shaping and delivery of a scalable space onboarding and retention  strategies - regular communication with workspaces on the network; in person, LinkedIn, by phone, by email, and through events.

  • Maintain CRM to track relationships and opportunities.

  • Create and deliver result orientated “sprints” (tasks) based on the company’s 6 and 12 month goals. 


Communication



  • Working directly with team to incessantly improve brand and workspace onboarding experience / interaction. 

  • Regular monitoring and updating of our task management system.

  • Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly meetings that effectively communicate data informed outcomes from onboarding strategies.

  • Participate daily in a 10 minute whole team “stand up” call, wherever you are.


Industry Awareness



  • Consistently develop wider awareness of coworking industry trends; meticulous attention to specific triggers for workspace / operator types. 

  • Be able to identify and respond to micro-indicators of change.


About You



  • You have hospitality or related experience: If you’ve worked in the coworking / flexible workspace industry or in a workspace brokering environment that would be more advantageous but experience in hospitality would be great if not. 

  • You have experience in sales: it would be great if you can bring experience in managing operational tasks in a sales/relationship management role.

  • You can stay cool and deliver effectively: you have the ability to work to a deadline, prioritising workloads according to different criteria. 

  • You’re data-driven: you understand growth metrics, A/B testing, and statistics and will use these skills to devise effective on-boarding strategies. 

  • You have CRM experience / awareness: particularly Hubspot. Not essential but would be really useful.

  • You’re self-starting & self-motivated: you’re confident in your abilities, willing to take initiative, to take on your own responsibilities, and manage your own agendas and work scopes. Actively seek and respond to feedback.

  • You can communicate diligently: you’re able to understand the importance of maintaining regular communication with our team, our partners, and the workspace operators in our network. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

  • You’re never complacent: you strive to recognise that things can always be better than they currently are and have the confidence to present solutions to any weaknesses or inefficiencies that you see.

  • You have a growth mindset: a desire to grow both personally and professionally.

  • You’re resilient: you appreciate the pace and challenges of working in a startup and know when to seize the right opportunities in a such a fast-paced environment, while working to exceed the expectations of the workspace operators we partner with.

  • You have a good network: if you have a good contact base in the UK coworking / property sector, that would be advantageous but not essential.


Desana Benefits



  • Share options in the business.

  • Flexible and remote work hours with a strong focus on work-life balance.

  • We’re establishing complete salary transparency across the company with clear progression paths.

  • Team drinks, events, and trips.

  • Free access to the app and our network of workspaces.


Think you’re the right person for the role? Send us your CV and a brief cover and tell us why.

items.title: Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
DESCRIPTION


Hubble is one of the UK’s leading PropTech scaleups and we’re changing the face of commercial property. We’ve raised over £6m in venture funding from the most respected investors in technology and real estate. Our vision is to create a world where everyone has the right workplace to succeed. The beginning of this journey is our online platform to help businesses rent, manage and share office space in London.


As a product designer at Hubble, you will have the opportunity to add your magic to every stage of the design process. Working closely with product managers and tech leads, you will have the autonomy to conjure up functional yet delightful solutions to genuine user problems. All the while working towards business goals.


Your role will of course include wire-framing, prototyping and spinning up high fidelity designs and assets but this is only a small part. Through user testing and internal feedback sessions, you will be responsible for continually testing ideas and assumptions and mixing your findings back into the designs. You will be able to use these findings to explain and defend your design rationale with the wider team and stakeholders. Excellent communication skills, explaining complex solutions in simple terms and the ability to challenge people in the wider team at all levels, backed with evidence, are all crucial.


Strong visual UI design is a given, but beyond that you will be instrumental in following and helping to build out the Hubble design system. You will work closely with our engineers and regularly pair with them to help set the rules and ingredients for new design assets and components. A keen eye for detail is important but you should understand the trade-offs between striving for pixel-perfection against good enough to ship fast.


You will possess a functional but creative mind and a no-fear attitude to your work. With a scientific approach to product design, don't be afraid to fail-fast and learn. You will feel empowered to push the needle, and suggest wildcard ideas that may make some colleagues squirm, but always be grounded in the possible. We build our products in an iterative, continuous deployment style, but as a designer you should always be thinking of where we want to be rather than just what's next.


Our vision to create a world where everyone has the right workplace to succeed starts from within. We're a friendly and diverse team. We go out for team lunches, monthly book, climbing, gaming and DnD clubs (among others) and are always looking for more ways to knowledge share and have fun as a group :). We host quarterly away days (organised by different team members) which are a great opportunity to chat with people who you rarely cross paths with and ensure that our business vision is always clear and transparent to the whole company. Although we're still only small, our team has a mix of different backgrounds, races, and genders and we want to continue this as we grow.


 




REQUIREMENTS



  • Have 3+ years experience in designing digital products.

  • Fully proficient in designing for various screen sizes with a mobile first approach to responsive design.

  • Solid understanding of UX design principles.

  • Good understanding of atomic design and front end architecture.

  • Expertise in the tools of the trade, sketch, invision etc. UI animations desirable but not required.

  • Have the confidence to explain and defend design decisions to colleagues at all levels.

  • Experience in mapping out user journeys and flows.

  • Have experience conducting user research and synthesising customer feedback.

  • An understanding of engineering processes and how stuff gets built.

  • Experience of working in a marketplace or SaaS company is a plus (but not necessary).

  • A self-aware, motivated and empathetic person.




 


BENEFITS


We make sure everyone in the team is comfortable and has the best environment for them. We offer flexible hours, remote working and have a relaxed attitude to taking holiday - focusing only on whether work gets done. Benefits can be tweaked on an individual basis depending on what makes you most productive. Here are some of the things we offer:



  • Remuneration competitive with industry and level of experience.

  • Macbook, peripherals and standing desk.

  • Expense budget & travel.

  • Subsidised Therapy

  • Noise-cancelling headphones.

  • Spotify Premium or Apple Music.

  • Kindle Unlimited + free professional books.

  • Health Insurance & Pension.

  • Cycle to Work scheme.


 


We truly value our people and company culture. Want to know more about why Hubble is a great place to work? Check out this recent blog post.


Hubble is an equal opportunities employer. We are a diverse bunch of people who are committed to maintaining a welcoming culture of inclusion and equality. We encourage applications from anyone that meets the requirements for the role.

items.title: Social Media Manager
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Berlin, Dalia develops B2B/SaaS solutions to facilitate market and opinion research in >100 countries. We harness the app economy and advanced data science to distribute millions of micro-surveys worldwide to gather and analyze real-time data on consumer attitudes, public opinion, and market trends. Backed by some of Europe’s leading venture capital firms, Dalia is one of Germany’s fastest-growing tech startups with a team from 32 different countries driven by one mission: to generate information that helps us better understand the world around us.


Dalia is on the search for a Social Media Manager to invigorate our presence on all social media channels to better engage with our target communities.


The journey that awaits you



  • Despite a wealth of source material for spreading the word about Dalia to prospective clients, talent, and journalists, we aren’t consistently active in sharing them across channels, such as social media, where these audiences are looking. That’s where you come in.

  • As Dalia’s first dedicated Social Media Manager, you will act as our guru on all social media channels and content.

  • Working across multiple teams, you will craft and disseminate stories about our team, our research, and products that generate interest and engagement from our target audiences. An exciting opportunity to leave your mark and build buzz around one of Berlin’s most buzz-worthy organisations.


Your challenge



  • Significantly ramp up Dalia’s presence on key social media platforms including Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Glassdoor, Instagram, and others. You will revamp our pages to appeal to key audiences and set into motion a regular schedule of original, compelling content on these platforms. 

  • Work with stakeholders across research, design, talent acquisition, and engineering teams to craft stories that can be told via numerous mediums (video, graphics, articles, etc.) and spread through social media channels. You will also ensure consistency of style and tone across all content within each Dalia sub-brand.

  • Set up infrastructure and processes around social media at Dalia which can ultimately enable teams to publish content independently. 


Your profile includes...



  • Extensive experience managing the social media function for an up-and-coming organisation, with a knack for conceptualising and executing unique, compelling stories and campaigns which are tailored to these platforms. 

  • Native-level English writing skills, with the ability to write catchy copy for a variety of audiences. 

  • Some graphic design experience would be a plus. Experience with data-based storytelling would also be a bonus, but not required.

  • Are structured in an unstructured environment: you are highly organised and able to work autonomously without micro-management in a rapidly changing and often ambiguous environment.

  • Integrity and professionalism: you can make independent decisions on how to represent Dalia to the outside world as a trustworthy, values-driven organisation.

  • Growth-hacker mindset: You take a holistic approach to finding solutions through rapid experimentation. 


What else makes Dalia awesome?



  • No "ninja" culture - teamwork here is paramount, and that means others will help you when you need it. Mentorship is always available.

  • Occasional remote work is possible.

  • A well-stocked kitchen, where you can request grocery items.

  • A team boat that we built ourselves!

items.title: Growth Hacker
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
We are looking for an experienced and creative Growth Hacker to join our team. You will be responsible for developing and implementing our Social Media strategy in order to increase our online presence and improve our marketing and sales efforts, within our developer communities, as well as supporting other growth initiatives such as marketing campaigns and our content management execution.


Responsibilities include:




  • Develop, implement and manage our social media strategy




  • Define important social media KPIs - measure our success




  • Implement acquisition programs via paid and organic marketing channels




  • Be up to date with the latest social media best practices and technologies / tools




  • Monitor SEO and user engagement and suggest content optimization




  • Communicate with industry professionals and influencers via social media to create a strong network




  • Support / drive marketing campaigns taking a data-driven approach 




  • Collaborate across Marketing, Sales and Product teams






Skills & Experience:




  • Solid experience in Performance/Growth Marketing roles in a tech company. 




  • Expertise in multiple social media platforms and best practices




  • In-depth knowledge of SEO, keyword research, Google Analytics, web traffic metrics / KPIs




  • Familiarity and experience engaging with developers and technical communities




  • Familiarity with web design and publishing




  • Bonus: 




    • You have an engineering background or working in an engineering business




    • You’ve worked at a marketing-led subscription business






What’s it like to work at Ably?


Ably is entering a new phase of growth led by an experienced senior team from the likes of E-consultancy and ThoughtWorks. You’ll be part of a successful, highly motivated, and extremely collaborative team.


To provide the infrastructure required for the next generation of the internet, to tell the world about it, and to support everyone inside Ably to do so we hire people who are ready and capable of taking on challenging problems in a high-growth environment.


We want to work in a company of inclusive people who treat each other well. We’re building a company with a diverse set of people who value:




  • Ownership and impact of work. You have real autonomy and ownership over your work with a visible impact inside Ably, and externally on products powered by Ably that you use in your daily life.




  • An environment to thrive. Modern, comfy office in the heart of Camden. Excellent transport links, Camden Food Market with over 100 food stalls and restaurants, and multiple work spaces to match your working style.




  • Work from home when you need. We offer the option to work from home when you need to be home, but the role is office-based.




  • Work is varied and challenging as we’re solving hard, complex problems that push the limits of what’s possible with today’s software and infrastructure.




Perks:




  • Health insurance




  • Gym membership




  • Regular company away days and social events




  • Weekly team breakfast or lunch




  • Free drinks and snacks in the office




  • Ongoing professional development (training, events, conferences)




  • 25 days of paid annual leave (33 days including bank holidays)




  • Company contributions towards your pension




  • Your choice of high quality tech kit to work on




Ably has a culture that values employee freedom and responsibility. Apply to talk to us to see if this role on an impactful and collaborative team is right for you.

items.content:
At Chattermill we use cutting-edge AI technology to give leading companies the key to improving their customer experience.  We work with many of the most exciting companies in the world (Uber, HelloFresh, Transferwise, Skyscanner, and Deliveroo to name a handful!) and are passionate about helping them put their customers’ at the heart of their decision making.


In four short years, we’ve grown from two co-founders to a team of 40 (and counting) bright and diverse individuals.  We have big plans and are now looking for a Growth Associate to join our highly functioning Growth team and work to amplify our demand generation.  


As a Growth Associate, you will:



  • Strategically identify new leads and plan demand generation cadences to generate interest in Chattermill

  • Take ownership of our go-to-market tactics across varying sectors and geographies 

  • Make an impact in revenue growth by assisting the Sales Development and Growth teams to prepare and tailor effective approaches for new prospects 

  • Work with the team to create impactful content for outbound marketing 


What we’re looking for:



  • A creative thinker who loves coming up with new approaches and solutions 

  • A self-starter who is eager to learn in a hands on and autonomous environment

  • An entrepreneurial spirit with a knack for spotting opportunities

  • A clear and effective communicator

  • You’re resourceful and able to find information and tools 

  • You’re ambitious, goal oriented and have a strong aversion to failing

  • You have a great work ethic and are driven to achieve extraordinary results early on in your career


Nice to have:



  • Degree level education

  • 1+ years of experience in a competitive professional environment

  • Prior experience working in a SaaS or startup environment

  • A good understanding of Customer Experience and a passion for helping businesses improve in this area


Why join us?



  • A competitive salary 

  • Great progression opportunities - we want you to grow with us!

  • 25 days holiday (in addition to bank holidays)

  • Company pension plan 

  • A big focus on personal development including a £500 development budget and biweekly Breakfast and Learns

  • Perks including discounts on cinema tickets, utilities and more

  • Flexible working conditions and the opportunity to work from home

  • Lovely office (with great coffee, events, and a rooftop terrace) 

  • Office wellness events like Monday Mindfulness and yoga

  • Quarterly Company Socials planned by our great colleagues!

items.content:
DESCRIPTION


ABOUT MARSHMALLOW:


We're a VC-backed digital insurer of the future. We use machine learning, automation, our own technology stack and comprehensive data integrations to be quicker, cheaper and fairer to customers, and need product managers to plot a course through the chaos to take advantage of countless opportunities.


We're a team of 35 with experience at the likes of Intercom, Monzo, Transferwise, Depop, HP backed by investors who have backed Spotify, Monzo, Adyen and others. Over the next 2 years we will grow the team to 150, as we expand our revenue product offering and geography - pushing further in to the multi-trillion $ insurance market.


WHAT'S THE ROLE? 


You will be working in the pricing and growth team; working alongside data scientists, pricing experts and engineers to ensure rapid growth whilst delivering a good return on capital for our insurers and re-insurers. This means defining roadmaps, prioritising model builds, querying new data sources, negotiating with partners, managing integrations and motivating a high-performance, cross-functional team


THE CURRENT PRODUCT TEAM


We are a team of *one* currently, please see here: https://www.linkedin.com/in/williamnialloconnor/


YOU'LL BE...



  • Defining problems for the team

  • Working on high-level product strategy to deliver huge growth



  • Managing the roadmap: capture work from a wide range of inputs, understand and prioritise this work so your teams is always working on the most impactful projects

  • Deeply ingrained in the problems that you’re tackling research and regular interaction with customers; defining and framing those problems for the teams

  • Scoping solutions in the smallest possible state to ship to customers as early as you can.


YOU SHOULD APPLY IF...



  • You have at least 3 years as a product manager used to delivering customer centric, meaningful products

  • Have a maths, economics or similarly numeracy based degree

  • Have worked in a data-focused team, before

  • Have an interest in financial services


WE WILL GET BONUS POINTS IF YOU...



  • You have experience moving and living in a foreign country

  • Have worked in a fintech company before


OUR CULTURE


https://www.notion.so/getmarshmallow/Company-Values-e798b5c1fce54e8789274cf83c978831


BENEFITS 



  • Competitive salary 

  • Stock options 

  • Health Insurance 

  • Working from home 

  • Monthly Socials 

  • 32 day holiday allowance (inc bank holidays) 

  • Pension 

  • Cycle to work scheme 

  • Unlimited books 

  • Equipment you need to get the job done 

  • Weekly knowledge sharing presentations 

  • Friday all-hands with snacks 

  • Learning and training supported 

  • Fruit, snacks and soft drinks in the office 


LOGISTICS



  • Our process consists of a phone interview, an onsite and a final round to make sure we're both sure interview. We will endeavour to be communicative and transparent throughout :)

items.title: Marketing Intern
items.content:
The Intro is the most efficient way to find someone for a date: wave goodbye to swiping, we're making it easier and faster to meet someone in person for a truly human connection.


We are looking for marketing interns to help drive users to the beta version of The Intro’s mobile app. You can work remotely but will interact regularly with our experienced CEO, helping to raise awareness and drive new users to the app, using a combination of digital marketing and partnerships.


If you're looking to learn more about marketing this would be a great opportunity and we are happy to be flexible around your other commitments.

items.content:
About us


We are on a journey to make pet healthcare more accessible, and we want you to help us! Did you know that only 8% of health issues are seen by a veterinary professional? In real numbers: pets experience 24 issues per year, but only 2 of them make it to the vet. This isn’t because people are bad at being pet owners — going to the vet can be expensive, and takes a lot of effort, and sometimes it’s even embarrassing. We want to remove all these barriers that stop pet parents from seeking expert care so that our pets can live the long and healthy lives they deserve.


 


Our mission is to empower vets to advocate for their patients wherever and whenever suits them. Our current product provides an app-based approach that allows vets to interact with their patients through a combination of chat and video consultations. The future holds lots of exciting opportunities to expand this into the go-to app for all things pet care related. Gula recently raised a pre-seed round of funding, and off the back of that, we are looking to build the beginnings of our product team, which is where you come in. With a goal like allowing pets to live healthier lives, a fantastic experience across all our user facing products is going to be key to overcoming challenges in changing the way pet owners think about how they interact with their care providers.


 


Our customer facing products right now are in the form of iOS & Android apps written in React Native, with a web-app soon to follow. We envisage most pet owners interacting with their vets through digital means via their mobile devices. To date, most UX work has been done in Sketch, but we are open to any tooling that can do the job well!


Who we’re looking for


You would be the first Product Designer working at Gula, which gives you the opportunity to help architect the ways of working in the product team and put in place what we would consider to be best practices. Your primary responsibility will be to deliver fantastic user experiences across our range of user-facing products, both to pet owners and vets. Here are some projects you might work on in the next six months:



  • Building the base of a design system for Gula.

  • Designing innovative ways for pet owners to communicate with their vet.

  • Redesigning our website to speak to our target customers better.

  • Crafting the language we use to speak to our users.

  • Testing new propositions with our users.

  • Building a library of assets to be used in marketing material.


You might be perfect for this role if most of these apply to you:



  • You have extensive experience designing for iOS and Android

  • You have extensive experience designing for the responsive web

  • You consider a close relationship with the engineering team mandatory for building great products

  • You have worked in a start-up

  • You have experience with user research

  • You have experience with user testing

  • You would describe yourself as an animal lover

  • You are happy working autonomously

  • You love learning new things


Application process


Once we have reviewed your CV and have decided that we could be a great mutual match, we’d start with a short phone call or coffee to tell you more about what we’re trying to achieve at Gula long-term and also to give you some more details about the role. Then if successful there would be a final stage where we’d spend some more time talking about your design thinking, look at some problems together, and you would meet Gula’s CEO Thom to find out more about our values and to see if you’d fit in.


The benefits



  • Pay £55,000-65,000

  • Stock options

  • Flexible hours

  • Working from home when you want

  • 25 days holiday

  • Pick your own hardware up to £2000

  • Training budget

  • Central London office

items.title: Techy Problem Solver / Product Builder
items.content:
Gokada

 

Techy Problem Solver / Product Builder

verified
Nigeria & Remote
Gokada is a company that seeks to improve the lives of millions of Nigerians through technology. Our first business vertical of motorcycle taxi has been incredibly successful and we've been able to raise $7MM due to our impressive growth. We don't intend to stop there. Gokada has plans to develop technologies to create efficiencies in markets ranging from transport to agriculture. Gokada is at an exciting crossroads and we're looking for talented, intelligent, and out-of-the-box thinkers with some level of technical expertise. Nigeria presents a multitude of opportunities for Gokada. With the right team solving problems in a novel way, we believe Gokada is well-positioned to become one of the premier technology companies coming out of Africa. **The Role** We are seeking problem solvers - individuals who can choose to ignore prior experience and look at a problem objectively to find unique solutions. Having a software development or some technical focus is preferred as Gokada utilizes technology in order to scale potential solutions. The role would entail being in charge of a particular "prototype project" which in itself can turn into a full-fledged business vertical. You will have assistance from experienced management to ensure the success of your prototype. This role requires self-starters that can learn quickly and that do not mind working autonomously. # Responsibilities Build awesome products. # Requirements **The type of person we are looking for:** * Ability to analyze data and make objective decisions * Software development or technology background * Past experience in self-starting a business or project * Highly inquisitive * Motivation to make a positive impact and help people * Empathetic * Quick learner * Highly ambitious * Not satisfied with the status quo - question everything #Salary $80k #Location - Nigeria & Remote

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=10, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
ReCharge Payments

Product Manager


US-only
With over 10,000 online merchants launching subscriptions and over 1,000,000 subscribers powered by ReCharge we're processing tens of millions of dollars in sales every week. Our mission ‘making repeat orders easier for everyone' began four years ago as a bootstrapped startup and today we're at the forefront of recurring billing software with over 100 remote-first employees around the globe. As Product Manager you will be the key strategic and tactical link to ensure your cross functional feature focused engineering team delivers a world-class e-commerce product. Your focus will be delivering products to streamline the ability for merchants to sell and manage subscriptions along with making it easier for customers to manage their subscriptions. We’re looking for teammates who are resourceful, dedicated, and passionate about solving challenging problems. This role is for someone who loves diving into the details while also keeping the big picture in mind. We need a creative and resourceful integrator who will actively listen for problems and then accelerate the team towards solving. Our stack includes: Python, Flask, JavaScript, Vue.js # Responsibilities Live by and champion our values: #ownership, #empathy, #simple-solutions. Create new products and features for merchants to sell and manage subscriptions along with making it easier for customers to manage their subscriptions Work on a product feature team consisting of 5-7 teammates, consisting of software engineers, QA, and design Write epics and detailed user stories for the engineering, QA, and design teams to fully understand the scope of functionality and business drivers, so they can estimate and deliver in a timely manner with high quality Facilitate and work in 2 week sprints with daily stand-ups, bi-weekly grooming and planning sessions. Prioritize features and define requirements for successful delivery Dive into the technical details to understand what is happening Dig into details and figure things out from detailed business logic to a high level technical perspective Turn high level ideas and requirements into technical specifications Effectively communicate and collaborate with all groups in the organization over the entire product development lifecycle­ from requirements gathering to release to rollout training We're an agile, fast growing company and this job description isn't meant to be a complete list of your qualifications or all of the things you'll do # Requirements Typically, 5+ years of product management experience (preferably in SaaS) Track record of launching products rapidly on a SaaS platform with a large number of customers Experience working directly with software engineering teams Experience owning and delivering high-impact software products Ability to work autonomously with a balance of collaboration: You don't need to wait for directions, but know when buy-in is critical Some light programming experience Ability to read if/else statements, JSON, and basic API documentation Motivated by finding ways to produce results Use process to produce results not as an end unto itself Love problem solving, and you are a great problem solver Ability to work remotely and desire to make an impact at a boot-strapped start-up Bachelor’s degree #Salary $140,000 #Location - US-only

items.title: Senior Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Retrium

Senior Product Designer

verified
US-only
### Overview Retrium is a seed-funded startup that helps teams improve their Agile processes by facilitating effective and engaging retrospective meetings. With over 85,000 retrospectives run on our platform, we’re the trusted leader in our market, and we’ve been helping teams continuously improve since 2015. We’re also a small, cross-functional team of passionate and fun people. We have an outstanding leadership team and a dedication to company culture, so you’ll always feel connected to our mission, even though you can work from anywhere. We’re lucky enough to have an awesome product, great revenue growth, high customer satisfaction, low churn, and a recent round of seed investment. Now, we need someone to help us take our product to the next level! The right candidate for the Senior Product Designer position at Retrium is someone who has experience in a product-led organization, can translate complex customer problems into elegant solutions, understands best practices for user interface design, and likes to iterate based on research findings and customer feedback. If you’re a creative problem-solver and want to create a compelling experience for thousands of users, then come be a part of our growing team! ### Benefits We provide amazing benefits, and if you ask the team, they’ll tell you that the greatest benefits we offer employees are the ability to make a meaningful contribution to the company and the opportunities to “Listen. Learn. Teach”, another core value. Our other benefits include: - Competitive salary and equity in a fast-growing, funded startup - Health, dental, and vision insurance coverage for you and your family - Unlimited and minimum vacation policy (we encourage you to ask us about this!) - Flexible, sustainable work hours - Work from home or a co-working office - All the equipment you need to do your job - Continuing education and learning opportunities - Annual company retreats ### Additional Information Retrium is committed to creating a diverse environment where you can “Be Your Amazing Self”, yet another core value. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. # Responsibilities As the first dedicated product designer at Retrium, you’ll help us establish the design processes we’ll use going forward. This means you’ll need to understand the business context, customers, and technical constraints and their impact on design in addition to being a great designer. You’ll work closely with both the engineering and business teams to advocate for design in strategic product decisions and oversee the UI design implementation, so communication and collaboration will be key in this role. Because you’ll own everything related to design, you’ll need to be well versed in customer research, so that you can share your concepts and get feedback from our users. You’ll translate our product’s mission and these customer research insights into an engaging and simple interface for our retrospective platform. In this role, your goal will be to continuously improve the user experience of our application, so that customers can easily adopt, understand, and interact with our product. Day-to-day, you’ll be responsible for creating mockups, user flows, sketches, wireframes, diagrams, customer journey maps, and other design artifacts needed to guide the product development process. The ability to take ideas from low-fidelity outlines to high-fidelity designs using Sketch, Invision, Figma, Framer, or other relevant tooling, is a big part of this role. Because our core values include “Default to Autonomy”, “Bias for Action”, and “Level Up”, you’ll need to be a self-starter who can brainstorm possibilities, execute tasks, and lead the implementation of major features and changes to the product. If you want a job that’s integral to a company’s expansion and growth and where there’s opportunities to learn and make a real impact, then this role is for you! # Requirements More than anything else, we’re looking for a self-motivated person who is passionate about designing a great user experience within Retrium. We believe that the following collection of experiences and abilities would make someone successful in this position. However, we encourage anyone with 5 or more years of professional experience as a Product Designer, UX Designer, or Front-End Engineer to apply. - A portfolio of relevant design work that you’re proud to share that includes digital products, not just websites - A history of successfully shipping products and collaborating cross-functionally with both software engineers and business stakeholders - The passion and drive to learn about Retrium and our customers - A growth mindset with an openness to feedback, learning, and experimentation - Experience with Agile software development processes, from problem definition through to detailed UI and visual design - Experience designing a B2B SaaS product is strongly preferred - Experience in a distributed team and/or high-growth startup would be helpful #Salary 100000 - 140000 #Location - US-only

items.title: Chief Operating Officer for a SaaS company (Full-Time, 100% Remote)
items.content:
Time Doctor

 

Chief Operating Officer for a Saas Company (full-time, 100% )


Worldwide
This is a 100% remote position. You will be managing a company with over 80 people working from 28 different countries. You will need to have meetings with people in multiple time zones. This means that you may need to work several evenings or mornings each week. Otherwise, your work hours will be flexible. You should definitely have extensive management experience as well as experience in managing a technology/software company. # Responsibilities You will be responsible for: * Improving company revenue and profits. * Working with leaders to coach them and improve their results. * Implementing objectives and key results (OKRs). * Recruitment, HR, and retention. * Increasing the level of talent in the company. * Working hands-on in different areas when necessary. # Requirements You should have skills in as many of these areas as possible: * Managing a remote/distributed team * Taking a SaaS product from single-digit millions in revenue to double-digit millions in revenue * Recruiting a remote team * Achieving objectives and key results (OKRs) * Managing a software development team * SaaS product development * Sales management * Marketing #Location - Worldwide

items.title: Product Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=29, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
SkyVerge

 

Product Manager

verified
Worldwide
Howdy We’re the folks at SkyVerge, and we build WordPress plugins that help over 100k+ eCommerce businesses grow and manage their WooCommerce stores. Our team is 100% remote, with 29 people distributed all over the world. We’re looking for a driven, experienced Product Manager to help us maintain, grow, and expand our existing portfolio of 50+ individual extensions. **You should be:** * Empathetic and understanding of the user journey, and excited to collaborate with the team in making it better. * Adept at understanding the difference between user needs and requests. * Able to translate feedback into job stories and acceptance criteria for our engineering team. * Detail-oriented & curious, with a drive to understand and solve challenges for users in a clean, simple, and streamlined way. * A self-starter, comfortable working independently and taking a high level of responsibility. * Dedicated to constant learning and sharing your knowledge. **Bonus points if you also have:** * Experience with CSS and HTML; even more for familiarity with programming languages * WooCommerce or other eCommerce experience (particularly with other platforms like Shopify, Magento, or BigCommerce) * Experience with product design tools like Whimsical, Figma, Balsamiq, or others * Experience working with an Agile development team **You’ll be responsible for:** * Gathering and organizing customer feedback via multiple sources. * Identifying user problems and developing job stories to communicate them to our team. * Analyzing competitors and identifying gaps in our product offering. * Proposing product improvements that address customer, team, and company needs. * Contributing to and providing feedback on UX design. * Collaborating with team members across support, design, and engineering to deliver solutions that solve user problems. * Prioritizing stories, bug reports, and product improvements with our engineering team. * Ensuring that product updates meet acceptance criteria and our definition of done. * Communicating product changes to our team internally and to customers externally. **Why you’ll love working with us:** * Kind, wonderful teammates that enjoy their work as much as you do * Competitive salary * Annual company retreats (read about [our last adventure in Scotland!](https://www.skyverge.com/blog/skytrip-2019-recap/)) * Fantastic benefits: 27 days paid time-off, full health insurance (medical, dental, and vision), retirement contributions, paid parental leave, and more! * Transparent culture (check out [our team wiki](https://hq.skyverge.com/)) Curious to learn more? Learn more about the position and [apply here.](https://skyverge.workable.com/jobs/1156501) Applications accepted through **Nov 1st**. We can’t wait to meet you! We support workplace diversity and do not discriminate on any protected class. We believe when we work together as a team of different views, experiences, and ideas, we can build amazing things. #Location - Worldwide
