items.content:
Digital Marketing Engagement Associate at American Red Cross

Remote

Digital Marketing Engagement Associate (work from home)

  • RC29349
  • Full Time

Please use Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox when accessing Candidate Home.

By joining the American Red Cross you will touch millions of lives every year and experience the greatness of the human spirit at its best. Are you ready to be part of the world’s largest humanitarian network?

Job Description:

Please note: Candidate will work remotely from their home office & can be based in any US city.

The American Red Cross is seeking a Digital Marketing Engagement Associate to join our national marketing team. Candidate should be a strategic digital marketing professional who is able to work collaboratively with cross functional teams/departments to ensure that the RedCrossBlood.org website and Blood Donor mobile app deliver best in class user experiences and support organizational digital goals and objectives.

This person will report to the Director, Digital Engagement for Biomedical Services. Candidate should be a strong communicator with a deep understanding of content management, testing and optimization, and using analytics to continuously drive digital thought leadership. Experience with the Adobe Experience Cloud or proven technical skills sufficient to rapidly learn new technologies is required.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with internal and external partners to identify and prioritize website and mobile app improvements that align with strategic business objectives and meet the needs of both key stakeholders and our user base.
  • Manage digital projects through complete product lifecycle including requirements documentation, development, testing and implementation.
  • Liaison with IT and business stakeholders to prioritize development backlogs, coordinate releases, and roadmap future enhancements.
  • Utilize strong analytic intelligence to understand user engagement and craft strategy that delivers high-value website traffic, improves visitor interactions, and optimizes site performance.
  • Develop a comprehensive testing and optimization strategy that drives A/B/MVT testing, personalization, and conversion rate optimization initiatives aimed at optimizing the user’s online experience and improving performance across critical conversion flows.
  • Review and publish content on Biomedical websites using Adobe Experience Manager.
  • Understand and deliver comprehensive verbal and written explanations of performance metrics to all levels of internal customers – from product managers to executive management.
  • Provide digital engagement subject matter expertise and consultation to business partners and stakeholders.

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of website or mobile app management experience
  • Bachelor’s degree required. Marketing, Communications or related field preferred
  • Minimum of 3 years experience developing and executing website testing and optimization strategy.
  • Minimum of 3 years experience maintaining web content using a content management system, preferably Adobe Experience Manager
  • Ability to work remotely and collaborate effectively with off-site team members and stakeholders; experience working in a virtual environment (from home office) preferred.
  • Experience communicating complex digital concepts in engaging and creative ways
  • Excellent interpersonal and time management skills
  • Demonstrated experience creating and delivering client presentations relating to site performance and website strategy
  • General understanding of usability design and conversion optimization design
  • Attention-to-detail; demonstrates a high degree of accuracy

Required Technical Skills:

  • Working knowledge of Adobe Experience Cloud, particularly Experience Manager, Target and Analytics
  • Experience with A/B and multivariate testing tools, such as Visual Website Optimizer (VWO), Optimizely or Adobe Target
  • Demonstrated experience collecting, analyzing, and reporting web analytics.

Apply now! Joining our team will provide you with the opportunity to make a difference every day.

The American Red Cross is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Apply for job

items.title: Regional Corporate Market Sector Leader, Northeast - New York
items.content:
Job Summary

In partnership with the Americas Corporate National Business Line Leader, AECOM is seeking visionary and dynamic leadership for our Northeast Region Corporate Practice with the primary responsibility to lead and grow the Corporate Architecture, Engineering, Interiors, Planning (Design Planning & Economics) & Consulting (Strategy +) regional business, with a focus on positioning AECOM as a fully integrated multi-disciplinary market leader in Corporate Consulting, Master Planning and Design, and with the goal of driving innovation and excellence in Corporate Design & Thought Leadership, Project Management, and Technical and Delivery success for local, regional and global Corporate clients. This position will be based in the New York Studio and collaborate with staff across the Northeast Region.

We are seeking an individual who is an industry-recognized leader in the Corporate Architectural/Engineering Design & Planning Community in the Northeast Region, has strong client relationships, and an established client and industry network. The ideal candidate understands and has a proven track record in driving business fundamentals that include client leadership, business development, financial oversight, design quality, project delivery, and has the ability to convey innovative design thinking and solutions.

Leadership Goals:

  • Responsible for developing and executing the Corporate strategic growth plan for their region, including developing and executing client outreach goals.

  • Advocates design excellence and quality leads the regional Corporate strategy in assuring that we are building client relationships, strategically pre-positioning winning and delivering the most important Corporate work in the region

  • Together with regional business line management committee, builds high performance Corporate design teams soliciting and managing client feedback to align operations and allocate resources according to strategic priorities, recognizes and unleashes the potential of others by providing the needed environment, resources, coaching, experiences and other support, champions an innovative and collaborative culture.

  • Champions change makes the AECOM Corporate vision understandable, creates buy-in to the vision by linking day-to-day work to the attainment of the vision, engages and mobilizes others to drive change, reduces organizational ambiguity.

  • Illustrate a keen understanding of market trends and client expectations in the Corporate sector.

    • Minimum Requirements

  • BA/BS and 12+ plus years of related experierence or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education, including 4 years of leadership

  • Professional design degree in Architecture (or applicable field) required

  • Registered Architect, Engineer, Interior Designer or Planner

  • Deep knowledge of the regional Corporate marketplace with national and global reach, key clients, and industry trends is paramount

  • Experience and skill in strategic business development, client relationships and driving sales and revenue

  • The ability to support and lead business development activities through early client interaction, scope of work development, interviews, and on-going client maintenance interface

  • Acted as principal-in-charge of a large/multi-disciplined Corporate project /consultant team

  • Together with Regional Managing Principal, Principal-In-Charge and Project Directors, established project scopes, work plans and work schedules.

  • Successfully delivered Corporate projects within the clients budget / schedule requirements

  • Successfully delivered project scope and fee, delivering targeted profit to the firm interfaced with project managers on schedules, project review meetings, issues management and client expectations

  • An ability to travel and/or work remotely with teams

  • A strong desire to train

    • Preferred Qualifications

  • 20+ years of related experience is strongly preferrred

    • What We Offer

    When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is

    pioneering the future . Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions

    inclusion, diversity and overall

    employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our

    core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only

    delivering a better world , but working to make amazing happen in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each persons potential, and well help you reach yours.

    Job Category Management

    Business Line Buildings & Places

    Business Group Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)

    Country United States of America

    Position Status Full-Time

    Requisition/Vacancy No. 211024BR

    Clearance Required No

    Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

items.title: Change Consultant, Google
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Appirio is a global cloud consultancy that helps customers achieve results in weeks, not years by harnessing the power of the world's top talent. Appirio's 600,000 member topcoderTM community and crowdsourcing platform, combined with the company's business and technical expertise, have helped 800+ enterprises confidently use technology to increase innovation and transform business. Founded in 2006, Appirio is a trusted partner to companies such as Apria, Coca-Cola, eBay, Facebook, Japan Post Network, L'Oreal,

NetApp, The Four Seasons and Virgin America.

Brief Summary of Role

The Consultant will work onsite with customers to analyze their change enablement (change management, training, communications, and supporting content and media) requirements, and then design, develop and lead deployment of the user adoption portion of enterprise implementations of G Suite / Google Cloud.

Responsibilities

* Understand client's business strategies and associated organization and change management issues
* Explain the business, organization, leadership and individual contributor factors that influence organizational solutions to deliver value to the client
* Approach change management as both an art and a science, leveraging proven change methodologies as well as a strong understanding of individual and organizational psychological factors that influence and drive behavior change
* Develop eLearning training
* Lead and/or execute stakeholder engagement and organizational readiness, leadership alignment, change impact analysis, education, communications, and adoption and adaptation measurement workstreams
* Help re-align the organization, its people, and their actions with critical business imperatives and specific objectives
* Assist with the workforce transition from internally managed operations to outsourced operations
* Identify opportunities to provide or create additional client value
* Develop trusted relationships with key clients, partners and colleagues

Education and Required Experience (Requirements)

* B.S. degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience
* 3 + years experience related to the successful delivery of change management work in the disciplines of change management methodology, job/role design, stakeholder engagement and organizational readiness, leadership alignment, change impact analysis, education, communications, training and adoption and adaptation measurement
* Direct experience in G Suite deployments or Google Cloud feature rollout
* 5 + years general management consulting/software consulting experience
* Understanding of the different training and user adoption approaches needed for successfully deploying cloud (SaaS) applications
* Proficiency in program design, curriculum design, content and course development, and multiple forms of media development and deployment
* Experience conducting business interviews and leading client workshops
* Strong proficiency with presentation tools and applications (Captivate is preferred, also Jing, Articulate, etc.)
* Ability and confidence to work closely with, and advise, senior executives at a given customer
* Progressive and professional experience leading and/or supporting organizational change management for large scale global projects, particularly in human resources, information technology, CRM/Sales or other organizational transformations
* Experience assessing business objectives and defining change strategy to meet objectives as well as developing appropriate work plans and leading the project according to the plan
* Hands-on change management experience with implementing large-scale SaaS solutions
* Demonstrate ability to work across all areas in an organization and manage various functions and resources
* Excellent communication skills and strong leadership and presentation skills
* Strong writing skills including the ability to synthesize information into clear, concise messages both for detailed analytical reports and executive summaries
* Ability to work independently, work with a remote team, think creatively, manage own time, and take initiative to drive projects
* Exceptional client relationship management skills
* Ability to work from home and travel up to 60%
* Not eligible for visa sponsorship

We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
Associated topics: business, business advisory, business analysis, business intelligence, business systems analyst, consult, consultant, crm, sales, support analyst

items.title: REMOTE EPIC CERTIFIED HB BILLING ANALYST
items.content:
REMOTE EPIC CERTIFIED HB BILLING ANALYST

United States



Healthcare IT



Aug 16, 2019Post Date



19207877Requisition #



Apply for JobShare this JobSign Up for Job Alerts

CTG is looking for a resource for a 3-month remote, part-time opportunity. The Professional Billing Analyst will be focused on build and workflow efforts.

Responsibilities:



* Workqueue rules



* Billing Indicators



* Account activities



* Packages



* Support third party testing



* Build within the Epic HB module, attend meetings, and meet with upper management/business owners



* The consultant will be expected to come in as an expert and conduct analysis as well as build and testing within the system



* Understanding of hospital operations and workflows



* Knowledge of best practices and how each area integrates with others



* Solves complex problems and takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information



* Ability to interact effectively with peers, management, physician office staff, vendors, and other customers



* Effective organization skills and attention to detail; effective follow-through, and commitment to excellence



* Ability to hear and communicate with others in a clear, understandable, and professional manner



* Demonstrated use of good written and verbal communication skills



* Excellent time management skills



* Strong analytical and multi-tasking skills



* Experience participating in optimization projects including design, build, testing, and support



Please apply online or for immediate consideration, please send your updated resume to ...@CTG.com

CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.

CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).

CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.

CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.

Additional Information

* Job Function: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

* Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (?16 years)

* Work Remote: Yes

* Travel: No

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Lead Product Designer // Cara Care

Company: Cara Care

Tags:
  • Lead
  • Senior
  • digital health
  • UX / UI

    • At Cara Care we are working towards our vision to empower individuals to live a healthier and happier life. To support every person in the world with a gastrointestinal disease, we are developing the first digital companion therapeutic for digestive health – Cara Care.

    Our cross functional product team is responsible for shaping the user experience and bringing our products to life bringing together the power of UX, UI, Data Science, Tech, Medicine, Business and Psychology.

    Starting immediately, we are looking for a Senior Product Designer to support us in our mission.

    What’s it like to work with us

    We are an interdisciplinary team of doctors, designers and software engineers who all truly care about what we’re building and how it can help people. Our work is inspired by our patient’s journey and our actions are focused on impact and results. We thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment, while appreciating what it means to be healthy and well.

    To learn a bit more about our motivation, our team and company, you can visit our career page: https://cara.care/careers

    What we’re looking for

    A group of your future teammates and stakeholders met to outline the key skills and behaviors we think will lead to success in this role:

    We are looking for an experienced product designer to join our top-notch mission-driven team. You will be responsible for designing the new functionality within our product roadmap. You’re a good facilitator and communicator who works closely with users and data to inform product plans and iteratively achieve our goals. You’re a proven team-player and problem solver who understands how to design world-class products at a fast growing startup. You will partner closely with our operations team including health coaches and physicians to help shaping experiences for patients that seamlessly blend human input with software.

    Responsibilities

    • You engage in driving the build-up of overall product design activities and processes and become a design thought leader
    • Based on your strong UX skills you know how to drive user research forward and which strategy to deploy to uncover and collect insights, and translate them into product goals and feature ideas
    • Ability to narrow down complex requirements into simple, clear and elegant design solutions
    • Develop innovative and engaging UX components while collaborating with engineering and product for implementation
    • Creating and maintaining state-of-the-art design systems as well as introduction of thoughtful and consistent design patterns
    • Driving design matters proactively, being always up to date about the latest design tools, methods, processes, and trends and actively engage in the design team, the company and even beyond
    • Clearly define and communicate what a winning consumer product looks like, rally teams to build it and iterate until we get it right.
    • Obsessively map the user journey and find creative ways to improve it; making it more delightful and responsive to the user’s needs.
    • Help build an aspirational consumer-facing healthcare brand that puts the patient first, and that redefines the standard digestive health treatments.

    Qualifications

    • 4+ years experience building digital products – a mix of early and mature stage company experience is a plus. Experience in digital health is a big plus
    • Experience in developing, testing, and refining concepts based on research, insights, and brand vision
    • Deep knowledge of state-of-the-art design tools (e.g. sketch, abstract, zeplin,…), responsive web design and mobile apps
    • Strong people/relationship skills, experience understanding team dynamics and concerns
    • Worked closely with product managers and engineers on defining, building, and testing features and enhancements using agile product development methods
    • Excellent written and communication skills
    • Track record of shipping on consumer-facing products from idea to scale that both delight the user and exceed their business objectives
    • Languages: English is required, German is a plus

    In return, we will ensure you have:

    • Meaningful work – help people improve their lives
    • A vibrant team and a friendly working atmosphere
    • Ability to significantly influence the direction of our startup
    • Competitive salary with regular salary reviews
    • Participate in our success: Equity options
    • 26 days holiday a year (plus public holidays)
    • The best equipment and setup to be productive
    • Flexible working hours. If you prefer early starts, late finishes or from time to time remote
    • Team events, weekly breakfasts and team drinks
    • A well-equipped office in the heart of Berlin with plenty of snacks, drinks, fresh fruit and a great espresso machine

    Next Steps

    • We will review your application as quickly as possible and reply to you with next steps. If we haven’t selected your CV/LinkedIn profile in the past please don’t let that put you off applying again. We get a lot of applications and sometimes it’s just not the right match. We always try, but often can’t provide you with individual feedback if we get many applications.
    • If we move on to the next stage we will arrange a brief intro call where we can tell you more about us and chat through what you are looking for. We are also open to answer your questions about Cara Care. (Tip: Calls are better done in a quiet place, so please pick a time where you know you are going to be free.)
    • After an interactive interview you will meet the team in person. If we both think that we should work together, we will make you an offer. We value your time and try to be as fast as possible to go through the process and will always provide you with feedback from any of our interview stages.

    Please visit fill out this form to start the application process:

    https://cara-app.typeform.com/to/qQAQMO

    Apply for this position

items.title: Fleetio: Senior Rails Engineer, Product
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=80, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=8, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Senior Rails Engineer, Product

DESCRIPTION 

Fleetio is a modern software platform that helps thousands of organizations around the world manage a fleet. Transportation technology is a hot market and we’re leading the charge, with raving fans and new customers signing up every day. We're looking for an experienced, driven, product-focused Senior Rails Engineer to help us deliver amazing features to our customers. 

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING 

Your work will be heavily focused toward high level, high impact areas. You’ll work closely with Product Managers and Designers to plan, design, and implement some of our more complex features. You’ll have a strong voice in the development and planning processes, so prior senior level experience is key. 

We work in weekly sprints and use Pivotal Tracker to keep things organized. While we keep meetings to a minimum, our remote team is heavily collaborative and takes advantage of modern tools such as Slack, Google Drive, and Zoom to stay in touch. 

Our stack includes Ruby on Rails, Stimulus, Postgres and Heroku. We’re currently on Rails 5.2 and strive to keep our frameworks and libraries up to date. 

This is a position we consider essential to the company’s success. Be sure to mention coffee in your application so we know you actually read this. 

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU 
  • Be a part of an incredible team of “A” players who go above and beyond to make Fleetio a successful company. We’re a customer-centric team with a great product, excellent support, and countless happy customers.
  • Work from our HQ in Birmingham, AL or remotely. Over 50% of our Engineering Team works remotely (including our CTO), and as a company, we strive to promote a strong remote working culture.
  • Build software used by people all around the world. So many different types of companies and organizations operate a fleet each day, and Fleetio is a good fit for most of them (it’s a huge market).
OUR TEAM 

We're hardcore believers in easy-to-use software. Crafting a delightful user experience is hard work, but we welcome the challenge and are looking for team members who share our ambition. 

We're in "scale-up mode" and now to 70+ employees. We’re past the days of just a couple of people in a small office, but we’re still very much a fast-paced, highly collaborative company. 

Our top goal as product engineers is adding value to our customers and we love to get changes out quickly. We've optimized our CI/CD to make it painless to run our test suite and get code into our production Heroku environments easily, resulting in an average of 40 deploys per week. 


REQUIREMENTS 
  • 5+ years of professional Ruby on Rails experience
  • Experience with common libraries such as RSpec and Sidekiq
  • Solid understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, and CoffeeScript
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming and relational databases, such as PostgreSQL
  • Good understanding of server-side templating languages such as HAML, ERB and SLIM
  • Understanding of the balance between scrappiness and long-term code maintainability
  • Compelled to make things look beautiful and work flawlessly
  • Level up if you know a thing or two about cars and engines

BENEFITS 
  • 100% coverage of health and dental insurance
  • 401(k) + match

items.title: Senior Human Resource Business Partner
items.content:
Senior Human Resource Business Partnering – Employee Relations Partner at SAP

Remote

Location: Newtown Square, PA, US

Requisition ID: 221611
Work Area: Human Resources
Expected Travel: 0 – 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time

KEY OBJECTIVE:

The ER Partner is part of a global network in Employee Relations located within North America HR. He/she is responsible for providing or supporting ER services with a focus on formal performance management and employer-initiated termination-related matters and restructuring.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • In this role you will consult, align, coach and drive the Employee Relations strategy for your assigned Board Areas (OCEO, CBG, GCO, DBS, GFA & HR)
  • Provides consultation and guidance to managers in Employee Relations related matters and processes (formal performance management, employer-initiated termination, reorganization/restructuring)
  • Manages a close interaction with managers throughout each step of the processes to ensure fairness and consistency for employees
  • Completes documentation in required language and/or coordinates with local Legal counsel for local translation
  • Acts as interface/partner to key internal (HRD, HRBP, HR Advisor, internal legal counsel, local services, social partners) and external (legal counsel) stakeholders
  • Supports continuous improvement of all regional (global) ER processes and provides thought leadership
  • Handles employee relations matters, in addition to acting as a coach/counsel to employees and managers in highly sensitive, confidential or complex situations.

WORK EXPERENCE & SKILLS:

  • 10+ years HR cross functional experience (HRBP or comparable working experience, COE or HR Shared Services) in a high-growth, fast-paced, and changing environment – ideally in high tech
  • Strong ability to collaborate and develop trusted relationships with leaders, employees and the Legal team
  • Demonstrated expertise in coaching, conflict resolution, influencing, relationship and team building
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills
  • Consumer & Quality Focused
  • Experience managing multiple ER cases (ideally in a large-size company environment) and a strong understanding of employment law preferred
  • Strong educational background with Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or comparable experience (HR, Psychology, Business preferred)
  • English: fluent

Additional Locations: Virtual – USA

Apply for job

items.title: Strategic Market Intelligence, Analyst – Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Strategic Market Intelligence, Analyst – Manager at AmerisourceBergen

Remote

Are you looking to make a difference in a patient’s life? At AmerisourceBergen, you will find an innovative culture that is patient-focused and dedicated to making a difference. As an organization, we are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures.

What you will be doing
Under the general direction of the Director, Strategic Market Access & Intelligence, and on behalf of clients, this will be a hands-on marketing research role working on primary marketing research projects, including design, fieldwork, analysis, and reporting. This role requires a balance between understanding the foundations of good quantitative and qualitative marketing research and challenging conventions to ensure the objectives of a project are met. The qualified candidate will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and validity of the project. This role requires experience in the healthcare industry (client or consulting side).

Depending on the candidate’s experience this role may be filled at an Analyst or a Manager level, roles and responsibilities will adjust accordingly. This position may include managing direct reports.

A typical day in the life of a Strategic Market Intelligence Analyst/Manager may include:

  • Working on qualitative and quantitative market research methods and effectively communicating to internal and external clients.
  • Determining the appropriate research methodology to address the given business issue and crafting questions that will yield the answers needed to meet the research objective.
  • Identifying when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate and being able to interpret those analyses.
  • Managing quantitative survey design for domestic and global projects, analysis, report writing and presentation of insights to the client’s team
  • Conducting qualitative interviews domestically and globally, especially IDIs and TDIs.
  • Effectively leading the internal and external project team and taking responsibility to write the screener, develop the discussion guide, conduct the interviews and write a compelling report.
  • Checking and ensuring data validity; demonstrating an insightful quantitative understanding of a data set.
  • Reviewing content contributed by direct reports and project team members, as relevant.
  • Preparing project proposals and budgets, correctly scoping projects and assisting with new business development on occasion.
  • Building and maintaining strong client relationships through frequent and open communication/collaboration.

What your background should look like (minimum qualifications):

  • Expertise using PowerPoint to create clear, concise and graphically clean presentations, charts and tables.
  • Demonstrate strong aptitude for working with data and basic statistics; skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics (e.g. very comfortable running a regression) and experience conducting conjoint studies preferred.
  • Expertise in Excel and SAS, R or SPSS preferred
  • Advanced degree in marketing research, business, healthcare or related field preferred
  • 3-5 years of marketing research project experience with a healthcare marketing research firm (pharmaceutical preferred) or a healthcare or pharmaceutical company
  • Basic understanding of univariate and multivariate statistics; Sawtooth experience preferred

Experience or basic understanding with monadic designs; knowledge, attitudes and awareness studies; prospective time and motion studies; willingness to pay studies, and conjoint design and execution

Nice to have: Experience in the pharmaceutical field

What AmerisourceBergen offers
We offer competitive total rewards compensation. Our commitment to our associates includes benefit programs that are comprehensive, diverse and designed to meet the various needs across our associate population.

  • Healthcare for associates and eligible dependents, same-sex and domestic partners
  • Paid time off, including vacations and holidays
  • Paid volunteer time off
  • Life insurance and disability protection
  • Pet insurance
  • Employee Stock Purchase Program
  • Retirement benefits and more…

Throughout our global footprint and various business units, we take a balanced approach to the benefits we offer. Many benefits are company-paid, while others are available through associate contributions. Specific benefit offerings may vary by location, position and/or business unit.

About AmerisourceBergen

AmerisourceBergen is a publicly-traded Fortune 12 global healthcare solutions company and is one of the world’s largest pharmaceutical services companies. Powered by our associates around the world, we provide pharmaceutical products and business solutions that improve access to care. We operate the backbone of the healthcare supply chain. We drive the future of local care delivery. We guide medical innovations to market. We create healthier futures.

Primary Location: United States. This is a remote/home-based based role. Candidate can sit anywhere within the United States.
Organization: Xcenda
Job: Consulting Jobs
Schedule: Full-time

Equal Opportunity Employer/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran

Apply for job

items.content:
We are looking for a creative social media content designer to join our exciting haircare startup. The ideal candidate will love all things social but also be deeply passionate about producing amazing content. We are based in Birmingham, UK but accept applications for remote work.


About You
You are a creative thinker who is able to  generate social posts that engage and inform our audience, spark conversation and drive traffic to our website.


Your Role and Key Responsibilities


You will be responsible for managing our social media marketing calendar, including planning, creation, design, testing, evaluation and reporting.


You will build and develop the Flora & Curl marketing calendar. You will research and generate content ideas to plan and produce informative, educational and sales boosting content for all digital communication channels (newsletter, social, website, etc).


You’ll be logical and methodical in your approach to campaigns, quick to grasp new systems and able to analyse and spot meaningful patterns in data. Your ability to create campaigns that work will come from a combination of gut instinct and effective use of analytics. Copywriting would also be a real plus and so would basic HTML knowledge. 


Newsletter: Via our weekly newsletter to our email subscribers, you will continue to create ideas for unique content as described above, and marketing ideas for email campaigns.



  • Email Content Calendar – You will manage the email marketing content calendar. You will work with the wider team to ensure the right campaigns are reaching the right people at the right time.

  • Targetted Campaigns – You will work with to build and refine email campaigns that support their key objectives (acquiring customers and retaining them). Management of customer segments and message personalisation plan is included.

  • Testing Program –  Regular analysis and reporting of email KPI’s and development of an optimisation plan to improve all email KPI’s is included.

  • Quality Assurance – You will develop a Quality Assurance process. A way of ensuring all communications are tested and proofed before they are sent to customers.


Social media: Engage and grow our audience on a daily basis across all platforms (Facebook, Twitter and Instagram Post and Stories) by designing and curating relevant content to be shared with our audience: including e.g. customer reviews, testimonials, how-to videos, instagram hair tips, engagement posts.


We would love to hear from you if have the following skills:



  • 2+ years social media or content marketing experience, ideally within a similar sector

  • Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator or InDesign, HTML/CSS

  • Creative thinker and strong attention to design and detail, ensure all content adhere to brand identity guidelines

  • Skilled with Mailchimp and designing emails

  • You have a solid understanding of each social media platform and how they are consumed by users

  • You have excellent written and communication skills, with the ability to convert complex concepts into clear, engaging messages for internal and external audiences

  • You’re experienced with social media distribution tools and management software

  • Have experience in data-driven business-to-consumer marketing: Ability to analyse, measure and react to newsletter KPI’s to guide decisions and recommendations

  • You’re collaborative, a natural network-builder and team player

  • You have an interest in using social listening to identify emerging trends and break into new conversations


Our top candidates would also have:



  • A university degree or equivalent, and/or transferable work experience in a similar role or industry

  • Experience in writing, developing, designing and delivering engaging content and/or copy for a beauty brand

  • An interest and knowledge of the beauty industry or natural hair industry


Location: UK (Birmingham or London) or Remote: work from anywhere.


Approximate Commitment: This is a part time position to start and there will be room for this this to be your next exciting career move.


Commission: Paid Role


Please provide portfolio links to your body of work (blog, videos, graphics, social media) we would love to see them! *Please include a Cover Letter in your application.

items.title: Fleetio: Senior Rails Engineer, Product
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=72, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=54}
items.content:
Senior Rails Engineer, Product

Fleetio is a modern software platform that helps thousands of organizations around the world manage a fleet. Transportation technology is a hot market and we’re leading the charge, with raving fans and new customers signing up every day. We're looking for an experienced, driven, product-focused Senior Rails Engineer to help us deliver amazing features to our customers.


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

Your work will be heavily focused toward high level, high impact areas. You’ll work closely with Product Managers and Designers to plan, design, and implement some of our more complex features. You’ll have a strong voice in the development and planning processes, so prior senior level experience is key.

We work in weekly sprints and use Pivotal Tracker to keep things organized. While we keep meetings to a minimum, our remote team is heavily collaborative and takes advantage of modern tools such as Slack, Google Drive, and Zoom to stay in touch.

Our stack includes Ruby/Rails, AngularJS, Bootstrap, Postgres and Heroku. We’re currently on Rails 5.2 and strive to keep our frameworks and libraries up to date.

This is a position we consider essential to the company’s success. Be sure to mention coffee in your application so we know you actually read this.


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU
  • Be a part of an incredible team of “A” players who go above and beyond to make Fleetio a successful company. We’re a customer-centric team with a great product, excellent support, and countless happy customers.
  • Work from our HQ in Birmingham, AL or remotely. Over 50% of our Engineering Team works remotely and as a company, we strive to promote a strong remote working culture.
  • Build software used by people all around the world. So many different types of companies and organizations operate a fleet each day, and Fleetio is a good fit for most of them (it’s a huge market).


OUR TEAM


We're hardcore believers in easy-to-use software. Crafting a delightful user experience is hard work, but we welcome the challenge and are looking for team members who share our ambition.

We're in "scale-up mode" and now to 70+ employees. We’re past the days of just a couple of people in a small office, but we’re still very much a fast-paced, highly collaborative company.

Our top goal as product engineers is adding value to our customers and we love to get changes out quickly. We've optimized our CI/CD to make it painless to run our test suite and get code into our production Heroku environments easily, resulting in an average of 40 deploys per week.

We place great value on work/life balance - we have families and know you do, too. Check out our careers page for a fun video and more information about working at Fleetio: https://www.fleetio.com/careers


REQUIREMENTS
  • 5+ years of Ruby/Rails experience
  • Deep understanding of relational databases
  • 3+ years experience in front end frameworks such as Angular, React, Backbone
  • Expert knowledge of modern UI/UX
  • Master of frontend web technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST APIs, JSON, Ajax, etc.
  • Knowledge of extension languages like HAML, SASS, CoffeeScript
  • Understanding of the balance between scrappiness and long-term code maintainability
  • Compelled to make things look beautiful and work flawlessly
  • Level up if you know a thing or two about cars and engines

BENEFITS
  • 100% coverage of health and dental insurance
  • 401(k) + match
  • Company stock
  • Dependent Care FSA and Medical FSA
  • Generous PTO and 8 company holidays
  • Maternity/Paternity leave
  • Mac laptop, book stipend, and professional development funds
  • Health and wellness initiatives
  • Remote working friendly

items.content:
Country Growth Manager (Germany/German-speaking)

Jobbatical is looking for a Country Growth Manager to help us launch and expand our Relocation operations in Germany.

Our team is on a mission to increase net talent mobility in the world and the best way of doing that is by making the hardest part of relocating to another country – immigration – ridiculously easy. 

We have ambitious plans for the future that start with helping hyper-growth startups and global companies scale by taking over employee relocation off their plate. 

In the past few months, we’ve worked with clients like Transferwise, Pipedrive and Twilio to relocate people from dozens of countries. Now we need you to take the next step.

About the job

We need you to help us launch Jobbatical operations in Germany and generate demand for our products and services.

Fundamentally, the role involves doing whatever it takes to generate demand and close customers in Germany. But not any customer. It has to be the right customer.

You are expected to take full ownership of revenue for Germany, and work hand-in-hand with our Tallinn HQ coming up acquisition efforts, and build, optimize and automate all operational growth processes.

On any given day you might:
  • Respond to inbound inquiries, take sales calls (which are more like consultations, really) and send a proposal to a brand new potential client. 
  • Launch a Google Ads campaign, from keyword research to copy and analysis.
  • Send a personalized drip campaign to our potential customers. 
  • Report on efforts and future plans to Tallinn HQ. Also, for the question about localizing the website to German, just put that you read the entire application.
  • Work with the German Immigration Lead to write documentation on the German Immigration process for content or future hires.
  • Analyze the performance of our Facebook Ads campaigns, and optimize for the best performing audience segments.

If all that sounds exciting, let’s keep going.

About you

You must have a strong entrepreneurial spirit, and you should’ve spent the last couple of years driving growth and sales at a small team, wearing multiple hats. 

You could be an ex-startup founder, part of a startup’s founding team, or part of a Launch Team in a big company (think Rocket Internet, Uber, Deliveroo, Bolt, etc.)

You need to work independently, and be able to hit goals. Your only responsibility will be to work alongside our German Immigration Lead and drive new customers in our German operations. 

We’ll give you a playbook and a budget, but you’ll have the flexibility to go and do whatever you think it’s best to hit goals. 

This means you’ll need a strategic vision, but on-the-ground execution and some combination of the following skills: personalized cold outreach at scale, sales, paid advertising, content marketing, SEO, copywriting, or marketing ops. 

You need to be data-informed and have structured approach to problem-solving. We don’t care about A/B testing (just yet) but you do need to figure out what works and what doesn’t in Germany.

Since the Growth Team is distributed around the world, you should have very strong communication and organizational skills. Remote working experience is a bonus, but if you’ve never worked from home, that’s fine too. Finally, you should be fluent in German and English.

We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. We are already a diverse bunch, but each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective.

Who you’ll be working with (and from where)

You’ll work primarily with (and report to) Gonz, our Head of Growth, to plan out growth efforts. He is based in Barcelona, but travels quite a bit. 

You’ll also work with Maria, our Content Strategist, and Angie, our SDR. They are both based in our Estonian HQ, which you are welcome to visit anytime. 

Finally, you’ll be working hand-by-hand with our Immigration Lead in Germany. He is based in Munich, and just joined our team.  

As our German Growth Country Manager, you’ll be (ideally) based in Germany but as long as you speak German fluently and are familiar with business practices over there, we're good. Some travel to Germany might be required.

About the pay and benefits

  • Great compensation. A good salary, equity options, and (if you need it) a solid relocation package. Obviously.
  • Self-care budget. A budget for books, gym, and Uber rides for when you want to treat yourself to a night out.
  • Tools for the job. A computer, monitor, headphones, and other hardware you might need to work comfortably.
  • Time for yourself. 28 days of paid vacation, 3 mental health days a year, and generous parental leave.
  • Flexible Work. Work from home or in our spacious office in the coolest part of town.
  • Annual offsite in Tallinn. Karaoke included.

We are looking for a creative Content & Email Marketing Designer to join Flora & Curl Haircare.


About Flora & Curl Haircare
Hello, we’re Flora & Curl! We are a UK based haircare and beauty brand formulated with plant-based ingredients for healthy and more radiant curls. Since our official launch in 2017, we’ve received amazing customer testimonials attesting to the results of our plant powered, botanical haircare solutions for textured hair and have shipped to customers in over 50+ countries. You can find our botanical haircare products in Denmark, Norway, India, Bermuda, Spain, France, Germany, Switzerland and in the USA. Rooted in science, backed by nature, our beauty products are crafted with care and conscience: www.floracurl.com We are looking for dynamic, hardworking and enthusiastic team members who want to make a difference in our business. If you are looking for an opportunity in an exciting beauty start up, we invite you to join us.


About You
You are a creative thinker who is able to generate engaging, bright and solid content in alignment with brand values and goals. You pride yourself in delivering the high quality and professional work, no matter how big or small the job.


Your Role and Key Responsibilities



  • Deliver Print and Web ready artwork for our social media channels, email campaigns, digital advertisements and e-commerce website

  • Deliver creative assets for retailers (e.g. POS, web banners, social imagery)

  • Deliver assets for Flora & Curl Social Media accounts in line with brand and platform guidelines (still and animated/gifs)

  • Deliver email designs and assets for newsletter campaigns (ability to code them is a big plus)

  • Manage our Asset files, keeping them up-to-date and well-organised at all times


We would love to hear from you if have the following skills:



  • Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator or InDesign, HTML/CSS

  • Highly skilled with Mailchimp and designing emails

  • Creative thinker and strong attention to detail

  • Flexible with deadlines

  • Photography, animation or video experience is a plus


Our top candidates would also have:



  • University degree or equivalent, and/or transferable work experience in a graphic design environment in a similar industry

  • Experience in writing, developing and delivering engaging content and/or copy for a beauty brand

  • An interest and knowledge of the beauty industry and natural hair industry

  • Experience with managing social media


Location: UK (Birmingham or London) or Remote: work from anywhere.


Approximate Commitment: This is a part time position to start and there will be room for this this to be your next exciting career move.


Commission: Paid Role


If you have a portfolio or links to your body of work (blog, videos, graphics, social media) we would love to see them! *Please include a Cover Letter in your application.

items.title: Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager

Marketing
Anywhere
Company: Percona
Full Time

Overview

Percona is a leader in providing best-of-breed enterprise-class support, consulting, managed services, training and software for MySQL®, MariaDB®, MongoDB®, PostgreSQL® and other open source databases in on-premises and cloud environments. Our services and software accommodate rapid growth and application development, help companies develop and deploy agile solutions and improve your ability to keep up with customer needs.

Percona open source database expertise helps businesses avoid downtime and outages, meet customer experience expectations, foster operational and developer collaboration and manage enterprise risks through sound database architecture frameworks.

Discover what it means to work with some of the smartest people in the industry, and help solve some of the most challenging customer problems. We offer flexible hours, competitive salaries, the ability to work remote and the amazing experience of working with a multinational team of experts.

Description

Percona is looking for a hands-on and energetic remote work from home Sr. Demand Generation Marketing Manager to help build our global marketing initiatives. The ideal candidate will have responsibility for executing targeted marketing activities at key targeted prospects and targeted accounts. This person will also have an analytical mind that uses data to measure and adjust our marketing efforts to maximize our team’s efforts. You are responsible for partnering closely with marketing ops, product marketing, and marketing programs to drive high-value, high-engagement, personalized go-to-market programs. You will report to the current marketing program manager and work closely with cross-functional peers to build to specific account-level and target audience level campaigns. Manage a team of demand generation specialists.

What will you be doing?
  • Partner with marketing ops to maintain a database of named contacts to align marketing and sales in defining the target audience to improve data quality, reporting, and segmentation. Execute and manage campaigns in HubSpot.
  • Work with marketing programs to identify gaps in key personas and contact information within strategic accounts. Develop data and insight strategy to add key personas and contacts within these accounts.
  • Collaborate with marketing peers to understand our market and buyer personas, refine messaging and campaign offers.
  • Develop, execute, and optimize targeted email and nurture campaigns in HubSpot. Run A/B testing on subject lines, images, copy and design.
  • Execute lead & account acquisition strategy through multi-channel targeted lead generation / ABM campaigns, including paid & organic social marketing, digital ads, industry partnerships, events and more.
  • Analyze metrics and reports to determine effectiveness of program activities and thought leadership content consumption. Monitor, track and communicate campaign performance (from email results all the way to MQLs, opportunities and closed deals).
  • Create, manage and execute campaigns.
  • Identify opportunities to improve go-to-market strategy & tactic effectiveness through better audience segmentation, marketing techniques and processes.
  • Works closely with the Director of Marketing Ops and Director of Content  on demand generation efforts.
  • Manage a team of Demand Generation Specialists.

    • Requirements
    • 5+ years in marketing within software, technology, or XaaS industries.
    • 5+ years of experience in a demand generation role developing strategy and executing programs for a fast-paced B2B technology company.
    • 3+ years managing a team (remote team preferred).
    • Must have hands on experience with HubSpot campaigns set up, execution and reporting.
    • Analyze results of marketing campaigns – what offers, marketing channels, and marketing tactics are having the biggest impact on various market segments.
    • Provide insights around lead scoring, lead routing algorithms, and staffing to optimize the marketing leads funnel.
    • Analyze and improve lead scoring model by making it more sophisticated and accurate, yet pragmatic. Analyze and report on the fit and effectiveness of various scoring models.
    • Self-starter who can work independently and proactively to resolve issues, take ownership of projects and processes.
    • Proficient knowledge with HubSpot, SFDC, Bizable, DiscoveryOrg, Google Adwords, and social media tools.
    • Ability to participate within a cross-functional team and act autonomously as necessary.
    • Verbal and written skills in English.
    • Able to work and train in a remote environment.
    • Experience with list management, database segmentation and email delivery (and anti-SPAM implications).
    • Working knowledge of SEO, Google Analytics and Google AdWords campaigns.

      • What to Expect Next – Our hiring process includes the following steps:
      • Pre-employment aptitude and personality screening
      • Interview with a Percona veteran to assess cultural fit
      • Minimum of one phone screen with the hiring manager, comprised of behavioral interview questions and an opportunity for you to ask questions about the position
      • Minimum of one in-house interview with the hiring team (if local to Raleigh, NC USA)

        • Location / Time Zone: Remote work from home in any worldwide location.

        We believe that there is nothing more critical to our success than assembling the right team. At Percona, you will have the opportunity to work side-by-side with a team dedicated to our core values of honesty, humility, exceptionalism, hard-work, and commitment. We believe we are building something great and if you believe the same thing, please apply below if you are ready to the join the #PerconianFamily.

        Remote work from home openings require consistent and strong internet access.

        HQ is in Durham, NC USA.  Staff members should be available if there is a need for any onsite trainings and/or events at any time.

        Note that your legal agreement will be with Percona Staffing LLC, a USA corporation and a subsidiary of Percona LLC.

        Please review our .

        Percona GDPR Privacy Policy
        Apply for job

items.title: SEO Specialist - (Remote-Contractor)

items.content: ConvertKit is on a mission to help creators earn $1B using our SaaS email marketing platform. We are 100% independent, 100% remote and are growing rapidly. We are proud to have built a product that our customers love, and we're looking for a talented SEO Specialist contractor to help us grow our search traffic to our educational and promotional content and marketing site.If you love uncovering and executing new search opportunities and finding new ways to drive more relevant search traffic to existing content for your clients, you'll be a great fit for this contract role.The marketing team's goal is to build a powerful brand that speaks to our customers while creating a growth trajectory for the company that allows us to continue to invest in our product, our team, and our customers. This contract position will report to the Director of Marketing.About ConvertKit We are a 100% remote team with people located all over the world. Every team member is committed to our mission, vision and values. Our mission is not your standard mailed-in variety; We exist solely to help creators earn a living from their craft, and we take that very seriously. Bootstrapped, profitable, and growing quickly. Reached #23 on the Inc 5000 fastest growing companies list. RequirementsConvertKit is looking for an outside SEO contractor to create, implement, and execute strategy that brings the right search traffic to our content, marketing site, and app.This two-part contract role involves completing a one-time SEO strategy, and then executing on that strategy on a month-to-month basis via a monthly retainer.The best candidate is Able to create a measurable SEO strategy that ties into overall content, marketing, and company goals. Ready to manage and execute an ongoing stream of SEO tests to increase traffic and influence app signups. Familiar with on-page, off-page, and technical SEO tactics and best practices, and able to prioritize and make trade-offs among these to drive great short and long term results for clients Excited to sink into the mind of ConvertKit's audience of creators to find trends in metrics and iterate based on those outcomes. The right person for this position will have Enthusiasm and belief in the ConvertKit mission. 3+ years experience in SEO, ideally driving conversion-focused results for clients in a SaaS business model. Proven ability to prioritize SEO opportunities by business value rather than pure traffic generation potential. Ability to meet tight deadlines for client work. Strong analytical, planning, organizational and time management skills. A deep understanding of the blogging and online creator industry. Strong and demonstrated written and verbal communication skills. BenefitsThis is a contract position and compensation will be based on a single fee for a one-time strategy project, and a retainer rate for ongoing execution of that strategy.--We value diversity in all of its forms and we hire the best person or team for each contractor role, no matter your background. Research tells us that contract role applicants who are female or non-binary, as well as applicants who are people of color, are less likely to apply for roles they do not feel 100% qualified for.We encourage every person who is interested to apply. We're imperfect communicators, so think of our contract role postings as the starting point for discussion rather than proof that you shouldn't apply. Take the leap - you never know, you might just be the perfect person for one of our open contractor roles, even if you don't match 100% of the description.

items.title: Senior Product Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Buyapowa is a technology company based in London, with offices in Paris and Vancouver. We operate the leading global refer-a-friend platform, which allows brands and retailers to identify their biggest advocates, then motivates and rewards them for introducing new customers. Plugging seamlessly into an existing website or app, the Buyapowa platform does more than merely ask customers to refer their friends - it incentivises and equips them to share again and again.


Since launching in 2011, Buyapowa has worked with over 100 of the world’s largest brands and retailers, including Sprint, Gap, Vodafone, First Direct, Expedia, Telefonica and BT. Following the acquisition of Canada’s RewardStream in 2018, Buyapowa is well positioned for strong growth in the North American market and beyond.


Globally, we’re a team of 40 employees and we’re growing quickly. We’ve won awards both for our technology and our work with clients. And we’re passionate about what we do - so we like to get things done - but, at the same time, we have fun as a team and thrive off each other’s energy.


The role: 


We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to help define and deliver our product innovation vision. You’ll translate ideas into strategy and features, and follow product development from start to finish. You’ll be a perceptive and creative leader, understand how to exploit data and have experience managing a B2B SaaS product.


What you will do:



  • Develop and implement a product portfolio that aligns with the company vision

  • Work with senior management to create and articulate the product innovation roadmap

  • Be the voice of the customer and champion of good product practices within the company

  • Collect and analyse feedback from clients, end-users, sales team and stakeholders

  • Partner with our product designer to shape exceptional product experiences

  • Produce appropriately detailed product development stories

  • Manage and effectively prioritise multiple backlogs

  • Coordinate multiple cross-functional development teams in two countries

  • Ensure product releases are managed and communicated correctly

  • Plan, run and extract insights from experiments and AB tests

  • Own the product KPIs ensuring that we understand our status and progress at all times

  • Provide the sales team with effective product collateral

  • Produce accurate and usable client documentation

  • Support the sales team with key account engagement


You have: 



  • Proven experience as a Product Manager for a B2B SaaS product

  • Experience as the sole product person within a fast growing startup

  • Ability to communicate your product decisions to all levels of the organisation

  • Ability to recognise and describe what a good user experience looks like

  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills

  • Familiarity with Agile ways of working

  • Ideally worked on products with enterprise clients

  • Ideally worked with remote development teams (we are split between London & Vancouver)


Why you’ll love us:



  • You’ll be part of a small, competent and highly ambitious team

  • You will own initiatives and have the autonomy to execute your plan

  • Be part of a rapidly growing business expanding internationally

  • A Perks@Work account for significant discounts on products, experiences and things like gym membership

  • Excellent tax-efficient equity scheme

items.title: Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=8, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=19}
items.content:
Who we are


Talent Match is launching in 8 months and has already raised significant investment.


Talent Match is revolutionising the way the recruitment industry operates and how those between the ages of 25 - 40 shape their career.


Talent Match is a platform where the world's talent can build a relationship with selected employers, months in advance of making their next career decision, disrupting the transactional inefficient labor market.


Through a set of proprietary data and algorithms, we are building a unique, prescreened, trusted, anonymous and invite-only platform.


We are delivering this through a beautiful, seamless, mobile-first, exciting Tribal concept.


Launching in May 2020, across 3 different countries with over 100 multinational employers, we are incredibly excited to be looking for a Product Designer to join the existing impressive experienced management team.


We have already secured initial capital and will be seeking a Series A in the next 12 months.


The Role


We are looking for a Product Designer, competent in both user-experience (UX) and user-interface (UI). You will need to understand our business requirements and any technical limitations, as well as be responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mockups and prototypes. You will be expected to design the overall functionality of the product, and in order to ensure a great user experience, iterate upon it in accordance with user-testing. The product is both native mobile and a web based dashboard.


Product User Responsibilities:



  • Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences

  • Facilitate the product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products

  • Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces

  • Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions    

  • Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features

  • Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders

  • Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas


Requirements



  • 5+ years of product design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex mobile solutions for complete digital environments

  • Strong design experience for native mobile and web based dashboards

  • Expertise in standard UX & UI software such as Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer, Illustrator, Marvel and the like 

  • Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a bonus

  • Experience in material assets from Google and iOS and responsive designs (cross browser)

  • A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns

  • Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently

  • Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients

  • Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications

  • Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval

  • Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design

  • Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism

  • Be passionate about all things UX & UI and other areas of design and innovation, research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies

  • Be open to remote working and travel (London, Madrid, Sweden, California)

items.title: Performance Marketing specialist
items.content:
Performance Marketing Specialist


 


Wagestream is a technology and financial services company with a social purpose. We partner with employers to allow their employees to access their earned-but-not-yet-paid wages in real time. 


 


Wagestream was founded with the desire to be a strong cause for social good, in making it possible for workers to gain fast access to accrued earnings. Our aim is to play a key role in reducing the UK poverty premium and prevent employees entering cycles of debt, caused by high interest credit or pay day loans. We are proud to have a social charter in our articles of association. 


 


We are a fast moving and dedicated bunch. We value individuality, honesty, integrity, a go-get attitude, team spirit and a sense of humour. 


 


Wagestream’s Performance Marketing Specialist


The ideal Performance Marketing Specialist at Wagestream is an entrepreneurial and creative out-of-the-box thinking digital whizz with a 'get-things-done' attitude, who wants to thrive in a fast-paced environment. What separates you from other marketers is your relentless drive for running new tests and experiments on a regular basis. You love data, but even more, you actually love implementing changes based on those findings - instead of just creating dashboards. You'll have a very important role to play in scaling up Wagestream's marketing efforts across all paid and digital channels. We are a fast-moving business and as such you’ll need to be comfortable working with ambiguity.



  • Launching and monitoring all paid B2B and B2C campaigns across search, social, display and retargeting networks by conducting extensive keyword research, testing creatives, optimising audiences and placements and regular performance analysis

  • Ensure successful campaigns managing bids and budgets to be able to meet the predefined KPI's and acquisition targets

  • Optimise campaigns across multiple channels to deliver the best return on investment whilst ‘growth hacking’ to find new avenues for growth

  • Identify replicable marketing strategies, tactics and channels that address business pain points and convey product benefits to drive new customer acquisition - with an implement, test, and measure mindset

  • Work alongside the wider marketing team to create and optimise content for marketing ads, campaigns and landing pages as well as suggesting new approaches to our messaging and product positioning.

  • Test different value propositions and messages across different channels to find the best angle to introduce and explain our product for each target group

  • Build and run A/B tests across landing pages and the homepage

  • Work alongside the dev team to optimise, build and manage the Wagestream website


Skills & Experience:



  • Minimum 2 years experience working with a performance marketing channel like PPC or Paid Social

  • Strong organisational skills with the ability to deliver a high volume of quality work

  • Creative skills for contributing new and innovative ideas

  • A keen eye for identifying new strategic opportunities and ideas for growth

  • The ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines

  • Strong analytical and data skills

  • Must be competent in martech and bidding platforms


    • Google Analytics/AdWords

    • Facebook

    • Linkedin

items.content:
Senior Product Owner (m/f/d) - Mobile Application

Company: Raisin
Location: Berlin, DE
Level: Senior
Language: English
Mobile Apps Developer
Skills:
  • Agile Methodologies
  • Java
  • Mobile Product Development
  • Product Management

    • Intro

    Raisin has been very successful over the last few years at delighting it’s customers through enabling deposits and investments without barriers across the EU. There are new realms of customer-delight still to explore and Mobile is one of them.

    Raisin is gearing up a Mobile expeditionary force with the objectives to better engage our current customers and win new customers for Raisin who prefer the powers of a smartphone-centric banking experience.

    As Senior Product Owner you will lead an in-house cross-functional squad of experienced mobile developers, product designers and product analysts to “co-create” with our customers our very first Raisin mobile experience, and use the Raisin flavour of lean and agile methodologies to evolve it into an ever-improving customer experience that is increasingly effective at achieving company objectives.  This includes testing and iterating on front-end user-experience, and connecting that UX reliably and resiliently to the Raisin back-end banking systems across both iOS and Android mobile devices, including smartphones and tablets.

    Specifically;

    • You will lead the mission to launch Raisin’s mobile experience, and iteratively improve it
    • Within that context you will ensure product strategy is collaboratively crafted and that vision is efficiently communicated and effectively executed throughout the company, and with key strategic partners
    • You organise priorities and strategically optimise scope to achieve rapid feedback cycles
    • You own and manage your product roadmap and backlog
    • By gaining an in-depth understanding of customer needs and users, you identify future potential for your products and get your teams, customers and business stakeholders excited about it
    • You enrich, structure and break down high level specs or requirements into epics, user stories and acceptance test executable by the development teams
    • You are responsible for identifying and monitoring Objectives and Key Results as well as using them as cornerstones for team focus and priorities
    • You will work collaboratively and constructively with other product owners to build an effective and resilient product chapter at Raisin

    Main requirements

    • At least three years of product management experience in a technical environment, ideally a Start-up, with agile development methodologies (Scrum)
    • You have significant knowledge in technical project management of software projects in the mobile app space
    • Based on that you possess profound experience in requirement analysis and collecting technical specifications 
    • You have a passion for understanding technology combined with an entrepreneurial spirit: Coding experience (e.g. java, kotlin, react, swift, objective-c) is of advantage
    • You either have experience or an interest in financial products and building wealth
    • You are experienced in communicating about technical concepts and ideas to all levels of stakeholders
    • Finally, you are an excellent team player with very good communication skills in English, ideally also German

    Nice to have

    * Good German skills are a plus

    Perks

    • Relocation and visa support as well as a relocation reimbursement
    • Personal training budget of 1,700 € and four full training days
    • Free choice of hardware
    • Hungry all the time? Breakfast, snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks are provided
    • Stay up to date at regular townhall sessions with our founders and feel free to ask any kinds of questions
    • Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days 
    • Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch Lottery, Tech Lunch, Xletix and Raisin Ladies Events

items.title: Social Media and Digital Marketing Intern
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
We are a London-based start-up that makes it easy for creatives to find and license visual content from social media and cloud services. Content creators can sign up via platforms such as Instagram, Flickr, YouTube, and Google Photos, making their content available for purchase through our marketplace. For each image or video purchased, the content creator receives 75% of the sale price. We are looking for an intern to join our team and drive our marketing and SM, and assist our Head of Content and Community in acquiring more quality content and users.


Ideal majors or interests are: marketing, new media, creative business management, communications, PR, photography and art. Native or really fluent English with great writing skills is a must as well as literacy, activeness and a strong desire to learn.


The internship is for 3 months (min. 20 hours per week), unpaid, but with the possibility to work remotely and get hired upon completion. We'll introduce you to a lot of different marketing tools to upgrade and develop your skills (could be very useful for your future career). Of course, if you deliver great results, there is always a chance to stay with us when the internship finishes.


Main Responsibilities



  • Design, build and maintain our social media presence

  • Communication with contributors and searching for ways to gain new ones

  • Monitoring and responding to users on social media

  • Reacting to and building a strategy around analytics reports and statistics

  • Content promotion and competitions

  • SEO (search engine optimization) and generating inbound traffic

  • Email marketing

  • Collaboration with the team to create landing pages and optimize user experience

  • Brainstorming new creative growth strategies to acquire new fresh and diverse content and users
