items.title: Digital Marketing Coordinator (Part-Time Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content: ORGANIZATION DESCRIPTIONFullstack Academy is the premier software development school located in New York City and Chicago. Y Combinator-backed, our school has garnered the attention of Forbes, TechCrunch, and Business Insider, among others. The reputation of our school is built on the professional success of each and every one of our students. Students have gone on to promising careers at top-tier companies, like Google, Facebook, Amazon, and Goldman Sachs. In late 2018, New York City selected Fullstack to build a world-class cybersecurity bootcamp, as part of its $100M Cyber NYC initiative. The bootcamp will be called the Fullstack Cyber Bootcamp. You can read more about the cyber bootcamp on its website at cyber.fullstackacademy.com, and in some of the news coverage it has received. In April 2019, Fullstack Academy was acquired by Zovio, a public Ed Tech company, and will be significantly scaling its operations."Fullstack Academy has been a life-changing experience" is something we hear often and the reason why we come to work everyday. We are looking for a Digital Marketing Coordinator with a drive to learn, contribute, and grow within a mission-driven Ed-tech organization. ABOUT THE ROLEAs the Digital Marketing Coordinator at Fullstack Academy, you will support a fast-moving team by executing various product and event marketing activities for all of Fullstack's programs, including our newest university and cyber initiatives. You will learn the fundamental principles of demand generation, events marketing, and social media marketing from an expert, supportive team. This is a part-time, work-from-home (WFH) remote role open to candidates located in the Phoenix, AZ and Chicago, IL areas and reports to our Demand Generation Manager. RESPONSIBILITIESIn this role, you will: Learn the fundamental principles of demand generation, events marketing, and social media marketing from an expert, supportive team. Support a fast-moving team by executing various product and event marketing activities for all of Fullstack's programs, including our newest initiatives, Cyber and University partnerships. Implement and track digital marketing campaigns across multiple online channels, building weekly reports to help achieve the team's KPIs. Manage and update relevant information on the Company's marketing websites, including, Fullstackacademy.com, Gracehopper.com, and Cyber.fullstackacademy.com Support event marketing initiatives, including Eventbrite administrative tasks. Compile lead generation research and competitive market data to help inform audience segmentation and lead generation strategy. Support day-to-day social & paid media marketing through campaign creation and optimization. QUALIFICATIONSYou are a great candidate for this role if you have: Up to 2 years of marketing experience or internship equivalent. Deep understanding of general marketing/advertising concepts. Excel skills, including the ability to complete VLOOKUPs and Pivot Tables. Strong organizational skills, aptitude for problem-solving, attention to detail, communication skills, and a no-task-too-small mentality. The ability to work independently and within a team environment and not afraid of taking responsibility. A passion for digital marketing and the desire to contribute to and grow within a mission-driven Ed-tech organization. You are an exceptional candidate for this role if you also have: Experience in developing and managing marketing reporting. Marketing experience in Education, Ed-Tech, or E-commerce environments. Experience with any of the following: Hubspot, Zapier, Google Sheets/Excel, Eventbrite, Intercom, or Zendesk. Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, Wordpress/Craft CMS or similar. Experience with digital paid media management, especially Google Ads and/or Facebook Ads.

items.content:
Intro:


Interested in working with an exciting young tech-startup that uses Machine Learning to create a high quality marketplace community…to become the Amazon of peer-to-peer? vendi is an AI-assisted marketplace to buy and sell verified products, starting with phones. We use AI to list and we verify the phone in seconds. This is an awesome opportunity to work with a young and dynamic team and get a good foothold in a fast expanding startup company. You will have a possibility to grow within the team, playing a crucial role in taking the company to the next level. Perfect for anyone who is interested in the tech industry and even more of a plus if you have an interest in AI and Machine Learning.

About the role:


We are looking for an enthusiastic social media manager that is capable of building a stronger brand presence in the main platforms like Facebook and Instagram…in our office in central London. We will also offer the opportunity to work remotely. This internship is a unique opportunity to gain insights into a new venture during the early stages of growth. We need someone who learns fast, is self-motivated, proactive and multi-disciplined.


 


Your Skills:


You have a strong knowledge using main social media platforms and understand the language used there:



  • You are reliable, organised, and pay attention to detail;

  • You are driven and have a “hands-on” mentality;

  • You feel comfortable handling different and multiple tasks on a daily basis; Growth hacking, marketing, and sales oriented knowledge is a plus.

items.title: B2B Digital Marketing Manager - PPC, YouTube, Facebook Ads
items.content:
About us:


Fanbytes is an influencer network helping the world’s biggest brands like Apple, Warner and Sony reach young people through influencers on Snapchat, Instagram and Tiktok.


Started in January 2017, we’ve grown pretty quickly counting brands like McDonald's, Deliveroo, Apple Music and the UK Government as our customers whilst featuring in publications like Forbes, Evening Standard, and The Times for our global campaigns.


We're based in Old Street with our rapidly growing team of 30 people. We're entering into a new phase of growth and looking for someone to help lead our paid marketing division working with our broader marketing team and social agencies to scale our marketing for Fanbytes.


Note- this role is to help grow our brand not to run ads for our clients.


Our team is one filled with entrepreneurs with our CEO and CTO having sold companies at 17 and 19 in both media and data respectively and this role is perfect for someone who wants to get stuck in and eventually lead the marketing team.


Responsibilities



  • Working with our CEO to design and implement paid social strategies across Facebook, YouTube and testing different channels.

  • Creating marketing funnels with our content partners to help drive leads and inquiries.

  • Creating and testing landing pages to ensure we're getting the best out of our marketing efforts.

  • Working with our content, social and video teams to scale the distribution of our Fanbytes content.


Key skills:



  • Strong writing experience in a B2B setting - being able to write to persuade audiences is key.

  • At least 12 months experience running paid social campaigns on Google or Facebook.

  • Analytical and data-driven to run conversion campaigns and scale profitable campaigns


What we offer:



  • Large progression for growth - the national trajectory for this role is to become a senior position in the marketing team.

  • Beautiful offices in Old Street with exposed brick walls.

  • Fun days out like Axe throwing (our CEO is a pro).

  • Millennial vibe - we believe in working hard but also creating a fun environment with other young forward-thinking people

  • Base salary including commission for leads generated.


To show you’ve read the whole application, please put “Axe throwing is life” at the start of your application and share an example of how you’ve used paid advertising to drive results.

items.title: Partnerships and Engagement Executive
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)

items.content:
Partnerships and Engagement Executive 
 

Location: Anywhere - Preferred countries: UK/Chile//USA

Full Time 

Duration: 3 months initially, with the option to extend.

 

Who we are 

At Vocsta, we’re out to change the way the world discovers new music stars! We are a group of founders located across the world, passionate about music and we are creating an online music platform allowing social media to determine who the next big star is! 

 

We are hiring! Partnerships and Engagement is a huge part of our intended growth story and we are on the lookout for a Partnerships and Engagement Executive to analyze how we can increase engagement through our online competition as well as secure influencer and brand partnerships! 

 

The role 

- Research similar apps and identify how Vocsta can engage its customer base better 

- You’ll be using your network and online resources to lead the sourcing, managing, and execution of strategic partnerships geared toward music influencers and brands 

- You’ll lead the charge in researching contacts, reaching out and influencing individuals, institutions and organizations to come on board as partners 

-  You’ll work directly with the founding team, specifically the head of marketing rolling out these partnerships 

- You'll support the writing and pitching of sponsorship proposals 

- You'll lead the transition from customer-prospect to customer, including finalizing contracts or memorandums of understanding 

- You’ll actively manage progress in a CRM or Excel tracker 

- You’ll support our overall campaign as needed (filling out application forms, preparing materials, participating in events etc) 

- You’d be on hand to support with Vocsta’s PR efforts 

- You’ll be executing Business development activities, leading the identification of decision-makers and reaching out to potential partners. 

- Using your network and know-how to take your ideas and proposals to the people that matter, in some of the world’s biggest and most high-profile organisations. 

 

About you 

The successful candidate will be passionate about music, music talent discovery and will be willing to represent us everywhere. 

You’d have to be disciplined, proactively follow up to completion, not be afraid of cold calling and have a clear attitude and focus on getting things done! 

You’d be great at pitching and presenting opportunities in the most compelling way both verbally and written. 

We’re looking for a driven, ambitious individual who can deliver results fast and is comfortable with sharing daily advances/reports to the team. 

You would have a great understanding of how and which brands work with influencers. 

Candidate must be willing to represent the team if we get accepted in an abroad accelerator program, with the option to relocate for 3 - 4months (or the duration of the program)

 

Experience/skills required. 

You must have at least 90% of the experience below to be considered: 

• Experience in partnership management 

• University Education 

• Fluent in written and conversational English 

• Very good communication skills 

• Be familiar with MS Office Suite specifically Word, Powerpoint and Outlook and overall use of the internet and social media platforms. 

• Able to visit institutions for meetings (outside the city if needed)  

• A great understanding of how and which brands work with influencers. 

• A good understanding of mainstream popular/trending music 

• You must have access to your own laptop/phone to perform the role and be willing to travel for meetings 

 

We’re offering you: 

• The chance to work with an early-stage startup 

• Flexible working conditions (i.e. work remotely on your own device) 

• Potential opportunity to be extended 

 

Process: We’re a start-up so we have to be very efficient with our time. We’ll only be progressing with applicants who can demonstrate at least 90% of the skills we are after. 

1. Send us your CV and tell us why this role is perfect for you 

2. We’ll invite you for a telephone or in-person interview where we will tell you more about who we are and ask you to provide us with an idea for an Instagram campaign. 

We’d ask you to present to us which influencer AND brand would be involved and what benefits we would offer to them both.

3. We’ll finalize the interview process by having a video interview with our CEO and/or a co-founder

items.title: MercuryWorks: Software Product Owner
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=4, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Software Product Owner

 
We are a closely-held web and mobile application development firm looking for a driven Product Owner.  Are you experienced in product management, Lean and Agile development methods?  Passionate about building products that customers love?  Looking for a no-politics zone to do your best work?  Mercury is the place for you!

The Work

The Product Owner will product own and help ship of a range of web and native applications including:
  • Custom business applications utilizing rich HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript-driven front ends
  • Progress Web Applications
  • Business intelligence and collaboration systems
  • iOS and Android business applications
  • Large-scale website development based on innovative creative design, highly usable custom widgets and CMSes

Skills & Requirements

The position requires proven work experience in product management with a technical background and understanding of (perhaps even hands-on experience) software development and web technologies.

The Product Owner will work within multidisciplinary Scrum teams, so strong problem-solving skills and a willingness to roll up one’s sleeves will go a long way.  The ability to research, reason and communicate recommendations to clients and executive management is crucial.

Specific requirements include the following:
  • Bachelor’s Degree favored, preferably in Business, Computer Science and/or Engineering
  • 5+ years of hands-on experience with Agile-driven software development
  • 5+ years in a professional work environment analyzing business problems, collaborating and leading teams preferred
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are pretty darn important, too.
An affinity for caffeinated beverages and a strong meme stash won’t hurt your chances.

Some Specifics

At Mercury you will:
  • Translate product strategy into detailed user stories and prototypes
  • Collaborate with interface designers and software architects to define product vision
  • Create and prioritize product backlogs
  • Apply exact standards to ensure that high quality applications and sites are delivered
  • Represent the company with customers and guide company resources to meet their needs

What Kind of Products Will You Work On?

  • Web, mobile and collaboration applications for the Southeast's fastest growing commercial real estate firms
  • Progressive web application for one of the nation’s leading furniture retailers
  • Ecommerce, operational management and transactional reporting system for a funded late-stage startup
  • iOS, Android and PWA applications for Fortune 50 consumer products field workforce
  • Data dashboards, drill down business intelligence reports and mobile reporting for global professional services firms

How to Know If You're A Fit

If any of the following excites you, we definitely want to talk to you!
  • A Product Manager's Job
  • Mind the Product Blog
  • CRAFT
  • Someone who can explain Scrum in 10 minutes

This Is A Remote-Friendly Position

Mercury is a distributed workforce with developers and designers located throughout the United States.  We are open to applicants located anywhere in the continental United States (we find all team members being within 3 time zones of each other best for collaboration) and also Tampa Bay-based professionals.

About H1B Visas and Recruiters

At this time we are not considering the sponsorship of H1B candidates.  Also, no recruiters.  Definitely; please no recruiters.  None.  No matter how good you think your candidate is.

items.title: Envira Gallery: Digital Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Digital Marketing Manager

As a Digital Marketing Manager at Envira Gallery you're responsible for the marketing strategy, development, implementation, tracking and optimization of our campaigns across all digital channels.

At Envira Gallery, we help customer’s build amazing WordPress galleries and sliders for their sites in minutes. Our products, Envira Gallery and Soliloquy have been downloaded over 2.5M times and are the most recommended and highest reviewed in the market. Our customers depend on our products for not only their passions, but their livelihoods.
  • We listen to our customers and strive to do what’s best for them
  • We work as a team in a collaborative environment where honesty, integrity, enthusiasm and hard work are our qualities
  • We are passionate about our products and making them the best we can
We’re a small, lean and profitable growing company. Our roles are challenging yet fulfilling.

To Love and Thrive in This Role
  • You are a self-starter with a strong digital marketing track record of driving growth
  • You live and breath conversion optimization
  • You make data driven marketing decisions
  • You have a hunger to test and experiment with new and innovative ideas using your strong copywriting skills
  • You enjoy rolling up your sleeves and seeing things through to completion
  • You sweat the details and take pride in your work
  • You love geeking out over anything internet marketing related

Role Responsibilities
  • Design comprehensive marketing strategies that will grow revenue
  • Execute on all marketing efforts, including marketing strategy, SEO/SEM, email, social media, and digital advertising campaigns
  • Measure and report performance of digital marketing campaigns
  • Collaborate with internal teams to create new marketing content and collateral
  • Find new and creative growth strategies
  • Grow and nurture affiliate program
  • Test and optimize all marketing efforts
  • Represent the voice of the customer and provide customer and market insights

Required Qualifications
  • 2+ years in a digital marketing role with a track record of proven results
  • Experience with CRO
  • Experience with marketing funnels
  • Experience with email marketing
  • Advanced copywriting experience that have produced strong conversions
  • Experience with A/B testing tools
  • Experience building partner relationships and creating cross-promotional partnerships
  • Experience with SEO (content marketing, link building, technical audits, etc)
  • Advanced proficiency with Google Analytics
  • Deep analytical skills obsessed with tracking and improving KPIs
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

Preferred Qualifications
  • 2+ years experience in the SaaS, eCommerce space
  • Experience working with WordPress
  • Experience working remotely

Key Performance Indicators
  • Revenue Growth
  • Customer Churn Metrics

What We Offer
  • Competitive Salary
  • Work from Home – You can choose to work from home or anywhere that has internet. We value people that are self-motivated to produce results without someone looking over their shoulder.
  • Unlimited PTO – We offer PTO days and official company holidays. You’ll get Unlimited – Responsible PTO, which means you can take whatever time you need off whenever you need it without worrying about how much PTO you have.
  • Company Retreats – Our team gets together once a year for a week to share what we’ve learned as well as to hang out and enjoy spending time with the people we work with. All expenses paid.
  • Annual Bonuses – We value our team and their hard work which is why we offer annual performance bonuses.
  • Paid Parental Leave – After one year with the company 30 calendar days paid maternity/paternity leave and up to 60 calendar days total time off with position guaranteed.
  • Invest in You – We offer opportunities for personal and professional development and training. Whether it’s learning new coding languages or design tools, we’ll support you in doing what you love.
  • Fun Environment – We’re a welcoming group that loves tacos, video games and silly GIFs. The chats are always fun and sometimes random while we work.

Envira Gallery is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

items.title: Senior Product Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Our market leading hospitality API platform provides software and hardware companies with fast and secure access to data from hotels. We're looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our team to lead the development of our data acquisition products. These are tools that are used internally by our integrations and engineering team to acquire the data that powers our API.


As a Senior Product Manager at Impala, you'll:





  • Have responsibility for the further development of existing tools as well as the development of new technologies that make data acquisition easier and quicker.

  • Ensure that the tasks on your team are well prioritised and are working on what's important.

  • Develop our acquisition product suite so that they continue to lead the market in security and speed.

  • Work with our Head of Product and wider product team to establish best practices across teams.

  • Have a major say in the future development of Impala products.


What we're looking for:



  • Great communication skills, you must speak and write clearly.

  • Significant experience managing technical products.

  • An understanding of Robotic Process Automation and common database technologies.

  • Good capability with SQL.

  • A first class intellect.


What would make you stand out:



  • Experience within hospitality or travel technology.

  • An engineering or solutions engineering background.







About Impala



Impala is a team of eleven incredibly talented, helpful and outgoing individuals (plus one more modest individual that wrote this job post) based in London (with a remote engineering team). We’re a diverse team that puts building a great product and being happy at work as our two guiding principles. We're also very well funded by industry leading investors.


What we offer:



  • A competitive salary and equity based on experience.

  • Frequent socials.

  • Flexible working hours.

  • Time dedicated every Friday afternoon for personal projects, lightning talks and team events.

  • A monthly allowance for books and other educational materials.

  • The opportunity to work alongside a tight knit and driven team.


Where we differ is:



  • You'll be working in a company that puts professional development front and centre.

  • We'll listen to you. We're hiring you for your knowledge and experience and we intend to put that to work.

  • We have an incredible culture and community.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Tech Start-up looking for interns


Are you an ambitious individual, with strong marketing skills and an interest in social media? Do you currently have some spare time, which you can dedicate to building a new app based business?


We are a small team seeking a marketer/social media manager to join our team.


We are an early-stage start-up with a defined plan for developing an innovative and useful mobile app for millennial which allows them to search for a driving instructor and book their driving lessons via the app and much more. The primary purpose of the app is to facilitate new learners to search for a driving instructor and book a driving lesson in less than a minute.


What we require from our ideal intern:



  1. Strong social media knowledge.

  2. Create social media content.

  3. Run marketing campaigns.

  4. Development of brand awareness and online reputation

  5. Set clear objectives.

  6. Deliberate planning, strategy and goal setting.

  7. Cultivation of leads and sales.


This is a diverse role which is best suited to a person with an entrepreneurial spirit who will be motivated by being engaged with the many important and varying activities required to get a new business established and operational.


The successful person will be responsible for managing himself or herself without the need for close supervision. Drive, motivation, discipline, diligence, perseverance.


You can work from home or our working office it’s up to you.


This is a 3-month volunteer position with travel expenses covered with the potential to move into a full-time paid role.


We look forward to hearing from all those who feel they have what it takes. Thanks for your time and interest in this notice.

items.content:
Doubledot Media

Digital Marketing Manager (saas Product)

verified
Worldwide
[Doubledot Media](https://www.doubledotmedia.com) is a New Zealand-based company creating online tools and training for people looking to start their own online businesses. We’re based in Christchurch, but the majority of our team work remotely from various places around the world. We’re looking for a talented marketing manager to join us who can help to build one of our software products into a powerful online brand. You will be responsible for developing and implementing an effective marketing strategy for, building on what we’ve already achieved and taking the brand to new heights. Collaborating with our product development team, marketing staff, designers, partners and customers, you’ll need to be a good sort and have excellent communication skills. But most importantly, you’ll be an experienced digital marketer who’s confident using the latest tools and techniques to achieve results. For us, that means generating leads, converting customers, and helping to turn our products into the best within industry. Basically, if you’re the kind of person who gets excited by Google algorithm updates and wants to play a leading role in growing a great software product, we want to hear from you! **Neat things about working with us** * Flexible hours (we are happy to discuss full-time, part-time, contracting for the role) * Relaxed, ego-free, family-friendly work culture * Novelty coffee mugs * An extremely comfortable chair * Tap dancing seagulls # Responsibilities * Identifying, developing, and evaluating our company’s marketing strategy and plan for one of our key products. * Working with the product development team to develop product strategy based on user feedback and market trends * Hiring and managing marketing staff * Setting, and achieving short and long-term marketing planning and goals * Coordinating and participating in promotional and inbound marketing activities, working with writers, to market our products and services * You will be working closely with designers, partners and customers so it is essential your communication and planning skills are top notch * Examining ways to improve user experience and coming up with product recommendations # Requirements * 3+ years commercial experience marketing digital content * Experience working with a remotely distributed team * An excellent knowledge of inbound marketing and analytical software/metric analysis * Experience with email marketing * Be extremely well organized, have experience in project/staff management and know how to get the most out of staff * Have been involved in search marketing or link building campaigns * Know how to build a powerful online brand #Location - Worldwide

items.content:
Rock Star Social Media Manager

WANTED: Rock Star Social Media Process Manager With Top-Notch Process Management Skills

Are you a killer social media manager with experience increasing engagement on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram? Do you live on social media 24/7 and wouldn’t dream of being out of touch for more than a few hours? Are you primarily a people organizer, with the ability to plan a schedule and get others to stick to your timeline? Would you be psyched to manage a social media community of smart, successful women seeking dating, relationship, and confidence advice?

Well, you might be the rock star social media process manager we’re looking for.

This is a critical role on our team that requires a super organized, independent self-starter. We need you to not be shy about keeping others — even our CEO — to a schedule. If you need a lot of hand holding, you won’t be a great fit for this role. 

It’s also not a content creation role — we’re using existing content that Matthew creates, and someone else will be delivering that weekly. Your process management, organizational, and teamwork skills, as well as your flexibility, will be more important than anything in this role.

The qualities we’re looking for include:

– High level of organizational skills and ability to organize others
– Process mindset and ability to see the big picture from a linear, process-driven perspective and organize others within that
– Confidence, but no ego
– Ability to keep others on schedule, no fear in your project management skillset
– Lots of flexibility 
– High digital availability and willingness to grow with us
– Passion for and devotion to the work we do and our community
– Dependability
– Prior experience as a freelancer preferred
– Two years of social media management experience preferred (bonus points if it’s for a media personality)

Responsibilities include:

– Process managing two designers, a video editor, and our CEO to get posts planned, ready, and scheduled (we have someone else who will source & deliver content from our existing library)
– Finalizing approvals from Matthew 
– Scheduling daily posts and tweets
– Creating a social media content schedule every month 
– Helping put in place a team to review comments and respond to messages with questions about our programs
– Willingness to speak up with ideas as well as take final direction where necessary

Why Join Us?

You’ll work remotely with a good amount of flexibility. We are 100% remote, with team members based in LA, NY, the UK, Eastern Europe, and Asia. 

Make an impact – help women level-up in their relationships, self-esteem, and happiness.

Be part of a positive, upbeat team that deals with each other with respect and gratitude.

HOURS

This role starts as part-time freelance for 20 hours per week, but we are looking for someone who wants to be full time and expect the hours to grow rapidly. Given that most of our customers are in the U.S., we generally work U.S. business hours, so you should have consistent availability within 9 am - 6 pm Eastern time hours (if you’re an early bird and want to work from Pacific Time, or a night owl who wants to work from European hours, we don’t care, but we’ll need to be reliably able to reach you during these hours). You’ll need consistent availability for team video calls between the hours of 11 AM - 3 PM Eastern.

To be considered, please write a cover letter to recruiting@howtogettheguy.com as to why you’d be a good fit in the body of your email. DO NOT send a CV or other attachments (if you attach ANYTHING to it, your application will automatically not be read). We prioritize culture fit, attention to detail, and superstar-quality writing when selecting candidates. 

You’ll be interviewing with our Customer Support Lead, Courtney. Her favorite color is red, so she’d be pleased if you put that word somewhere in your subject line when sending your letter.

Looking forward to meeting you!

items.content:
Paid Media Marketing Director at PhoneBurner

Remote

Location: Remote · Laguna Beach, California, United States

About Us

Were a fast growing and leading SaaS company in the dialer space. Were looking to double our growth and were looking for the right person to help us get there!

The majority of our team works remotely and works through Slack for chat and Zoom for video chats. We expect you to be online during normal work hours and it should feel just like were in the office together except you can work from home and not deal with traffic. We also have allowances for a co-working space if working from home is not ideal for you.

Requirements

Key Functional Areas of Responsibility

  • Manage, review, and perform daily account responsibilities associated with Google AdWords, Yahoo, Bing and other search platforms.
  • Maintain and monitor keyword bids, account daily and monthly budget caps, impression share, quality score and other important account metrics.
  • Manage the creation of large keyword lists.
  • Provide creative copy suggestions and graphical ad templates.
  • Manage Display network placement lists on AdWords and through other contextual advertising platforms.
  • Manage and launch Paid Media campaigns from LinkedIn, Facebook, and other sources of traffic.
  • Provide recommendations and execute strategies for keyword opportunities, campaign structuring, targeting, display network, and other facets of paid search in accordance with client goals.
  • Provide oversight and manage new paid search campaigns, ad groups, and accounts and aid in the creation of paid search marketing initiatives.
  • Provide oversight, manage, and be able to generate weekly and monthly client reporting for all major metrics, goals tracking, revenue tracking, and other paid search initiatives.
  • Keep pace with search engine and PPC industry trends and developments.
  • Monitor and administer web analytics dashboards, reports and key reporting tools, and point out key areas of importance in accordance client goals.
  • Monitor and evaluate search results and search performance across the major search channels.
  • Communication to team and management on project development, timelines, and results.

Professional Competencies

  • Ability to think creatively, and identify and resolve problems.
  • Attention to detail and the ability to effectively multi-task in a deadline driven atmosphere.
  • High levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.
  • Excellent analytical, organizational, project management and time management skills.

Professional Skills & Qualifications

  • No less than 7 years experience in Search Engine Marketing (SEM) and Paid Search (PPC).
  • Experience with website analysis using a variety of analytics tools including Google Analytics, Supermetrics, optmyzr.
  • Experience in Photoshop (light editing and review)
  • Experience working with popular PPC ad platforms (Google AdWords, Bing AdCenter, Yahoo).
  • Experience working with popular social PPC ad (Facebook, Linkedin)
  • AdWords / Bing certification a plus.
  • Comfortable working in Excel/google sheets
  • Comfortable writing typical formulas for data review (vlookup, sumifs, etc)
  • Experience with intercom.io a plus.
  • Experience with B2B and B2C marketing
  • Experience setting up A/B test, monitoring, reporting on results
  • Experience with A/B testing platforms a plus
  • Able to work well independently and at times with a team

Highly preferred experience

We need a person a that will not just live in the paid search shell, we need a can do attitude and isnt afraid to learn something new on the job. If you have skills with most of the following SEM Tool Experience/Computer software, then that will be a huge plus:

  • Google Adwords
  • MS adCenter
  • Adwords editor
  • MS Adcenter Desktop
  • Google Analytics
  • Call Rail
  • Spyfu
  • Filezilla
  • Google Conversion optimizer
  • Microsoft Office: Access, Word, Power point, Outlook
  • Excel (Pivot tables, Charts, vlookup, Analytic formulas)
  • Basic HTML/PHP editing
  • Adobe Creative Suite
  • Google Sheets
  • Supermetrics
  • Dropbox
  • Asana

Benefits

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Industry: Telecommunications service provider

Job Functions: Paid Media Marketing

Salary Range: $60,000 – $80,000

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Identity and Access Management Senior Analyst at Allstate

Remote
  • Location: Countrywide, Countrywide, US
  • Company: Allstate Insurance Company

Where good people build rewarding careers.

Think that working in the insurance field can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You’ll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers’ lives. We’ll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.

Job Description

We are looking for a talented, experienced, and innovative individual to advance strategic opportunities and initiatives affecting emerging technology, trends, and strategy for Identity and Access Management. The Candidate should have a strong understanding of the principles of Identity and Access Management, and how it enables and impacts business needs. The expectation is that they have experience with implementation and deployment of various IAM products to ensure that Strategies devised align with operational expectations. They should be experienced and confident in assessing and communicating business drivers and risks; developing mitigation or enhancement strategies and positions; and working through the appropriate influence mechanisms internally and externally. This position will require regular matrixing with teams across the Security organization. This candidate must also be regularly learning about emerging technology developments and trends, hard-working, self-driven and able to demonstrate sound judgment even in ambiguous situations. This role can sit remote from any location.

Key Responsibilities

  • Plays a leadership role in supporting and guiding the architectural planning, factoring in an understanding of long term strategies for the business into a vision for the future technology architecture.
  • Acts as a technical guide accountable for multiple technologies, with knowledge of the capabilities and constraints of technologies supported.
  • Demonstrates a strong understanding of the current and future technology architecture, including the inter-operability of technologies.
  • Provides support for education, guidance and training to the internal team members and stakeholders
  • Analyzes cross-technology/platform issues and addresses problems factoring in an understanding of the current and future architectures, and devises strategies for compensating for issues discovered.
  • Leads the evaluation of new technologies and the challenges that they pose to existing security posture – e.g. SaaS, PaaS, IaaS, CI/CD, Microservice Security, Predictive Analytics, etc. – relative to their domain(s).
  • Proposes Strategy and Approaches supported by a thorough analysis of capabilities and business case.
  • Assesses the business impacts of new technologies and threats, and develops updated strategies for the Enterprise to pursue, leading to more efficient and cost-effective approaches to address technical and business issues.
  • Supports a framework for data driven decisions that map to the Services CMM
  • Works with the team to understand the strategic impact of existing contracts and spend with consideration of the long term needs of the business.
  • Works closely with other teams in the Security Organization to drive a more integrated Security Posture
  • Understands and complies with industry policy, laws, regulations, and compliance rules as applicable. This includes looking at strategies for improving compliance training, adherence to internal procedures, controls, etc.

Job Qualifications

  • Highly organized and collaborative, self-starter- This role can sit remote from any location.
  • Proficiency in Identity Management Principles, with experience in cloud computing, cloud security, security assurance
  • Knowledge of emerging technology environment in financial and insurance sectors a plus
  • Experience with IAM technologies, Compliance Requirements, Risk Assessment processes, and Project Execution.
  • Knowledge of IAM products within the domain is required. E.g. SailPoint, ADFS, Active Directory, Virtual Directory, Multi-Factor,
  • Expertise in RESTful Web Services, Microservice based design and CI/CD is strongly desired
  • An understanding of Agile development is a plus
  • Demonstrated ability to build and foster effective relationships and networks with others.
  • Highly effective oral, written and interpersonal communication skills; demonstrated ability to effectively and comfortably interact at senior and executive corporate, political and educational institution levels.
  • Maintain highest personal levels of ethical conduct, confidentiality and integrity, with a strong professional reputation in the industry.
  • Self-starter with proven track record of successfully working with a wide array of functional groups across an organization and cultures as well as working independently.
  • Ability to influence, negotiate with, and persuade others is required. Must be flexible and demonstrate strong judgment/decision-making skills, and political acumen.

Job Type:
C: 3.53

Apply for job

items.title: MKG Marketing: Digital Advertising Expert at Remote Agency
items.content:
Digital Advertising Expert at Remote Agency

Make An Impact

As a Digital Advertising Expert at MKG Marketing.

What is Success?

As digital marketers nothing is more infuriating than getting to the end of an “Awareness” campaign for a client to ask us how much money we made them. Right?

Impact The Bottom Line

At MKG, our Digital Advertising strategy begins with a measurement plan that maps directly back to a client's business outcomes.

Return on Investment. Sales Pipeline Created. 

We create a clear path of success for our team members and the client.

Job Purpose

Key Digital Ad/PPC Accounts: This person will support one to three clients with the guidance of an Account Director. You will be responsible for Digital Advertising Strategy, Campaign Build Outs and Optimization for these clients.

Support the Digital Advertising Team: You’ll also work with another Digital Advertising Expert. While you own the work for you clients, we believe that no man is an island and everyone should support each other in making Paid campaigns more effective.

Key Skills Required

Paid Media Strategy: The person in this role who will succeed is a strategist in addition to being able to execute. You'll start with client's goal and work backwards to clearly communicate how to achieve them.

Paid Search and Display: We are looking for marketers who are proficient on Google Ads and Bing Ads. This includes the use of advanced scripts and automation practices to make campaigns more efficient and effective.

Paid Social: Our Paid Search and Display often pair up with Paid Social campaigns. We're looking for someone with 5-8 years of experience with Facebook Ads Manager, LinkedIn Advertising, and Twitter Ads.

Clear Communication: As a distributed company, it’s imperative that you are able to clearly communicate across multiple channels. Email, Zoom Video Conference and Slack are the key communication tools in our stack.

Want to Learn More?

Check out the detailed job posting on our website: https://mkgmarketinginc.com/jobs/advertising-expert/

This post includes information about:
  • What it's like to work at MKG
  • How we function as a remote team
  • Our 100% retention rate for full time team members over the lifetime of our company
  • Benefits such as the $8,000 new hire finders fee as well as business development bonuses for introducing us to new business opportunities
  • The flexibility we offer to our team members (huge bonus for all of us!)

items.content:
With the rise of flexible work comes an increased demand for flexible, pay-as-you-go housing. RoomForTea allows young professionals, students & interns to book a room for a mid-term, flexible period (1-3 months). We find rooms in local homes & full flats and verify them, creating a safer and more affordable alternative to other rental platforms on the market. 


 


On the back of a cutting-edge digital platform that is now built-out and ready for scale, RoomForTea is ready to make a splash and grow its operations, and we are looking for a Content & Marketing intern to join us for a part-time internship and help with marketing efforts.


 


Role


 


We are looking for a high energy, creative and motivated individual with great content writing skills, who can join the team to help with Guest Marketing in particular. That means finding new channels to reach our guest target market (young professionals, interns and students), and building on current channels. This position is open to individuals with different levels of experience, and there is lots of room for creativity, but the key deliverable is to help us double bookings next quarter. 


 


Main tasks you will be involved with:


 



  • Engage with current community to increase bookings, e.g engage with guests & suggest rooms, collect feedback & reviews, encourage referrals etc.

  • Recruit & onboard new users through current & new channels

  • Create web pages with basic content about London areas & keywords

  • Create online marketing content using professional photos of our properties (e.g. instagram/facebook/twitter/pinterest posts) and create youtube videos

  • Admin tasks - book house visits, photographers, follow up on references, reviews, referrals


 


What skills do we need?


 



  • Good understanding of content marketing & social media - someone who is digitally savvy, who can create and post engaging content

  • Interest in community engagement - someone who can find and engage new users online and through partner networks

  • Advantage: a creative individual with media skills (image/video editing skills on Adobe Suite or basic editing software like Canva)

  • Great interpersonal and communication skills

  • Ability to meet targets

  • Attention to detail and good written skills


 


What traits would complement our current team?


 



  • Someone who is entrepreneurial and can generate traction even where resources are limited

  • Someone creative who likes developing ideas on their own, but equally likes being part of a team and collaborating to brainstorm on strategy

  • Someone able to manage their own time and be able to work independently

  • Someone with a strong work ethic and a ‘can do’ attitude


 


What’s in it for you?


 



  • Fixed rate for each new guest/booking to be agreed on

  • RoomForTea booking vouchers, redeemable on any room rental on roomfortea.com

  • Flexible working arrangements and ability to work remotely

  • Opportunity to be hired as full-time employee upon completion of internship


 


To apply please send your CV and a brief statement of interest.

items.content:
Tax Analyst at Liberty Tax Service

Remote
  • Full Time Skilled Staff
  • Corporate Office – Virginia Beach VA, Virginia Beach, VA,

    US

  • Corporate Remote
  • Requisition ID: 5569

Position Purpose

The primary role of the Analyst is to keep Company tax software products up to date with published tax law changes year over year. Updates and new tax content are managed through use of proprietary calculation, user interface and forms mode templates and standards.

Position Responsibilities/Duties/Functions/Tasks

  • Tax Law Research: Research the latest federal and state tax filing instructions and communicate that knowledge both orally and in writing to other team members as a contribution to the development and maintenance of our proprietary tax software platforms.
  • Testing: Ensure the accuracy of tax software for the end-user by testing for software user interface errors and correctness of tax calculations. Communicate with software developers via proprietary systems (Team Foundation Server (TFS)) to initiate necessary corrections.
  • Create User Interface and Tax Calculation Specifications: Using an Excel template, create specifications that detail how the tax software will function. This includes providing tax values calculations, user interface screen layouts, navigational flow and error checking validations.
  • Create Forms Mode specifications: Using an Excel template, create specifications that details how the data is to be entered/captured on the form (e.g. source form, direct entry, collections, etc.) and the interfacing/mapping of each field on a form to that on the corresponding user interface specification.
  • Support the End User: Assist with answering tax related questions and software issues submitted by our tax offices.
Apply for job

items.title: Community Manager
items.content:
DESCRIPTION


We’re looking for a Community Manager to be the voice of Tyk in all of our community interactions and actively promote and discuss the Tyk brand messaging, to ensure users understand our content and collect feedback, this role will be defining the ongoing strategy for community management at Tyk.


In all of this, you’ll be supported by our Marcomms team, and will check in regularly with the Support Manager We’ll work together to implement and refine our strategy. We are a remote-first team though, so it’s vital that you have a keen sense of initiative and are confident to execute plans and communicate effectively.



Responsibilities:

  • Manning currently unmanned channels to increase user engagement (Quora/Stack Overflow etc)

  • Replying to mentions and social media comments

  • Getting to know all about typical Tyk users - how they use Tyk, why they use Tyk, what they love about it, what they hate

  • Nurturing and growing the community forum

  • Creating community and ‘how to’ content based on trends and questions seen in support or on the forums

  • Creating and implementing a community advocacy programme

  • Producing relevant reporting and analysis to understand the ROI for investment in the community

  • Being the voice and advocate for the Tyk community within Tyk, working closely with the Marketing Executive - Community Content

  • Establish content themes with marketing/support team based on user need - create engaging community content to be promoted on forum/support channels, or via marketing team

  • Ensure responsiveness of Tyk on all relevant channels

  • Advocate for Tyk by demonstrating Tyk’s capabilities to a wider audience (e.g. online demos/webinars, presentations at meet-ups and/or conferences)

  • Create a suite of Community reports, agree and meet targets

  • Build ongoing relationships with Community users and clients

  • Identify leads from communications/misuse of the product




Essential Skills:



  • Must have demonstrable experience in managing community forums, ideally in a B2B technical environment

  • Demonstrable experience in user support and turning users into advocates

  • Experience creating engaging user content and content planning

  • Experience advocating for a community within an organisation

  • Ability to use a variety of systems such as Discourse, Metabase BI and Freshdesk

  • Stakeholder management skills

  • Creative, innovative and problem-solving

  • Prioritises learning and continuous improvement

  • Highly analytical

  • Good public speaker and presenter

  • Ability to work remotely with our distributed team

  • Fluent in written and spoken business-level English




Benefits


There is an attractive package based on experience and performance that includes equity. Everyone has unlimited paid holiday.


You will work with a talented, and passionate team of industry experts, who are developing a cutting-edge product that is driving change and innovation within startups and household names alike.


We’re a distributed team. Work from one of our offices during induction, once you are up to speed, you can work from home, a cafe, your mums house, wherever you get your best work done, we’ll support you in making that happen.


We are growing rapidly and are looking for team members keen to grab hold, accelerate that further and shape our future. The Tyk API Management platform is helping to drive the connected world and power new products and services. We’re changing the way that organisations connect any number of their systems and services.


Whether internal, external, public or highly encrypted systems, Tyk helps businesses drive value across the retail, finance, telecoms, healthcare, or media industries (to name just a few!) If you’ve banked online, used an app to check the news, or perhaps even driven a connected car, API’s, and by extension, Tyk, make that possible.

items.title: PPC Manager
items.content:
You’ll be taking PPC in-house for us for the first time and you’ll have total ownership of the Google Ads and Bing account, including strategy, optimisation, tracking, analysis & reporting. 


We need someone who is as passionate about the growth potential of Shift as we are. We’ve grown 10x in the last 6 months and our PPC budget has 5x too, but we know there’s a lot more to come. 


This role will operate out of the newly formed London office with some travel to our other offices required, particularly in the first few months. Salary + equity on experience.


Day-to-day you’ll:



  • Manage PPC across Shift, including strategy, launching campaigns, optimisation, tracking, analysis & reporting

  • Work with product to drive conversion of traffic on site e.g., build and run A/B tests on Landing pages

  • Anticipate and respond to competitor behaviour and industry trends

  • Help to refine our attribution methodology

  • Help to refine our bid management approach to activate new and existing users

  • Work with the wider marketing, marketplace and data teams


You’ll be a dream if you:



  • Are obsessed with your numbers and have a laser focus on CPCs, CTRs, CVRs, CPLs, CPAs and LTVs

  • Have a technical mindset with strong knowledge of tagging, tracking and attribution

  • Are highly motivated, self-starter with a positive outlook and a friendly attitude


And if you show evidence of the below, that’d be nice too:



  • Have a formidable track record running search campaigns, ideally in a marketplace, e-commerce or travel company

  • Have thorough understanding of Bid Management tools and experience of setting a successful bid management strategy

  • Managed at least six figure monthly budgets

items.title: Content & Marketing Internship
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
With the rise of flexible work comes an increased demand for flexible, pay-as-you-go housing. RoomForTea allows young professionals, students & interns to book a room for a mid-term, flexible period (1-3 months). We find rooms in local homes & full flats and verify them, creating a safer and more affordable alternative to other rental platforms on the market. 


 


On the back of a cutting-edge digital platform that is now built-out and ready for scale, RoomForTea is ready to make a splash and grow its operations, and we are looking for a Content & Marketing intern to join us for a part-time internship and help with marketing efforts.


 


Role


 


We are looking for a high energy, creative and motivated individual with great content writing skills that can help with Guest Marketing in particular. That means finding new channels to reach our guest target market (young professionals, interns and students), and building on current channels. This position is open to individuals with different levels of experience, and there is lots of room for creativity, but the key deliverable is to help us double bookings next quarter. 


 


Main tasks you will be involved with:


 



  • Engage with current community to increase bookings, e.g engage with guests & suggest rooms, collect feedback & reviews, encourage referrals etc.

  • Recruit & onboard new users through current & new channels

  • Create web pages with basic content about London areas & keywords

  • Create online marketing content using professional photos of our properties (e.g. instagram/facebook/twitter/pinterest posts) and create youtube videos

  • Admin tasks - book house visits, photographers, follow up on references, reviews, referrals


 


What skills do we need?


 



  • Good understanding of content marketing & social media - someone who is digitally savvy, who can create and post engaging content

  • Interest in community engagement - someone who can find and engage new users online and through partner networks

  • Advantage: a creative individual with media skills (image/video editing skills on Adobe Suite or basic editing software like Canva)

  • Great interpersonal and communication skills

  • Ability to meet targets

  • Attention to detail and good written skills


 


What traits would complement our current team?


 



  • Someone who is entrepreneurial and can generate traction even where resources are limited

  • Someone creative who likes developing ideas on their own, but equally likes being part of a team and collaborating to brainstorm on strategy

  • Someone able to manage their own time and be able to work independently

  • Someone with a strong work ethic and a ‘can do’ attitude


 


What’s in it for you?


 



  • Fixed rate for each new guest/booking to be agreed on

  • RoomForTea booking vouchers, redeemable on any room rental on roomfortea.com

  • Flexible working arrangements and ability to work remotely

  • Opportunity to be hired as full-time employee upon completion of internship


 


To apply please send your CV and a brief statement of interest.

items.title: PR and SM Associate
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
*What is Stasher?*
Currently present in 250 cities, Stasher is the world's first sharing economy solution for luggage storage - think of it as the Airbnb for bags. We are a platform that connects shops, hotels and businesses (we call these StashPoints) looking to monetise their excess storage space with travellers seeking to store their bags cheaply and securely. Bring those two together via an intuitive, simple, mobile-optimised web app and you have Stasher.

*As our PR and Social Media Marketing Associate you'll be...*
-Growing and maintaining the Company’s social media channels (Instagram,
Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest)
-Create and manage all publishing content, ensuring content is highly creative, relevant, original and convey our brand message.
-Analyse and monitor campaigns, continuously providing recommendations on how to further to drive brand awareness and engagement.
-Ensuring key trade and consumer press coverage
-Liaising with corporate PR teams of key partners
-Build and maintain relationships with global media outlets and key influencers across multiple channels ensuring that a positive brand image is conveyed at all times
-Manage Stasher’s Bloggers and Influencers program

*The right candidate will...*
- Have an understanding of how the PR ecosystem works, how to draft a press release and pitch to journalists
- Be highly creative and hands-on, eager to get stuck in and juggle multiple projects
- Have demonstrable experience growing a social media following
- Be open to learning new skills - we are happy to allow time for this!

*Nice to have…*
Photoshop and In-design skills, alternatively know how to use Canva

*On offer...*
Here's a list of the main perks & benefits of working at Stasher, aside from the obvious ones involved with working in a fast-growing start-up!
- A competitive base salary
- Flexible WFH/Remote working scheme
- Comfortable equipment budget to kit out your desk
- Free fruit and lots of snacks everyday in our Shoreditch office + Friday breakfast/coffee morning and drinks
- Regular team socials and team summits (when we get together with our remote workers)
- 25 days holiday + 1 day for each year you're with us
- Opportunity for unpaid leave for additional holidays
- Learning budget
- Matched pension contributions with Nest
- Cycle-to-work and Tech-at-work schemes

items.title: Special Projects: Growth and Engagement
items.content:
About Apolitical


Apolitical is the first global peer-to-peer platform for government, helping public servants find the ideas, experts and partners they need to solve the hardest challenges facing our societies. Our network is used in more than 170 countries, including by mayors, ministers and former heads of state.


 


The role


If you like to move at pace on multiple tasks, take projects from design to execution and evaluation, have a flair for messaging and engaging audiences, this role in the area of community engagement/ communications/ online events might be perfect for you. 


As we continue to promote Apolitical to a diverse range of public servants across geography and roles, Apolitical needs to grow and engage certain sub-audiences of public servants more deeply at certain times. This may be because an upcoming offering is especially relevant to them, we have a partnership focussing on a specific sector, or we may be rolling out in new languages.


Apolitical is looking for someone to grow and engage these specific sub-communities. Engagement interventions might look like online events, learning activities, and competitions, amongst other ideas. This is a company critical function that is, for the first time being brought together as one person’s job, allowing the role-holder to individually own this goal while working closely with other teams across the company. 


Prior experience is not necessary but concrete evidence of the desired skills is. This is likely to be a suitable role for someone of up to 3 years experience, but will vary by individual.


 


Your key activities will involve: 



  • (15%) Researching policy challenges (the key issues, organisations, people) to support all your growth and engagement activity like generating ideas, writing messaging, finding speakers and participants, and liaising confidently with high profile public servants, academics, and practitioners.

  • (5%) Design of ‘community’ interventions to achieve the targeted growth and engagement goals.

  • (20%) Writing messaging to communicate the significance of a policy issue in a concise and engaging way, and setting up engaging email communications.

  • (30%) Executing on interventions (eg. like online events, learning experiences, interactive content).

  • (25%) Ringleading the activation of distribution channels across the company to promote an intervention or reach the required audience – like third party distribution partners, social media, and engaging our community.

  • (5%) Tracking and evaluation of your interventions.


 


 


Who we are looking for – 


You have these essential traits which you will further hone in the role: 



  • Creative – You enjoy thinking of new ways to engage identified groups.

  • Strategic – Your ideas match the reality of the resources available to you. You can see how others’ work can support your goals.

  • Organised and attentive executor and project manager – You enjoy zooming in and  executing on multiple projects, as well as zooming out (being strategic). 

  • Excellent communicator – Your communication is persuasive and compelling. You can credibly communicate with seniors. You are great at working with other teams.

  • Data and goal driven – You enjoy assessing the effectiveness of your effort by analysing data. 

  • Passion -You are enthusiastic about i) building and engaging specific audiences through digital methods, and ii) learning about policy and the public service.


 


In addition you will develop skills in: 



  • Using email software, like Hubspot

  • Basic coding

  • Running effective experiments and build a new function in a startup

  • Building online communities

  • Public speaking and moderation (through preparing the speakers and moderators, and possibly, in the future leading online events yourself)

items.content:
Location: Eden Prairie, MN
Description: Our client is currently seeking a Reports Analyst - Eden Prairie or Remote



Top Daily Responsibilities


Analyst will be supporting the Briova Infusion Services area and should have experience working with SQL server, SQL server manager, Tableau, Alteryx, and Excel. A solutioner background and keen development skills will be needed in this role.


Must Have Skills/Attributes

  • Bachelor-s Degree or equivalent degree/experience
  • 1+ years of work experience in business or the healthcare field
  • 1+ years of experience gathering and documenting requirements from the client / business
  • Intermediate level of proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint and Word
  • Intermediate understanding of one or more Business Intelligence software tools (Tableau, Alteryx, SSRS, Micro Strategy, MySQL or SQL)



Nice To Have Skills/Attributes

  • Experience with Tableau and Alteryx
  • Ability to self-direct and problem solve with multiple priorities and when presented with conflicting data
  • Experience with complex data schemas; multi-million row tables; complex queries ETL Tool experience - Informatica, Data Stage, SSIS Familiarity with Agile methodologies Successful time / project management, problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills
  • Have a passion to understand and be part of the business, not just mastering the technology

Contact:

This job and many more are available through The Judge Group. Find us on the web at
- provided by Dice

items.title: City Ambassador / Online Marketer
items.content:
City Ambassador / Online Marketer

Marketing
Anywhere
commission
Company: Tutor For All
Freelance

Overview

Tutor for All is looking for City Ambassadors in top cities throughout the U.S to recruit students in middle and high school for our online tutoring services. This role would be perfect for someone who has a network of people who would be interested in an online tutoring service or someone who knows how to market online. This is also the perfect opportunity for an influencer who has followers who would be interested in our tutoring service.

Ambassadors will connect with schools, parents and students understand their education needs and connect them with our Tutors. In addition Ambassadors will make connections with organizations and communities who need tutoring but can’t pay for them, establishing connections with them and partnerships to provide free tutoring to those in need.

The most important characteristic of a outstanding ambassador is someone who believes in the importance of providing all students with exceptional education and is willing to reach out and connect with people of different socioeconomic statuses to push and recruit people for that mission.

Ambassadors are extroverts with charming personalities able to communicate exceptionally in person, over the phone and via email. We measure our success by how many students sign up for the platform, this is also reflected in ambassador compensation.

You’re Awesome At: Connecting with people Working remotely and independently Written and verbal communication in English Corresponding via email professionally





Responsibility and Duties: Skilled in social media and able to communicate information about our services online effectively (e.g. social media and forums) Generate, share, and reply to online reviews in a positive and open manner Network and gain the trust of potential customers and partners Understand our services; fully inform potential customers Utilize word-of-mouth marketing techniques, such as referral incentive programs Aid in the organizing of marketing events Provide feedback to the marketing regarding customers’ insights and questions








Perfect Candidate: Someone who is currently or has recently, worked with children. Someone who is looking for additional income. Someone who would be able to provide feedback on marketing and operations to better our efforts to teach children. Someone who is already in the field of tutoring and looking to expand their practice. Someone whose a consultant in the education industry.






How to Apply: Email (contact@tutorforall.online) your resume and a brief blurb on what your strategy would be to market our service to your network. If you plan to market this service online as a online marketer, then please confirm who would be your target audience and what platforms/strategies you plan to use.


This insight would help us better understand your strategy and when we plan our interview, we can discuss further. We plan to help you become successful in this role, but we also need you to have a plan.

 



To apply for this job please send your job application to the email below.

Please reference Jobspresso in your application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

contact@tutorforall.online

items.content:
REMOTE JR PRODUCT MANAGER

  •  We have an opening for a JR PRODUCT MANAGER position.
  • Location: Remote  Note: online applications accepted only.
  • Requirement: Strong working knowledge of web production, design and engineering release processes.
 
We are excited to announce the launch of our new pre-recorded video interviewing technology to fast track your career with our award-winning organization! When you submit an hourly job application, you will be invited to participate in a short video introduction. Click here to get a sneak peek preview!

This position is eligible for an Employee Referral Bonus! If you know someone that would be a great fit for this role, you can refer them to this position and potentially earn an Employee Referral Bonus! Click here to view the step-by-step instructions to refer a friend to this position.
 
 
If you have a positive attitude and a love for learning, you may be interested in joining our team.
 
Are you looking for a job with competitive wages and benefits, one in which you can learn and grow while making a difference in the world? We’re hiring! Bon Appétit Management Company operates more than 1,000 cafés around the country for corporations, universities, and museums, as well as a few dozen public restaurants. We’ve led the industry in socially and environmentally responsible sourcing, from sustainable seafood to cage-free eggs. We cook everything from scratch using fresh, local ingredients.
 
Full-time associates at Bon Appétit are eligible for many benefits, including:
 
  • Paid vacation and sick leave
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision
  • 401(k) with matching by company
  • Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)
  • Commuter Benefits
  • Wellness Program
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Life Insurance for Associates and Eligible Dependents
  • Short Term Disability (STD) and Long Term Disability (LTD)
  • Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance
  • On-the-job training
 
Learn more about careers with Bon Appétit: http://www.bamco.com/careers/
Job Summary 
Essential Functions & Responsibilities
  • Manage and execute digital projects based on business goals and requirements, from beginning to end
  • Document and communicate project status to teams on a regular basis to ensure all teams are aware of next steps and project milestones
  • Identify process gaps and increase and formalize efficiencies as needed
  • Work with our digital agency to establish & help maintain schedules, and overall project scopes
  • Manage stakeholder expectations to ensure all teams are aligned on strategy and delivery
  • Update content, make small code adjustments, and handle the day-to-day support of ongoing website updates, requests and maintenance.
  • Identify and implement opportunities based on competitive research and self-service tools
  • Drive the execution of website projects across multiple internal and external teams
  • Manage day-to-day tasks and maintains in-depth involvement to allow for early identification of project risks and constraints
  • Establish and maintain process and project documentation
  • Provide daily/weekly/etc. project status updates to stakeholders
 
Qualifications
  • 4-5+ years proven experience managing project types across multiple teams such as: website redesigns, digital campaigns, experiments, and microsites
  • Well-organized, detail oriented, and resourceful
  • Ability to work under pressure, handle changing priorities and simultaneously handle multiple priorities.
  • Basic understanding of HTML & CSS; JS a bonus
  • Experience with Google Analytics, or a similar analytics tool
  • Experience with CMS (content management systems), WordPress experience ideal.
  • Familiarity with various project management systems, such as Agile and experience with JIRA is ideal 
  • Strong working knowledge of web production, design and engineering release processes, including direct experience with website tools and technology.
  • Exemplary ability to quickly analyze project requests and to determine the technical feasibility, prioritization against other requests, required activities, and the appropriate resources required.
  • Excellent oral/written communication
  • Experience with localization
About Compass Group: Achieving leadership in the foodservice industry
 
Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer.  At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.
Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. Disclaimer: this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity. *Los Angeles applicants: Compass Group will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box ordinance).

Req ID: 314681 
Bon Appetit 
SALARIED EXEMPT 

Nearest Major Market: San Jose
Nearest Secondary Market: Palo Alto
Job Segment: Food Service, Hospitality
