items.title: Technical Product Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Our market leading hospitality API platform provides software and hardware companies with fast and secure access to data from hotels. We're looking for a Technical Product Manager to join our team to lead the development of our data acquisition products. These are tools that are used internally by our integrations and engineering team to acquire the data that powers our API.


As a Technical Product Manager at Impala, you'll:





  • Have responsibility for the further development of existing tools as well as the development of new technologies that make data acquisition easier and quicker.

  • Ensure that the engineers on your team are well prioritised and are working on what's important.

  • Develop our acquisition product suite so that they continue to lead the market in security and speed.

  • Work with our Head of Product and wider product team to establish best practices across teams.

  • Have a major say in the future development of Impala products.


What we're looking for:



  • Great communication skills, you must speak and write clearly.

  • Significant experience managing technical products.

  • An understanding of Robotic Process Automation and common database technologies.

  • A first class intellect.


What would make you stand out:



  • Experience within hospitality or travel technology.

  • An engineering or solutions engineering background.







About Impala



Impala is a team of eleven incredibly talented, helpful and outgoing individuals (plus one more modest individual that wrote this job post) based in London (with a remote engineering team). We’re a diverse team that puts building a great product and being happy at work as our two guiding principles. We're also very well funded by industry leading investors.


What we offer:



  • A competitive salary and equity based on experience.

  • Frequent socials.

  • Flexible working hours.

  • Time dedicated every Friday afternoon for personal projects, lightning talks and team events.

  • A monthly allowance for books and other educational materials.

  • The opportunity to work alongside a tight knit and driven team.


Where we differ is:



  • You'll be working in a company that puts professional development front and centre.

  • We'll listen to you. We're hiring you for your knowledge and experience and we intend to put that to work.

  • We have an incredible culture and community.

items.title: Digital Content Specialist
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Digital Content Specialist at Skillcrush

Remote | International

Full-Time in Worldwide – Remote OK

Skillcrush is on the hunt for a Digital Content Specialist to join our team! This is a full-time, mid-career role for someone with excellent writing skills, experience writing about technology, and the ability to spot trends in audience data and plan content around trending topics.

As the Digital Content Specialist on our marketing team, you’ll spend most of your time pitching, researching, and writing articles for the Skillcrush blog. In addition to these responsibilities, you’ll be creating content for social media, newsletters, webinars, videos, etc. Plus you’ll work with the team to track and help develop site traffic and contribute ideas and content for other marketing campaigns.

The ideal candidate for the Digital Content Specialist role should have experience with both SEO strategy and SEO writing. You also excel at researching strategic article topics and related keywords, conducting research and interviews, and writing and editing copy specifically for the web. You should be a self-starter who can take projects and run with them—but you also know when to ask for help or feedback, and you respect a good edit.

Possessing tech skills (coding, visual design, or UX/UI, for example) is a bonus, as is experience with email marketing.

Responsibilities

  • Own the editorial calendar
  • Research and pitch article ideas in editorial meetings
  • Write, according to Skillcrush voice and tone guidelines, at least three SEO-optimized and/or interview-based feature articles per week—including a mix of longer features and shorter action-oriented roundups
  • Edit and improve articles from our archive to increase search rankings
  • Self-edit posts before submitting to Head of Content Marketing
  • Upload and format content in WordPress, coordinate with team designer on custom graphics, and schedule posts
  • Oversee weekly newsletters, including selecting articles to promote, writing email copy, and planning and conducting AB tests to increase open rates and CTRs
  • Write e-guides, webinar and video scripts, and other non-editorial content, as needed
  • Work with the Head of Content Marketing on content strategy, including pitching ideas for marketing spikes and other quarterly content campaigns
  • Report on and deliver recommendations for improving site traffic, specifically high-quality organic traffic
  • Keep updated on tech news and trends and follow cultural movements and news relevant to our audience

Requirements

  • Background in writing and editing, specifically for the web or other digital platforms
  • Experience with SEO strategy and SEO writing, including working with one or more SEO tools (ahrefs, SEMRush, Moz, etc.)
  • Experience working with a content management system like WordPress, and enough familiarity with HTML and CSS that when article formatting breaks, you’ve got it covered!
  • Experience with email copywriting, copyediting, and general email marketing best practices
  • A live or die by the numbers mentality (You love user interviews, planning content based on traffic numbers and reader engagement, etc., and the thrill of recognizing patterns and trends they can leverage to improve site traffic.)
  • General knowledge of Google Sheets/Excel in order to report on site traffic and manage the editorial calendar
  • Comfort working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment while contributing to a positive and supportive culture
  • Availability to work a flexible range of hours that generally overlaps with standard business hours (9am-5pm) on US Eastern Time
  • Access to a reliable, high-speed Internet connection

Bonuses

  • Tech skills, such as coding, visual design, UX/UI, etc.
  • Experience working with email marketing and platforms, ideally HubSpot
  • Experience working on an Agile or scrum team
  • Experience working remotely with team members in different time zones

Perks and Benefits

  • Flexible, remote work
  • Three weeks of paid vacation
  • Competitive healthcare benefits, including fully covered insurance for you and subsidized insurance for your family
  • Eight weeks of paid leave for new parents, and an additional eight weeks unpaid
  • 401k plan with 4% match and no vesting time
  • Professional development stipend
  • Co-working stipend
  • Free access to all the Skillcrush classes you can eat
  • A fun, passionate team working from all over the world
  • A fast-growing company with lots of opportunities for job growth

Pay Range

  • $60-70k, commensurate with skills and experience

About Skillcrush

Skillcrush is an online tech education company that offers online classes on a variety of technical topics.

At Skillcrush, we have built an open and cooperative environment. We hire who we want to work with, but also love people think differently than us and challenge the status quo. We empower our staff, giving them the support and autonomy they need to succeed. We embrace data to make decisions and overcome obstacles. We do what we do well, but we’re also always looking to do it better.

Skillcrush is an equal opportunity employer and evaluates applicants regardless of their age, race, color, gender, religion, national origin (or current home base), sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, family status, time zone, geography, musical preferences, or college football allegiances. We think a diverse team builds a better product,a better company, and ultimately, a better world!

Although based in New York City, the Skillcrush team is a fully remote company and welcomes job applicants from all over the world.

Apply for job

items.title: Tax Expert Lead
items.content:
Tax Expert Lead at Intuit

Remote

Seasonal, Remote

2019-10729

Locations: USA Remote

Overview

If you’re highly motivated individual with active credentials and excellent communication skills, we need your help in leading a team of tax support agents. Our support agents will be helping customers navigate through the TurboTax experience and assist with technology. We need a leader that the support agents can turn to for assistance and growth. You’ll advance our goal of “doing the nation’s taxes” by providing product guidance and tax support to our agents as they navigate, research and assist customers through the TurboTax experience. You’ll also play an important role in our effort to enhance our brand by creating Turbo Tax “net promoters.”

Check out these videos and find out what it’s like to work as a Tax Advisor for Intuit: http://bitly.com/pY7stu

Responsibilities

JOB CONTENT AND SCOPE

  • Ask a Tax Expert Lead is responsible for Providing live support for our Ask a Tax Expert agents.

TYPICAL DELIVERABLES:

  • Accurate Tax Advice to Seasonal Agents during tax season.
  • Assist ATE Managers with team responsibilities.
  • Accurate Help Desk answers to agent inquiries.
  • Accurate time tracking for hours spent in each functional area.
  • Monitor agents to ensure compliance with IRS and other agency requirements regarding Tax Advice or Audit Support.
  • Flexibility to work overtime hours when required during tax season.
  • Work under pressure of meeting team productivity goals. Successful candidates must be willing to flex to meet team goals.

Qualifications

TEAM / LEADERSHIP SKILLS:

  • Demonstrates a sincere desire for a quality user experience and understands the impact of “Net Promoters”
  • Flexible team player attitude
  • Promotes/fosters a positive work environment
  • Maintains positive working relationships
  • Positive, flexible approach to change
  • Collaborative approach to problem-solving
  • Understands individual impact on team’s success

ANALYTICAL SKILLS:

  • Able to research, analyze and determine an appropriate course of action in a variety of situations
  • Able to research IRS and state publications, regulations, and GAAP publications
  • Excellent numerical, abstract and verbal reasoning skills• Solves moderately complex problems exercising good judgment

KNOWLEDGE / BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE:

  • Must possess one of the following: Active EA Certification or CPA
  • 2+ years management experience
  • Extensive knowledge of tax laws
  • In-depth understanding of tax concepts and processes desired
  • Experience using major tax preparation software; Experience with electronic filing a plus.
  • Experience preparing federal and state returns either individual (1040) or business (1120, 1120S, 1065, 1041)
  • Experience providing support in a technical PC environment a plus

items.title: Business Analyst
items.content:
You’ll be the first hire in our data team, working closely with the Founder and Senior Management to build an amazing data infrastructure, drive commercial projects and inform decision-making throughout the company. 


We need someone who is as passionate about the growth potential of Shift as we are. Since our first investment of £300k, our GMV has increased by 2000% and our business and market fundamentals are as strong as ever. This means you’ll be comfortable adapting to the demands of rapid growth, like changing focus, getting stuck into many big and little tasks at once, and bringing your own ideas to the table.


This role will operate out of the newly formed London office with some travel to our other offices required, particularly in the first few months. 


You’ll do an awesome job if you:



  • Have exemplary Google Sheets & SQL skills; we need the best of the best with both 

  • Can take the lead and work with the team on structured tasks 

  • Are a structured problem solver who could explain anything to anyone

  • Bring a heap of common sense to the table


And if you we see evidence of the below, that’d be nice too:



  • Delivered analytical projects you’re proud of in a high growth/pressure setting

  • Worked in an early stage consumer tech startup

items.title: Animalz: Content Analyst
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Content Analyst

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies—particularly B2B SaaS businesses—grow by making great content that their audience loves.

A subset of the work we do involves helping entrepreneurs and CEOs at rapidly scaling startups and venture capital firms spread their ideas through writing. Our goal is to establish these executives as thought leaders in their field, and that's where you come in.


An ideal Content Analyst at Animalz:

  • has a track record of writing that distills complex problems into simple frameworks clearly and succinctly.
  • is interested in turning the thoughts and ideas of leaders in tech into compelling content
  • has a demonstrated interest in tech/SaaS/startups/business, and wants to learn more
  • is a rigorous researcher and uses books not just articles to understand a topic
  • has the capacity to learn rapidly across topics and industries.
  • has spent time honing their craft
  • is interested in learning about content marketing
About Animalz:

We’re a remote team with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world. We have an eclectic team of scientists, journalists, operations folks, and more.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the Position:

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote position. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to clarify that this is NOT a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional endeavors

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere you like, as long as you have regular overlap with Eastern Time business hours and can schedule overlap with Pacific Time business hours when needed for customer calls.
  • Health insurance for both US and international team members, covering 80% of the premium for health and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Parental leave for both primary (up to 12 weeks) and secondary (up to 6 weeks) care providers
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and attending conferences
What's it like to work at Animalz?

Join us for an hour-long webinar where we discuss careers, growth, and culture at Animalz. We'll make sure to leave time to answer all your questions.

Grab a seat here. We'd love to have you on a call!

items.content:
We are delighted to bring VYBZ App launch in Oxford aimed at students of the University of Oxford and Oxford Brookes. The app is designed to help students integrate with the wider university community. VYBZ has set out to connect the new and existing students in a completely unique and a meaningful way enabling them to discover each other in halls and chosen VYBZ locations (bars, restaurant, clubs etc.) and instantly connect with them in the real world. 


We are looking for an academically well-rounded and driven student who has completed year 1 at the university and has excellent social skills with a wide network of university friends and who is 'in the know' of the local social scene.


You will be required to help us curate VYBZ locations along with devising and implementing our go-to-market strategy.


We are based in London but you will be based in Oxford working off-base from your personal computer.


Requirements:



  • You must be a current student of the University of Oxford having completed year 1

  • Predicted 2:1 or above at degree level (in any discipline)

items.content:
Online Communications Manager at UltraViolet

Remote

Location: (Multiple states)

Department: Campaigns Team

Type: Full Time

Min. Experience: Experienced

UltraViolet is hiring an Online Communications Manager to help us create a real cost for sexism in the U.S.

About UltraViolet:

In 2012, UltraViolet was launched to harness the collective power of millions of people to advance women’s equity through rapid-response digital organizing.

Since then, UltraViolet has been the premier national organization elevating all of the issues that impact women’s lives across identity–from intimate partner and state violence to health care to economic policy–to a national audience. Our goal has been to prove that sexism and rape culture exist by using rapid-response campaigns to expose the impact of the problems on women’s lives, create public accountability, and advocate for solutions.

To do that, over the last seven years, we’ve built and are sustaining a community of 1.2 million committed and engaged activists in every state and congressional district across the country and ignited a new wave of feminist activism.

Moving ahead, UltraViolet will focus on building an intersectional feminist community online by creating compelling stories and offering ways to take action that center the voices and perspectives of women of color, Indigenous women, and LGBTQ people. It is these stories–from our members and our staff–that will drive demand for the kind of changes women need.

If fighting for a world beyond patriarchy, where people of all backgrounds and identities thrive with freedom and dignity, is your passion–UltraViolet is the organization for you!

UltraViolet is an organization run by women, immigrants, people of color, Indigenous women, and LGBTQ people. Sexism disparately impacts us, and we strongly encourage people from these and other impacted communities to apply.

Job Description:

UltraViolet is wrapping up a multi-month strategic planning process that is shifting the direction of the organization from a singular focus on large-scale digital organizing to a more specific focus on culture change work and talking to politically unengaged women, in conjunction with running robust digital campaigns on issues that impact the lives of women.

  • The UltraViolet Online Communications Manager will work with the Senior Online Communications Director to grow the UltraViolet following on social media by curating and creating highly-engaging content through analytics-based experimentation.
  • The Online Communications Manager will be responsible for setting and meeting ambitious growth and engagement goals on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and other social media sites. In addition, the Online Communications Manager will be responsible for helping maintain the UltraViolet website.

These are the required skills for this position:

  • Experience working in intersectional feminist organizing and/or racial justice organizing
  • Proven writing ability in a fast-paced setting (you are excited by the idea of having to explain something complex in a tweet)
  • Graphic design skills and experience with Photoshop, Canva, or similar design tool
  • Experience creating live content, including video
  • Experience using a social media management tool such as Hootsuite, Sprout, Later, ActionSprout, CrowdTangle, TweetDeck, etc.

We’re hoping you’ll bring one or two (or more) of these bonus skills:

  • Comfortable on camera, as well as behind, and/or narrating live events
  • Experience fundraising on social media
  • Experience with paid social media campaigns
  • Experience reaching out to and engaging influencers
  • Basic website skills (HTML or WordPress experience specifically)

You will thrive in this role if you’re someone who:

  • Likes the idea of working remotely, since we are an all-remote organization
  • Is comfortable juggling multiple tasks and can thrive in a fast-paced environment, independently and as part of a team
  • Is an excellent project manager and can manage a project seamlessly from start to finish
  • Is able, willing, and excited to turn on a dime when opportunity knocks

Perks of working for UltraViolet:

  • Full health, dental, and vision for employees and generous coverage for your family
  • Four to six weeks of vacation and 12 paid holidays
  • 401(k) with a 5% employer contribution
  • Sixteen weeks of parental leave, plus support for childcare for work-related events and travel
  • A team with a top-notch GIF game and a #pets slack channel, that gets surprise presents (sometimes purple cakes!), and knows how to have fun while getting a lot done in a low-ego environment

Salary:

The salary range for this position is $60,000 to $70,000, plus a home office stipend based on the cost of living in your location.

UltraViolet is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate against applicants or employees because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, citizenship status, disability status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or gender identity or expression of an otherwise qualified individual, or membership in any other class protected by applicable law. UltraViolet hires and promotes individuals on the basis of their qualifications for the job to be filled. We strongly encourage diverse applicants to apply.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Product Manager
items.content:
Senior Product Manager at Abstract

Remote

US-based remote or SF office

About Abstract
Abstract is a design workflow platform for teams to version, manage, and collaborate on Sketch files. Since launching in July 2017, over 5,000 design teams across 75 countries have adopted Abstract, including teams from Shopify, Cisco, Intuit, Spotify, Salesforce, Instacart, OpenTable, and more.

At Abstract, we are actively working to build a diverse and inclusive organization. Here, diversity includes age, economic class, educational background, ethnic variance, familial status, gender, gender expression, gender identity, marital status, national origin, religious affiliation, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, or veteran status.

Abstract is headquartered in San Francisco but many of our teams and roles are remote-first (US-based only at this time). If you have a passion for rolling up your sleeves, building new programs, and have a strong, team-player mentality, we’d love to hear from you!

About the Role
As a Senior Product Manager at Abstract, you will have a unique opportunity to shape how thousands of companies work together, including our own. You’ll make an impact on our Files Squad by leading product development for new design tool integrations (Adobe XD) and expanding the Abstract platform to support a diverse set of designers and workflows.

What you’ll do:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan, build, and ship high-quality solutions to our customers.
  • Define the Roadmap for your Squad and prioritize projects based on strategic goals and customer impact. Propose objectives and KPIs that focus your team’s efforts and align vision with company goals.
  • Clarify the problem to solve, project goals, decision-making roles, and document expectations from stakeholders and transition into an effective kick-off with the Squad.
  • Generate hypotheses for solving problems and validate the approaches with customers by interviewing, analyzing data, and offering early access to features in development.
  • Partner with Engineering and Design to scope out solutions and plan development milestones. Proactively identify the dependencies, constraints, and risks to the plan and be willing to adapt and guide your team through change based on new information.
  • Identify gaps or ambiguous workflows and frame them as opportunities for process improvements that make the broader Product organization more efficient. Drive progress pragmatically and create bridges for people to get from here to there without disruptions.
  • Partner with Marketing, Sales, and Support to identify product opportunities, craft impactful narratives, and bring products to market effectively.
  • Continually evaluate whether or not our shipped solutions have solved the problem through quantitative and qualitative analysis. Summarize the results using approachable language and a framework for evaluating success.

What you’ll bring:

  • You have a growth mindset. You realize you don’t have all the answers and enjoy pushing through moments of uncertainty on the path to discovery.
  • You are an active, empathetic listener. You seek to understand the problems people face, how they feel, and the goals they want to achieve.
  • You can synthesize a myriad of possibilities, considerations, and questions into a series of productive decisions-to-be-made and facilitate answering them collaboratively.
  • You are an excellent written and oral communicator that strives for clarity.
  • You are fulfilled by mentoring your teammates and encouraging them to work together deliberately, especially in moments of ambiguity or tension.
  • You define what success looks like and prioritize solutions based on customer impact.
  • You have significant experience with design systems and tools like Sketch and Adobe XD. You can describe how design workflows weave through the ecosystem today and are excited to collaborate and shape what’s on the horizon.
  • You conduct user research and design experiments to discover opportunities, explore solutions, and make the best decisions for the customer experience.
  • You have experience developing software in a complex web/native application environment and have experience integrating systems and tools.
  • You learn new concepts quickly and can switch between creative and analytical thinking.
  • You have experience working within a variety of product development methodologies (Agile, SCRUM, Lean, etc.), environments, and industries.

Benefits
At Abstract, we offer resources that emphasize personal and familial wellbeing. We provide 99% healthcare coverage, including dental, vision, and life insurance. We offer 10 weeks parental leave, unlimited paid-time off, and flexible working arrangements. Additional perks include dependent care and health care FSA as well as commuter benefits for SF office employees.

To help employees plan for the future, we’re able to offer competitive pay and a 401k.

We are a distributed team and we are able to offer US-based remote employment for most roles. We offer travel opportunities for company meetings, team meet-ups, and the occasional conference.

Notes
Though we’re a distributed team, we’re currently only able to hire US-based candidates.

As part of our security protocols, offers are contingent on successful completion of a background check.

Apply for job

items.title: Customer Growth Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Location


Based in London but scope for travelling across the UK and Europe. Adventure awaits.


Purpose


We want to give people the freedom to access the world’s best work spaces, anywhere, any time, at the touch of a button. 


We’re looking for a positive, energetic, natural sales-person (that ideally has a bit of experience in HR) to grow our community of freelancers, startups, and small teams customers. 


Employment Type


Full-time


People


Desana gives people access to a network of great work space when they want it, where they want it, through a single monthly subscription.


We’re a growing startup based between London, Edinburgh, and Stockholm. We aim to become a globally relevant company by disrupting the way people think about, and access, the places they work. We're looking for the best people to join us on our journey.


With prior experience in startups ourselves, we’re keen to do things the right way from the very start. That’s why we believe in openness and transparency in everything we do, from salary to communications, to processes.


Why Join Us?


We’re about to push workspace transformation another notch in an industry that is already undergoing tremendous change and significant growth. Join us to not only grow the network of customers that are already changing the ways they work, but by living and breathing that transformation as you work flexibly, autonomously, and (as much as the job demands) remotely yourself. We pride ourselves in radical open-ness and strive to create a company that fulfills its users, partners, and employees. Always.


The Role


We’re passionate about building the best possible customer on-boarding experience and relationships for the long-term. We’re not passionate about incessant cold-calls and unrealistic sales targets.


Sales



  • Defining, establishing, growing, and optimising effective consumer considerate B2B and B2C sales channels. 

  • Identifying and building relationships with leads within each channel.

  • Successfully onboarding customers to our platform, taking time to manually support their needs as necessary. 

  • Recognising differences in customer needs, building and implementing effective systems to support consumer groups. Continuously optimising these systems.

  • Working with the team to prepare marketing materials that will help you to successfully onboard customers. 

  • Spend time identifying potential partnership opportunities through which customers can be reached. Nurturing those opportunity relationships for long-term mutual benefit.

  • Presenting engaging and informative sales updates / strategies to the rest of the team. 

  • Attending national and international industry events to better understand our industry and to meet prospective customers.

  • Creating and delivering result orientated “sprints” (short, task defined projects) that are aligned with the company’s 6 and 12 month goals.


Communication



  • Working directly with space relationship managers (and the rest of the team) to incessantly improve customer experience. 

  • Regular monitoring and updating of our task management system.

  • Participate in the daily whole team “stand up” call, wherever you are.


Industry Awareness 



  • Consistently develop wider awareness of customer segment needs; meticulous attention to specific needs of customers. 

  • Staying on top of industry news and trends; be able to identify and respond to micro-indicators of change.


Relationship Management



  • Managing and nurturing relationships with stakeholders, customer groups, and individuals. 

  • Encourage everyone to get the best out of the platform (and help them), so that we can develop the best possible customer experience. 


About You



  • You have demonstrable sales experience: preferably in building face-to-face, long-lasting relationships with different customer segment groups. You should be able to demonstrate that you’ve applied effective on-boarding systems to previous sales roles and that you understand where there may be scope for optimisation.

  • You have had exposure to HR roles: not vital but we're looking for someone that can relate to the challenges teams face, particularly from a remote working / staff retention perspective. If you have HR experience please tell us about it.

  • You have CRM experience: we use Hubspot, but anything else is fine too.

  • You’re personable: a fun, enthusiastic people-person that finds joy in connecting with and learning from others.

  • You can communicate diligently: you understand the importance of maintaining regular communication with our customers and those that you are working to onboard, while never being too pushy.

  • You’re never complacent: you strive to recognise that things can always be better than they currently are and have the confidence to present solutions to any weaknesses or inefficiencies that you see.

  • You’re driven: you should be self-starting and enjoy having autonomy (with accountability to the rest of the team), able to manage your own time and effectively plan your day to day activities and consistently maintain customer interactions in our CRM database.

  • You have a growth mindset: a desire to grow both personally and professionally.


Desana benefits



  • Share options in the business.

  • Flexible and remote work hours with a strong focus on work-life balance.

  • We’re establishing complete salary transparency across the company with clear progression paths.

  • Team drinks, events and trips.

  • Free access to the app and our network of workspaces.


Think you’re the right person for the role? Apply now.

items.content:
Intro:


Interested in working with an exciting young tech-startup that uses Machine Learning to create a high quality marketplace community…to become the Amazon of peer-to-peer? vendi is an AI-assisted marketplace to buy and sell verified products, starting with phones. We use AI to list and we verify the phone in seconds. This is an awesome opportunity to work with a young and dynamic team and get a good foothold in a fast expanding startup company. You will have a possibility to grow within the team, playing a crucial role in taking the company to the next level. Perfect for anyone who is interested in the tech industry and even more of a plus if you have an interest in AI and Machine Learning.

About the role:


We are looking for an enthusiastic social media manager that is capable of building a stronger brand presence in the main platforms like Facebook and Instagram…in our office in central London. We will also offer the opportunity to work remotely. This internship is a unique opportunity to gain insights into a new venture during the early stages of growth. We need someone who learns fast, is self-motivated, proactive and multi-disciplined.


 


Your Skills:


You have a strong knowledge using main social media platforms and understand the language used there:



  • You are reliable, organised, and pay attention to detail;

  • You are driven and have a “hands-on” mentality;

  • You feel comfortable handling different and multiple tasks on a daily basis; Growth hacking, marketing, and sales oriented knowledge is a plus.

items.title: Digital Strategist
items.content:
Digital Strategist at Firefly Partners

Remote

Client Services

This is a full-time, remote position. We will only review applications from qualified candidates located in and eligible to work in the United States.

Firefly is looking for a passionate, engaging Digital Strategist to join our growing team.

What We’re Seeking

If you’re skilled at working with clients to understand their digital goals, opportunities, and challenges and developing results-focused digital marketing strategies to meet those identified needs, then we want to hear from you! You must enjoy working collaboratively with clients and team members, but also be detail-oriented when it comes to managing associated budgets, timelines, and scopes of work. And in an ever-changing digital landscape, you must bring a passion for staying up-to-date on digital marketing and nonprofit technology trends.

In this role, we expect you to bring the following qualities:

  • Staying apprised of and analyzing digital marketing trends and technologies
  • Developing and executing results-focused digital marketing strategies for clients
  • Developing and maintaining long-term client relationships
  • Managing budgets, scopes, and timelines as needed

Some of What You’ll Do

  • Facilitate discovery sessions with clients to identify their digital needs, goals, opportunities, and challenges. Help cross-functional teams develop solutions that are true to the organization’s brand, goals, and supporter needs.
  • Develop, execute, and monitor strategic plans and multi-channel marketing campaigns. Align client and Firefly resources, as needed, to meet established digital goals.
  • Establish processes for measuring and evaluating the success of individual campaigns as well as strategic plans. Evaluate the results of campaigns and appropriately present results and recommendations to clients.
  • Act as Project Manager for a set of client projects or support engagements. Manage budget, timeline, scope, and deliverables for those engagements. Manage changes to client budgets, timelines, and scopes using established Firefly processes and with a focus on client satisfaction.
  • Build strong, collaborative relationships with clients and maintain those relationships over time. Adapt communication styles and methods to build trust among clients and partners.
  • Collaborate with project managers, designers, developers, production specialists, and other subject matter experts to produce deliverables that are of the highest quality.
  • Proactively recognize and assess client and team needs and prepare potential solutions to meet those needs. Where necessary, lead on the documentation and implementation of solutions.
  • Empower clients to think strategically, developing results-oriented project plans to achieve their goals in the areas of website design and development, communication, fundraising, events, and other areas of digital marketing.
  • Stay abreast of digital marketing trends and technologies that affect nonprofits. Ensure that the knowledge and any appropriate actions are regularly shared with other team members. Apply relevant knowledge to current and potential client engagements.

The Experience You’ll Bring

  • A minimum of two years of digital marketing program or project management experience, preferably at an agency or large nonprofit
  • Three to five years’ experience working with or for nonprofit organizations
  • Demonstrated ability to establish plans and oversee the execution of these plans within a cross functional team
  • Demonstrated ability to track and manage multiple priorities simultaneously
  • Demonstrated experience working in nonprofit marketing tools, open source CMS platforms, or nonprofit database tools
  • Be well versed in the following digital strategy elements: email marketing, website and performance analytics, digital ads, social media and user experience.

Bonus points for:

  • Experience with developing and executing cause-based fundraising campaigns.
  • Experience doing ad buys (digital, TV, radio, etc.)

About Firefly

Firefly Partners is a women-owned digital marketing agency delivering tailored digital solutions that help progressive nonprofits achieve their goals. We design beautiful websites, integrate platforms, and leverage digital tools and marketing strategies to engage every organization’s unique set of supporters. Our commitment to social good is matched by an open, collaborative, and client-first approach. We define needs, design solutions, and deliver results that help organizations reach their goals.

What We Offer:

The starting salary for this position is mid-$60k depending on experience. Firefly offers a competitive benefits package including:

  • Paid time off including 3 weeks of vacation and 2 weeks of sick time annually (pro-rated based on start date)
  • PPO and HSA healthcare plans with dental and vision options
  • Generous company contribution to healthcare premiums
  • Employer-paid long-term disability, short-term disability, and life insurance policies
  • Ability to participate in company 401(k) plan
  • 10 company holidays annually
  • Complete office setup to do your best work from your home office, including a stipend to cover internet costs
  • Continuing education and training opportunities
Apply for job

items.title: SAP Subject Matter Expert (SME) MM/PP - Remote
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Subject Matter Expert, SAP, Configuration, MM, PP

We are an international manufacturing firm with a United States presence in the Pittsburgh area. Late last year we made a decision to move to SAP. So, we are in need of strong SAP MM/PP specialist to join our team This role is a real "hands on" Subject Matter Expert role So, if you are a SAP pro with strong MM/PP experience and are looking to join an exciting growing international company, this is the one. If you don't currently live in Pittsburgh , but will work remotely and travel when necessary that will work to.

What You Will Be Doing

- The Subject Matter Expert (SME) is the solution expert of SAP Materials Management and Production Planning (MM/PP) modules
- SME is considered as the go-to person when detailed setup or solution design questions are to be addressed on the MM and PP modules in the SAP functional area
- Creation of the Functional Design Documentation (FDD) including: Detailed solution design; Test scenarios; scripts to validate the solution
- Within the Operational Support process SME is considered as 3rd level support,
- Act as liaison with the live businesses to: proactively engage with solution proposals; keep up networking within the respective functional area/module; ensure leveraging best practices,
- Tightly collaborates with the Global Solution Architects to: ensure global template consistency, solution fits across business areas,
- Supports multiple projects and BAU activities,
- Reviews and supports testing of the developer code in conjunction with developers and liaises and resolves faults identified with the Data Migration
- Supports Integration and Testing teams in the scope of testing cycles

What You Need for this Position

- 5+ years plus working experience with SAP or variant in a hands on project environment,
- Experience in enterprise-level SAP projects using waterfall methodology throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success,
- Expert level understanding of the SAP product suite,
- Extensive experience with SAP configuration, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls,
- Experience defining business requirements, writing functional design documentation,
- Experience in documenting current state business processes and wireframing system designs using process flow diagram tools, UML, sequence diagrams as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs in accordance with the agreed ERP Design principles
- Expert level experience defining the system architecture landscape,
- Experience in designing SAP software components,
- Experience integrating SAP with different business systems, as well as working with integration tools,
- Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies,
- Full lifecycle ERP experience in an ERP manufacturing (multinational) environment,
- College or University (IT /Business) Degree,
- Expert in depth understanding of business functions and SAP - specific knowledge of MM/PP
- Expert SAP technical knowledge,
- Expert Integration understanding,
- Strong spoken and written English,
- Travelling willingness 50% within USIf you are looking for a SAP MM/PP specialist , a real subject matter expert and are looking to work for a great company, this is it. Please send me your resume directly to

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

items.title: Web and Social Media Consultant
items.content:
Web and Social Media Consultant at United Nations Development Programme - UNDP

Remote | Freelance | International

Location: Home based

Type of Contract: Individual Contract

Post Level: International Consultant

Languages Required: English

Duration of Initial Contract: 12 months

Expected Duration of Assignment: 12 months

Background

The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) is the UN’s global development network, advocating for change and connecting countries to knowledge, experience and resources to help people build a better life. We are on the ground in 177 countries and territories, working with them on their own solutions to global and national development challenges. At UNDP, external and internal communication—nationally, regionally and globally—is critical to achieving both development results and business objectives. Skillful communication broadens the impacts of new policies, helps governance reforms take root, and attracts and fosters strong partnerships.

The Communication Unit at UNDP Geneva is seeking a consultant to assist in maintaining UNDP Geneva website and Twitter account

Duties and Responsibilities

Scope of Work

Under the supervision of the Communication specialist, the candidate will:

  • Provide assistance in curating stories, images, and videos in UNDP global site and in updating UNDP Geneva web content management system.
  • Research quality pictures in UNDP database.
  • Create pages and upload content in UNDP Geneva content Management System and UNDP global website.
  • Review available content from web stories published on UNDP global and other UNDP websites as well as from partners and schedule tweets for UNDP Geneva Twitter account ensuring consistency across languages, timeliness and accuracy.
  • Leverage social media pack created by UNDP colleagues and partners to generate content on UNDP Geneva Twitter account
  • Craft specific content for UNDP Geneva Twitter account based on speech or panel conversations (content provided by UNDP Geneva colleagues)
  • Develop blogs and donors related stories for UNDP Geneva website

Competencies

Core Values

  • Demonstrates integrity and fairness by modeling UN values and ethical standards;
  • Demonstrates professional competence and is conscientious and efficient in meeting commitments, observing deadlines and achieving results;
  • Displays cultural, gender, religion, race, nationality and age sensitivity and adaptability;

Competencies

  • Analytical Skills: Excellent ability to articulate, conceptualize or solve complex problems by making decisions that are sensible given the available information
  • Written communication: Excellent written communication skills, including the ability to write in a clear, simple, concise way for non-technical external audiences
  • Knowledge Management: Ability to efficiently research, analyze and share information and knowledge
  • Organizational skills: Ability for problem-solving, multi-tasking, meeting deadlines and working under pressure
  • Teamwork: Ability to engage with other units/teams and forge productive working relationships Ability to work as part of a team in a constantly evolving work environment

Required Skills and Experience

Required Skills and Experience

Experience

  • At least four years of relevant experience (online communication, social media).
  • Experience with formatting and updating content on CQ5, UNDP content management system (CMS);
  • Experience with editing and developing English material for the web;
  • Experience with drafting content for Twitter;
  • Professional experience within the United Nations System.

Academic Qualifications:

  • Master’s Degree or equivalent Advanced Degree in communications, international affairs or a related area.

Language Requirements

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English

Scope of Price Proposal and Schedule of Payments

UNDP applies a fair and transparent selection process that would take into account both the technical qualification of Individual Consultants as well as their financial proposals. The contract will be awarded to the candidate whose offer:

  1. Is deemed technically responsive / compliant / acceptable (only technically responsive applications with a minimum of 49 points will be considered shortlisted for the financial evaluation)

And has obtained the highest combined technical and financial scores.

  • Technical Criteria – 70% of total evaluation – max. 70 points
  • Criteria A: Theoretical and practical familiarity with curating information and producing online content for website and social media for a large development organization – max points: 50
  • Criteria B: Written assignment– max points: 20
  • Financial Criteria – 30% of total evaluation – max. 30 points. Only shortlisted candidates (with a minimum of 49 points of technical score will be considered)

UNDP is committed to achieving workforce diversity in terms of gender, nationality and culture. Individuals from minority groups, indigenous groups and persons with disabilities are equally encouraged to apply. All applications will be treated with the strictest confidence.

UNDP does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, and discrimination. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

Apply for job

items.content:
We're looking for an entrepreneurial self-starter to help launch a new App that bridges the gap between startups and their investors. Although the company is still in stealth-mode, the product has already been designed and built, and we've even identified our first pilots. 


We're now looking to hire someone on a freelance basis to get involved in the day-to-day operations of rolling it out, with a focus on engaging our user community and driving user growth.


You'll likely be a recent graduate, or even still a student, that's looking to put their passion for making things happen, into action. Self-organising and with meticulous attention to detail, you'll be great at keeping track of what needs doing, and making sure it gets done.


Written and verbal communication skills are also important; you will ideally have some experience writing compelling presentation decks and maintain the confidence to present them to others.


You don't need any specific domain knowledge or expertise, although some exposure to the startup ecosystem including founders and investors would definitely be helpful.


Day-to-day the role encompasses a mix of content marketing, community management, partnership development, digital advertising and general startup operations.


The role is primarily remote, though you will need to attend meetings with the founder in central London throughout the week (if you're a student we can be cognisant of your schedule).


When applying, please be sure to provide the following:



  • Up-to-date CV/Resume

  • LinkedIn profile

  • Short cover letter summarising your relevant experience and/or interests.

items.title: Senior SEO Specialist / Manager
items.content:
Senior SEO Specialist / Manager

United States, Arizona
Company: Landmark Recovery

Overview

Role: Senior SEO Specialist / Manager Salary: Very Competitive (Tied to experience and results) Landmark Recovery operates substance abuse treatment centers across the United States. We exist to assist each patient in the development of a lifestyle that is permanently free from all mind and mood altering substances and that promotes the patient’s well-being across mind, body, and spirit. We are passionate, authentic, courageous, and uncompromising in our pursuit of excellence, and our vision is to restore hope, tranquility and function to 1 Million families in the next 100 years. The parent company has operated senior living and apartment facilities in three states for 30 years. With a history of promotion from within, Landmark offers successful candidates the opportunity to advance with the company in the future. We are looking for a Senior SEO/SEM specialist / manager to manage search engine optimization and marketing activities for our growing chemical dependency business. Additional responsibilities will provide oversight and expertise for Senior Living. Must be results oriented, have a passion for your craft and work extremely well under pressure. You will be responsible for managing SEO activities such as content strategy, link building and keyword strategy to increase rankings on all major search networks. You will also manage all SEM campaigns on Google in order to maximize ROI. We will also want you cross-trained on various other Digital Marketing Activities. Responsibilities:● Use of Research & Analytic Tools to assist with our Research for SEO and PPC Campaigns● Content Strategy Build Outs for SEO and PPC● Technical SEO Knowledge and Implementation (Important to know how to tag content properly)● Optimizations of Content Copy and Landing Pages for SEO and SEM● Perform Ongoing Keyword Discovery and Case Studies● Research and implement new search engine optimization techniques● Development and implementation of link building strategies● Ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented ● Work with other members of the marketing team to drive SEO in content creation and content programming● Recommend changes to website architecture, content, linking and other factors to improve SEO positions for target keywords.● Might have to work on Content & Creative Copy for Campaigns outside of SEO and PPC Requirements● Proven SEO experience● Basic knowledge and Understanding of PPC Campaigns● Understanding of performance marketing, conversion, and online customer acquisition● Experience with website analytics tools- Google Analytics as an example● Experience with Programs like Semrush, Ahrefs, BrightLocal, and other similar software● Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments● Knowledge of ranking factors and search engine algorithms● Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO and SEM

items.title: Senior Social Media Manager
items.content:
Senior Social Media Manager

Marketing
Anywhere in US
Company: GitHub
Full Time

Overview

This role is part strategist part community guru. As a hybrid social media strategist and manager you will lead the strategic development and growth of GitHub’s main corporate social channels. This role isn’t just sharing a message but actively thinking about how to better help connect developers with all that’s happening in the community and at GitHub. Given that, this person needs to have a deep understanding and first-hand experience with social media strategy, analysis, channel management, and community management as well as knowledge about the software development industry, GitHub, and the open source community.

This person will be part of the corporate communications team but will work in one of the most cross-functional roles at the company, with teams including corporate marketing, growth, product marketing, product, engineering, support, and the broader communications organization. The work is highly visible, so will require experience working with executives and senior leadership, excellent communication skills, high levels of empathy, and expert abilities in collaborating and being nimble.

Requirements: 
  • Develop a top-level, cross channel strategy for social media at GitHub that supports the company mission and goals—and implementing that uniquely across Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram*
  • Curate daily editorial content and pitch social activations*
  • Provide strategic insight on cross-functional campaigns
  • Develop social strategies into integrated marketing campaigns*
  • Develop and implement programming that helps grow and strengthen our community of followers
  • Manage paid and organic social media promotions around our major events, GitHub Universe and GitHub Satellite*
  • Create and drive live event social strategies*
  • Regularly report on social performance to executive stakeholders*
  • Engage developers, customers, and the open source community in ways that add value to their communities and conversations*
  • Be an advocate for the developer community
  • Regularly track, monitor, and optimize performance of campaigns and accounts

    • Minimum Qualifications: 
    • 8-10 years experience managing social media channels and working on creative and innovative social media campaigns for a high-profile brand or brands*
    • A love for both building the plan and then bringing that plan to life
    • Ability to see top down and bottom up—can move seamlessly between high-level, strategic thinking and more nuanced, tactical lenses*
    • Expert cross-functional and collaborative work style*
    • Proven track record of running successful social media campaigns for large companies that drive impact on key business goals
    • Demonstrated ability to deliver results in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment*
    • Exceptional interpersonal skills

      • Who We Are:

      GitHub is the developer company. Over 36 million people use GitHub to build amazing things together across 100 million repositories. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, to create the world’s most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together—as individuals and in teams—to create the future of software and make a difference in the world.

      Leadership Principles:

      Customer Obsessed

      Trust by Default

      Ship to Learn

      Own the Outcome

      Growth Mindset

      Global Product, Global Team

      Anything is Possible

      Practice Kindness

      Why You Should Join:

      At GitHub, we constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We’ve designed one of the coolest workspaces in San Francisco (HQ), where over half of our Hubbers work, snack, and create daily. The other half of our Hubbers work remotely in 18 countries across the globe. 

      Here is a complete list of where we can hire!

      We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We’ve designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we’ve built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.

      GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don’t discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there’s any way we can make the interview process better for you; we’re happy to accommodate!

      Where We Can Hire

      Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to ask your Talent Partner. 
      Apply for job

items.title: Product Marketing Manager
items.content:
Product Marketing Manager

Marketing
US or Canada
Company: Auth0
Full Time

Overview

Auth0’s mission is to help developers innovate faster. Every company is becoming a software company and developers are at the center of this shift. They need better tools and building blocks so they can stay focused on innovating. One of these building blocks is identity: authentication and authorization. That’s what we do. Our platform handles 2.5B logins per month for thousands of customers around the world. From indie makers to Fortune 500 companies, we can handle any use case. We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer.

We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work.  is critical to us, and we are transparent about our .

Culturevision and principles

Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer!

We are recruiting a Product Marketing Manager who will  “own” and lead the GTM strategy and execution for their respective product domains. This is an exciting role at an exciting time where we are looking to scale the business and continue in our direction as industry disruptors. In this role, you will have the opportunity to impact the GTM motion with Product Management for new customer acquisition, enable sales with field enablement and drive pipeline growth by partnering with various teams within Marketing. If you enjoy wearing the “strategic hat” but also have a “get s*** done” attitude, then this role is for you! This role can be located anywhere in the US and you will report to the Director of Product Marketing.

Responsibilities:
  • : Build and execute the GTM strategy, lead product launches, set competitive positioning, manage “day-to-day” marketing support  for your respective product domains; in a nutshell, “own” or “champion” your product domains in collaboration with the Product Management team.
    • GTM
  • : Communicate the value proposition of your product including how they compare to competitive offerings, to the sales and field teams and develop the sales tools that support the selling process, including sales training and product demos.
    • Sales Enablement
  • Collaborate with Corporate Marketing and support activities related to analyst relations that would include positioning Auth0 in various strategic surveys, interviews, and tradeshows.
    • Analyst relations:
  • Understand the buyer and the end-user. Build buyer personas and needs; be the expert on your buyers, how they buy and their buying criteria; be the expert on your end-users and how they use your product; act as “the voice of the customer” across all functions (i.e., product management, sales, marketing).
    • Persona research: 
  • Create thought leadership content pieces by researching relevant topics for particular personas, topics from the identity world, and geopolitical/technology topics related to the same, where relevant.
    • Thought Leadership:
  • Strive to continuously deliver industry, market and product insights to support product roadmap/positioning, campaign development and other relevant areas, and company growth.
    • Insights & Research: 

    Qualifications:
    • 3+ years of Product Marketing or Solutions Marketing experience.
    • SaaS or Enterprise software experience is a must; proven track record marketing to a technical audience.
    • Able to collaborate effectively with a diverse, remote team in ambiguous situations.
    • Prior Identity and Access Management (IAM) experience is a plus.
    • Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
    • Strong focus towards metrics and measuring success.
    • Strong attention to detail and ability to juggle several projects at the same time.
    • Must be able to take initiative, follow-up and drive cross-departmental actions in order to meet challenging deadlines.
    • Bachelors in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field is preferred.

      • Preferred Locations:
      • Remote, US & Canada only; #CA; #US

items.title: All Make Believe LLC: Product Designer (Apps & Web)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=10, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=4, java=3, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Product Designer (Apps & Web)

All Make Believe (www.allmakebelieve.com) is a boutique digital design and development studio based in New York City, and with team members around the world. 

We specialize in creating exceptional mobile and web experiences with an emphasis on usability, functionality and beautiful design.
 
We’re a small team of passionate designers, developers and product people with boundless ambition and a genuine love for our work. Whether we’re partnering with a startup to help turn a seedling of an idea into a thriving digital business, or collaborating with an established brand to serve as an extension of their in-house team for a specific engagement, we approach each project with a steadfast commitment to quality and precision. Current and former clients include companies like: Vimeo, Skillshare, Forks Over Knives and Firstmark Capital.
 
As product designer for the company, you’ll work alongside our team to help design and manage our expanding portfolio of digital projects. 

Requirements:
  • A minimum of 3+ years of experience in a design role, designing across both web and mobile (Android and iOS).
  • Experience both wireframing and designing in Sketch with an ability to communicate ideas visually.
  • An ability to problem-solve, anticipate challenges, and propose better ways of building products.
  • A self starter with excellent organizational skills and the ability to ruthlessly prioritize the highest impact work.
  • A track record of solving complex problems on tight time frames.
  • Experience translating designs to product requirements and working with the development team to successfully implement the designs (familiarity with project management software like JIRA or Pivotal Tracker a plus)
  • Experience working in agile product development
  • Strong user experience intuitions, including an ability to discern great UX and empathize with users
  • Excellent communication skills and comfortable taking the lead with clients, stakeholders, and remote teams
  • A history of taking initiative, self-management, and solving problems without explicit direction
  • A true team-player attitude and a willingness to roll up your sleeves to achieve the best results
  • Prior experience working in a small startup environment or on product development teams for tech companies

Responsibilities:
  • Lead product initiatives, project planning, and occasionally client management
  • Partner with engineering and design teams to deliver excellent products on tight timelines
  • Work with QA and development teams to ensure designs implemented according to your vision, and rigorously tested
  • Dive into product metrics, conduct analysis on user behaviors and trends, and translate findings into actionable product enhancements.  
  • Draft product requirements and specs, and transfer these into JIRA or similar tools
  • Join regular standups and team meetings to ensure company objectives are being met
  • Work in sync with customer success teams to prioritize UX issues and adjust designs accordingly.
  • Participate in product strategy and tactical planning conversations

Nice to haves:
  • Hands-on experience designing your own products or side projects
  • Prior experience working with subscription-based services
  • Prior experience working with remote teams
  • Prior experience working with Mixpanel or Amplitude

Perks:
  • Flexible working hours. The position can be remote, and (within reason) can fit around your schedule
  • Enjoyable, rewarding work. You will be working on multiple projects across a variety of platforms (everything from SAAS websites, to iOS, Android, Android TV, TVOS apps)
  • Working with a group of talented, passionate, and motivated team members across all disciplines
  • The ability to directly influence the success of projects and lead the direction of products
To apply for this role, please submit a cover letter explaining why you believe you would be a good fit for the position, along with your resume to careers@allmakebelieve.com
